Job Title: Intern: Risk Analytics, Project & Reporting  (4 month contract))
Job Summary:
The opportunity

Are you passionate about the future of Big Data in Finance?  If yes, we are the team for you. We work with a billion numbers a day which support the effective monitoring of the risk for the fund.
Finance is a diverse team of professionals with multifaceted backgrounds (CA, CFA, MBA, MMF). On the leading edge of the investments industry, we are continually presented with new opportunities and challenges. We provide accounting and operational services, as well as middle office analysis including performance measurement and risk modelling.

As a Risk Analytics Intern, you will be exposed to the risk measurement process from data inputs to risk analysis, which facilitate the daily monitor of risk exposure of the OTPP investment book. In this role, you will gain knowledge in understanding drivers of market risk changes, investment product pricing model, improve skills in Bloomberg, SQL and VBA coding, and apply math/computer science/business knowledge in a hands-on environment.

Who you'll work with
The Risk Analytics team is a fast paced and robust team that is responsible for producing risk reports in a timely and accurate manner to facilitate investment decision making. The Risk analytics team supports the monitoring and reporting of the fund's overall market, credit and liquidity risk exposure as well as support daily production data initiatives related to all input data and metrics.
As a Risk Analytics Intern, you will work in the Toronto office reporting to a Financial Analyst/Senior Financial Analyst and within a team of 10+ professionals. You will get the chance to collaborate closely with multiple partners, including Strategy and Risk, Data Management, Model Vetting Group, Financial Operations and IT support team.
Job Responsibilities:
What you'll do

On the Project & Reporting side, you will play a meaningful role in downstream risk reporting and analysis.
Gain exposure to various investment products and understand different product attributes, identify potential risk reporting issue by performing trade/data checks
Propose and implement enhancement to operational processes that govern Risk Analytics Project & Reporting team
You will be performing analysis of risk factor's impact on product/portfolio/counterparty risk changes
Get to learn about risk calculation, valuation of various investment products and analysing driving risk factors of those products.
Engage in "what-if" simulation process or risk impact analysis
Required Skills:
What you'll need

Strong quantitative background in Mathematics, Statistics or Computer Science, along with an interest in Finance, Risk or Financial Engineering.
An investment/risk management concentration is an asset
3rd/ 4th year students with previous intern experience in financial industry preferred
Advanced knowledge of Excel, VBA
SQL knowledge  preferred
Interest in working in a fast paced environment preferred.
Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Accounting and Financial Auditing
				
			
				- Theme - Business Administration
				
			
				- Theme - Finance and Investment 
				
			
				- Theme - Insurance and Risk Management 
				
			
				ARTS/MATH - Finance
				
			
				MATH - Business
				
			
				MATH - Computer Science
				
			
				MATH - Computing and Financial Management
				
			
				MATH - Statistics and Actuarial Science

Job Title: Intern: Responsible Investing, Risk (4 or 8 month contract)
Job Summary:
The opportunity
The Responsible Investing Team leads the development of Ontario Teachers' responsible investing strategy and supports the integration of environmental, social and governance (ESG) factors in the Plan's investment processes. This includes partnering with investment teams to identify ESG risks and opportunities throughout the investment lifecycle in private and public equity investments, and conducting qualitative and quantitative research and analysis on ESG topics.
 
Who you'll work with
You will be part of a five-person team and have the opportunity to also work with colleagues across other investment departments. You will report to the Principal, Responsible Investing and will work out of the Toronto office.
Job Responsibilities:
What you'll do
As an Intern in Responsible Investing, you will get exposure to all facets of ESG considerations in investment. Day to day you will be asked to tackle a wide range of tasks and responsibilities:


Benchmark and identify best practices in sustainability in both public and private companies
Support ESG due diligence for private equity deals
Provide research and analytics to support the corporate engagement strategy
Conduct research on various ESG topics including, but not limited to, climate change and energy transition, plastics, water use/risk, human capital management and sustainable development goals
Support ongoing risk monitoring activities for our public and private equity portfolios

Job Summary:
The Opportunity
Do you want to get exposure to asset management and cutting edge analytics while working with financial data and implementing business logic using SQL?


We are always investigating new topics such as machine learning and big data analytics, with a view on how they can be practically applied within a pension plan.
You will supply financial data and help develop analytic tools used by researchers to address practical topics for managing the total fund portfolio
You will learn about asset classes and their risk and return characteristics
You will work with modern web-based technologies and architectures

Who you'll work with

Working in a team with 5 other quants and/or software developers
The work is project based, with projects ranging from half a day to the full term
Reporting to Director of Research & Analytics in the Strategy & Risk department
Immediate clients are the researchers using the tools and data you develop
Work location is Toronto head office in our hoteling work space
Hours are reasonably flexible with no additional travelling involved
Job Responsibilities:
What you'll do
Depending on the candidate's skill level in SQL, the role will either be primarily SQL development with some data management or primarily data management.


Programming business logic in SQL
Implementing new analytics in web-based UI
Updating financial time series data in an Oracle database using SQL
Investigating and resolving spikes, gaps, and overlaps in time series data
Interpreting financial and accounting data by applying investment knowledge
Trouble-shoot in-house software applications for performance and functionality
Perform research on other investment managers such as endowments and sovereign wealth funds

Must have working knowledge of SQL programming
Must have familiarity with asset classes and their distinct characteristics
Must have solid mathematical background, particularly in statistics
Concentration in Mathematics, Computer Programming, Statistics, finance or related field.
Knowledge of object-oriented programming is an asset.
Preferred knowledge or interest in machine learning or AI
Previous work term experience preferred
Must be enrolled in 3rd / 4th year or related Master's program
You must be enrolled in a co-op program or returning back to your studies after the work term is completed

Job Summary:
The Opportunity

January 2022 - April 2022/May 2022 - August 2022 


When you work in an internship role in the Capital Markets department you will have an engaging work experience where you can apply your analytical skills and passion for markets at a leading investment firm while experiencing the dynamic nature of the trading floor environment. This "full-immersion" experience unfolds in a friendly and open environment where you will work side by side with highly experienced investment professionals and more recent graduates. We embrace diversity of thought and pride ourselves in our strong learning culture. As an added benefit, our interns have access to industry tools, research and the opportunity to interact with traders, portfolio managers and economic researchers. 


Who you'll work with


We are looking to fill four (2 for Winter, 2 for Summer) internship position in Capital Markets in the Credit Team. The Credit Team leads the Fund's internal and external allocations to Credit asset classes, focusing primarily on running active strategies to add value on top of designated benchmarks. As part of a team of 24, the intern will work closely with portfolio managers on day-to-day investment activities and on longer-term research projects.
Job Responsibilities:
What you will do


As an intern in Capital Markets, you will be encouraged to make the most of your Teacher's experience by asking questions and getting involved in our daily business right from Day 1. Daily responsibilities may vary but generally involve building market analytics, vetting and running profit-and-loss and risk reports, and engaging in research for new and current investment strategies. You will also participate in a term-length portfolio management case to develop and test your investment skills, nurture your interest in capital markets and help assess your interest in risk taking. Furthermore, you will have a chance to explore the work of other groups, not just your own, by attending networking and lunch-and-learn sessions.
Required Skills:
What you'll need

You have exhibited passion and curiosity for financial markets.
You are an entrepreneurial thinker and possess strong problem-solving skills.
Your area of study is less important than your drive, and we urge you to apply if you have shown academic excellence and share our interest in financial markets.
Your dream is to work in a stimulating environment and to collaborate with your peers and managers.
You are naturally inquisitive with a desire to learn, ask questions, and solve meaningful problems.
You are a developing leader, with excellent analytical, social and communication skills.
You are able to multi-task, have phenomenal time management, leadership skills and work ethic.
You value Integrity, Innovation, Performance, Partnership and Humility.
Must be enrolled in 3rd / 4th year or related Masters' program
You must be enrolled in a co-op program or returning back to your studies after the work term is completed

Job Title: Intern - Quantitative Strategies & Research (4 or 8 month contract)
Job Summary:
The opportunity

January 2022 - April 2022/May 2022 - August 2022 


Do you want to use your research skills and curiosity about markets to explore and build new systematic investment strategies? 

We are Quantitative Strategies and Research (QSR), an innovation-driven team within Capital Markets at Ontario Teachers' Pension Plan. We manage a broad and diversified portfolio, built using quantitative models, and are looking for an intern to join us this winter or summer. 


We have varied educational backgrounds and research interests, and we are all passionate about understanding market drivers and using tools like data science, statistics, and technology to test and run our ideas. We are working on a lot of different projects - whether you are an undergrad curious about quantitative investing or a graduate student with advanced and original research contributions, we have something for you! 


Who you'll work with


QSR is a team of 15, based in Toronto. Some of us focus on research and portfolio management, others on data science and technology. You will report to one of the team's Principals based on the best match for your interests and our needs. You will work on research projects and collaborate with other team members. We will encourage you to think independently and explore and present your own ideas and we will guide and help you along the way. 


As a member of Capital Markets, a dynamic team of 80+ investment professionals working across liquid markets, you will also have unparalleled opportunities to meet and learn from people with different areas of expertise and approaches to investing!
Job Responsibilities:
What you'll do

Contribute to QSR's broad research and development initiatives (we tend to work in Matlab and Python)
Apply a wide array of quantitative techniques (e.g., statistics, machine learning, optimization, etc.) to explore and test investment and portfolio hypotheses
Review, critique, and implement research papers from academia or the practitioner community
Present and discuss your results with the team and gather feedback for improvement
Work on a variety of datasets, e.g., sourcing, cleaning, visualization, and predictive modelling
Propose original ideas (e.g., based on personal interests, prior experience, or graduate research) and test them on real-world data
Gain experience in one or several asset classes, including equities, fixed income, currencies, and commodities
Contribute to the development and optimization of our portfolio implementation infrastructure and analytical tools
Required Skills:
What you'll need

To be enrolled in a Ph.D. program or Master's or upper-year undergraduate program providing solid quantitative research and/or technology foundations (e.g., math, stats, computer science, engineering, economics, etc.)
A passion for research, demonstrated through academic work (e.g., papers published, research projects or theses) or personal projects
Broad programming experience, especially in scientific programming (we tend to work in Matlab and Python)
Curiosity and interest about applying research and technology in the context of understanding markets and building portfolio systems.
You should be returning back to your studies after the work term is completed
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Accounting and Financial Auditing
				
			
				- Theme - Business Administration
				
			
				- Theme - Finance and Investment 
				
			
				ARTS/MATH - Finance
				
			
				MATH - Business

Opal is helping engineering teams manage quick access to developer permissions. We've all been blocked on projects because it takes too long to request access to infrastructure and other developer tools. With funding from Greylock Partners, investors in Airbnb, Facebook, and LinkedIn, we're taking on the challenge of making access to priviilleged production systems faster and more secure. We are a product for software engineers, built by software engineers. 


We're looking for a sharp and experience fullstack engineer to help build new features in our UI. There's no shortage of features to work and it's guarenteed that you'll be working on product that will be shipped! We won't waste your time and energy on a project that will ultimately get sidelined.

Job Summary:
Openly is a certified B-Corp company living into our impact goal of fueling the hearts and work of a million change makers by 2025. We exist to support leaders across the social purpose, public, nonprofit and philanthropic sectors in achieving lasting social impact. As a certified B-Corp, Openly has made a formal commitment to advance our social purpose and environmental sustainability. Through everything we do, we promise: to advance equity, dignity and justice for all; and to actively contribute to a healthy, vibrant planet today and for the future. 

B-Corp Certification is a rigorous process to demonstrate commitment and accountability. Openly will need to recertify for this designation in 2022. The Social & Environmental Purpose Support role will report to Openly's Strategic Implementation Lead and play a key role in supporting our B-Corp recertification, as well as in two key projects aligned with our commitment to social and environmental good.
Job Responsibilities:
Environmental Sustainability Plan (40%)
To support the implementation of Openly's Environmental Sustainability plan, the co-op student will: 

Conduct research, develop and implement programs, policies and initiatives in support Openly's environmental sustainability plan and strategies. 
Work cross-functionally to extend the reach of the sustainability plan and inform and engage other departments and teams about sustainable strategies (communications, procurement, HR/recruitment, etc.). 
Work on ad hoc sustainability projects, supporting Business Owners and Lead with research, data analysis and presentation preparation. 
Support the creation of Openly's annual Environmental Sustainability Report.

B-Corp Recertification (40%)

Support research, data collection and other work as assigned for successful B-Corp recertification.
Create and document methodology for B-Corp recertification for use by staff and for future references.
Scan and gather policy and other necessary documents/ reports, recommend edits or changes as required to contribute to B-Corp Impact Business Model.
Generate reports to track and monitor Operational Impact and Impact Business Model to contribute to running a successful B-Corp.

Project Support (20%)
Supporting evaluation and strategy projects including:

Supporting data collection and entry
Communicating with clients and other external project stakeholders 
Coordinating work with team leads and other team members
Communicating and working collaboratively with project teams
Required Skills:
Demonstrated commitment to excellence, passion to drive change and make a positive social impact. 
Exceptional research and writing skills.
Ability to work in a collaborative, supportive way with cross-functional teams.
Innovative thinker with natural curiosity, a motivated self-starter able to champion innovative solutions with a passion for sustainability. 
Passionate about advancing community climate action and making a significant impact on greenhouse gas emissions, community resilience, energy use, resource consumption and community waste.
Sound knowledge of the principles, best practices, strategies, technologies, objectives and systems related to environmental sustainability and climate action (both mitigation and adaptation), and energy efficiency.
Humility, respect and professionalism in working with everyone regardless of title/position, including community members.
Capacity to manage multiple priorities and comfort working in a virtual office.
Graduate/Post Graduate degree in a related field.

Note: If you don't have everything listed above but believe this role will make you excited to start work every day, please apply! We love curiosity, tenacity and learning.

Job Summary:
With net assets over $23 billion, OPTrust invests and manages one of Canada's largest pension funds. OPTrust is a global investor with a team of experienced investment professionals located in Toronto, London and Sydney. 


OPTrust's investment mandate focuses on achieving the organization's mission to pay pensions today and preserve pensions for tomorrow. We are a pension management organization. Our members depend on us to provide secure, predictable income in retirement. Our investment strategy is aligned with our members' interests and seeks to deliver the returns we need to keep the Plan fully funded at the lowest level of risk. 


Job Description

The Investment Risk group at OPTrust provides independent oversight as a "second line of defense" to protect the organization from undue loss. We are responsible for the measuring, managing and reporting of investment risks associated with the investment of the assets of the OPSEU Pension Plan. Investment risk includes market risk, credit risk, counterparty risk and liquidity risk. A challenging and excellent learning opportunity awaits an enthusiastic co-op student for the position of Investment Risk Assistant.
Job Responsibilities:
Job General Responsibilities

  

Assist in the development of tools and processes that help to understand risks and improve investment decisions that are being taken in the total fund. Automate processes when appropriate, and potentially helping to design and develop investment risk dashboards to identify and highlight the concentration of risks in the portfolio.   

  

Collaborate with the investment division to conduct research on topics, such as 

1) key risk metrics (e.g., tail risk) and their applications; 

2) emerging risks in the market (e.g. economic, political, capital markets, regulatory, etc.); 

3) risk modeling of multi asset class hedge funds (working directly with external investment managers is required). 

  

Provide assistance in data analysis to support the production of risk reports and presentations for communication to key stakeholders (e.g. Executive Committee, Board of Trustees, Sponsors and External Partners).
Required Skills:
Qualifications

To be considered for this position, the resume must clearly demonstrate: 

-  Understanding of, and experience with basic investment and risk management concepts preferred 

-  Computer skills including VBA, Python, R or Matlab 

-  Strong analytical and problem solving skills 

-  Ability to conduct independent research using traditional and alternative resources to produce reports 

-  Excellent oral and written communication skills including presentation skills 


Competencies

-  Analytical and critical thinking 

-  Problem solving/judgment 

-  Mathematical capability 

-  Results oriented 

-  Teamwork and cooperation 

-  Demonstrates creativity and enthusiasm

Job Title:
NEW
									



										Software Developer - Enterprise Resource Planning
Job Summary:
At Oracle NetSuite, we build the best-in-class system for automating business processes. We help our customers run their businesses and scale with them as they grow. As a premier part of Oracle's organization, Development teams at NetSuite enjoys a start-up culture with the added benefits of the strength and stability of a global organization. Our work environment is open and agile. We thrive on collaboration and global partnership to build a seamlessly integrated suite of features and flexible solutions. We have developers and product owners in eight offices worldwide, all rallying around one common purpose - helping our customers achieve their goals. 


NetSuite developers do more than write code. We become specialists in our business domain and take the time to deeply understand our customers' goals. We own the design of our product, bringing questions and ideas to the table and analyzing them. We develop greenfield code for new engines as well as maintain a powerful legacy codebase. 


So, you're interested in a co-op? We're looking for students who have great attention to detail, are currently enrolled in a Computer Science or Engineering degree with at least 1+ years of software development and object-oriented programming experience (academic or industry). If you enjoy critical thinking and problem solving and are a strong communicator, take this as a sign to apply! 


Co-Op students at NetSuite are a key part of the larger teams success and are treated like full-time employees. Job Summary:
Machine learning (ML) is at the forefront of the rising popularity of data-driven software applications. The resulting rapid proliferation of ML technology, explosive data growth, and shortage of data science expertise have caused the industry to face increasingly challenging demands to keep up with fast-paced develop-and-deploy model lifecycles. Recent academic and industrial research efforts have started to address this problem through automated machine learning (AutoML) pipelines and have focused on model performance as the first-order design objective. Oracle AutoML [1] is a novel iteration-free AutoML pipeline designed to not only provide accurate models, but also in a shorter runtime. These objectives are achieved by eliminating the need to continuously iterate over various pipeline configurations. Our approach to AutoML has been shown to achieve better scores at a fraction of the time compared to state-of-the-art, making it a prime candidate for addressing industry challenges.

Moreover, as there is an ever-increasing number of deployed models, automated explainability techniques are required to provide insight into their complex behavior and the data they work with. They help humans understand the reasons behind model predictions as well as aid in debugging, improve performance, identify bias and unfairness in the models, and potentially support compliance with new regulations such as "right to explanation". Our group is focused on building a novel framework that gives novice and advanced data scientists the power of AutoML and explainability in a single, easy-to-use, python package.
Job Responsibilities: Featured job topics: AutoML and/or explainability for classification, regression, anomaly detection, and forecasting tasks; Explore support for federated learning; Explore techniques to reduce model bias while tuning; Extend dataset support for unstructured (e.g., NLP) and semi-structured (e.g., video/audio/graph) data; Generic model support including GNNs, DNNs and/or RNNs.
Required Skills:
Enrolled in MS/PhD in Computer Science/Engineering, or related field
Basic understanding of ML, including traditional and DL algorithms
Experience with python, scikit-learn, Tensorflow and/or PyTorch
Familiarity with anomaly detection or forecasting algorithms is a plus
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
Ability to work 37.5hrs / week
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Computing: Software
				
			
				MATH - Applied Mathematics
				
			
				MATH - Computer Science

Job Summary:
The DevOps team functions within Oracle Eloqua R&D to setup and maintain a consistent build, packaging and deployment process. The group also works to integrate the development tools and processes to improve the development experience. The mission of DevOps at Eloqua is to make the development process more repeatable, consistent and transparent. 


The devops co-op is a key member of the co-op team with a great aptitude to learn and a can-do attitude.  The position requires the student to understand the challenges of development, qa and operational side of product development in order to help with the end to end process of getting a product to customer's hands. This is not a one-dimensional role where the right candidate will be challenged on multiple fronts, learning complex database, software, operational and scripting solutions from day one and applying the learnings on a day-to-day basis.
Job Responsibilities: This person is expected to be innovative and detail oriented with excellent communication skills. The position includes administration and integration of devops tools such as JIRA, Teamcity, Git, Chef as well as Testing frameworks. In addition there is a great opportunity to learn more about Microsoft Technology Stack and Oracle Technology Stack in Software Development. The position requires the Integration Engineer to understand the unique challenges of Development, QA, and Production Operations and develop innovative solutions that enable these groups to work smarter, faster and better. The successful candidate will possess a passion for new technology and display a deep understanding of best practices.
Required Skills:
Skillsets needed 

  

While we know that not everyone can be a master at everything, we are looking for people with interest and basic understanding of the following 

  

Git - You are more than just a Git user. Would you know how to branch, merge, squash, stash, and patch? 

  

Linux - Need system level knowledge of Linux. Starting from understanding of Kernel architecture, process management and configuring a linux system? 

  

Windows - Everyone has done windows sometime or other. You will be doing more. Need to know Windows Services layer, APIs and probably done some sort of batch scripting on windows 

  

Chef/Puppet - Have you done Chef or Puppet? By that what we mean is you have written scripts using these tools, not just used them. If not, how about CFEngine, Saltstack, or Ansible? 

  

System Administration - Would you know how to add new windows users? Start/Stop services , setup new windows and linux machines? 

  

Apache Webservers - Have you setup an Apache Webserver? If not, how about Nginx? Understanding of webservers and how it works would be an essential skill 

  

Ruby/Python - You should have programmed significantly on Ruby or Python. What we are talking about are much more than writing some simple scripts or knowing the syntax. Share with us what you have done and show us how you can program in them 

  

CI Systems - We are big on Teamcity. If you are not, don't worry, how about Jenkins/Buildbot/Electric Commander/Hudson/Circle or any other popular ones? Again, we are looking for someone who has modeled workflows in a CI system and has in depth administration knowledge or at least understanding of the concepts. All developers these days use CI systems, but our group supports these for 100s of developers 

  

Databases / SQL - Being at Oracle developing enterprise systems, we need you to have a pretty good understanding of databases. We prefer Microsoft SQL Server and Oracle Database. If your understanding of how these databases work is minimal, we would at least want you to be a SQL expert. We expect you to know JOIN/UNION/SCHEMA/STREAM/… 

  

Shell/Perl/Regex - Knowing Shell scripting or Perl would show us that you have solid system administration automation experience. 

  

Java/C++/C# -- Have you done any application development. While this is not a must-have, we would know you can hold your own if you have done this 

  

Networking - We deal with very many networking challenges in our day-to-day work. While we do not expect you to be a network administrator , understanding of the basic concepts of networking is a must have. 

  

Dockers and Containers - Being able to build and deploy images is a critical part of our operations. We expect all our stack to be containerized in the next several months. Have you heard about this technology and does it interest you 

Agile/Scrums/Kanban/JIRA - Devops team does agile. We have 2 week sprints and practice our development methodologies religiously. We have roadmaps, goals and challenging deliverables while managing the day-to-day support needs 

  

Communication skills - Perhaps this is one of the most important skills that is often overlooked. Our team currently is spread across potentially 6 geographical locations and effective oral and written communication is what's really going to make it successful. Devops @ Oracle requires people skills in supporting several people around the world and gone are the days when you are a reclusive programmer.
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Computing: Information Systems 
				
			
				- Theme - Computing: Software
				
			
				ENG - Software Engineering
				
			
				MATH - Computer Science
Application Documents Required: University of Waterloo Co-op Work History,Résumé,Grade Report

Job Summary:
Original Studios Inc. is an early stage game development studio currently working on a realistic and challenging top-down survival game called Blight (Steam link: https://store.steampowered.com/app/1564600). The company was founded early 2020 by me, a UW CS grad (https://www.linkedin.com/in/sergei-bezborodko-031a362a/), and the company currently consists of me and an artist contractor. Since graduating in 2011 I worked in San Francisco at various small startups, followed by 5 years at Uber, and now I've decided to take the plunge and finally build out my dream company while I still can. 


I'm looking for someone that can help speed up the development process. I have an infinite list of things to build for this game, and I can only put so many hours in of my own time. The game is written in C# using the Unity engine, targeting the PC platform, and it's been under full-time development since August 2019. It's a top-down perspective survival game, drawing inspiration from games like Project Zomboid and Don't Starve. You'll be working closely with me and the artist to build out a bunch of new features, help fix bugs and even contribute to game design ideas and planning. An interest in playing games in this survival genre would be ideal. 


After covid I stopped going into a co-working space so now I just work at home all the time. Remote work would be fine, but in the first few weeks it would be great to meet at a coffee shop or a short-term co-working space type deal near Toronto for a smoother onboarding process. 


You can try out the current alpha version of the game by hitting the playtest "Request Access" button on the Steam page: https://store.steampowered.com/app/1564600
Job Responsibilities:
- Translate requirements into complicated but clean and efficient code 

- Produce prototypes of gameplay ideas and features 

- Develop schedules and determine milestones 

- Create unit tests and validation procedures to assure quality 

- Detect identification and resolution and document technical specifications 

- Polish the game, maintain code, fix bugs and iron out occurring problems
Required Skills:
- Proficiency in C# or similar languages like Java 

- Experience with Unity very ideal 

- Experience working closely with a team, including collaboration, estimation and sprint planning 

- Being able to work productively and reliably on your own 

- An interest in gaming, especially in survival genre based games, would be great

Job Summary:
About Us

We're a fintech leader. A first mover in the institutional debt capital markets -­ the largest capital market in the world -­ that is laser focused on transforming how global investment banks, institutional investors, corporations and governments connect. Overbond is building a platform that makes new bond issuance digital, transparent, and secure. Our team is composed of individuals with deep expertise, from both a technical and industry perspective, that are truly motivated by the opportunity and the space. We value sharp minds, integrity, high performance, collaboration, and purpose. Our mindset is innovation and we challenge convention. At Overbond, we believe that change is the only constant and that problems are opportunities in disguise. 


The Opportunity

We are looking for a motivated, sharp, and ambitious individual who is passionate about addressing a significant problem in the global capital markets using cutting edge technology. You'll work in a dynamic environment, be given responsibility to execute on projects, and learn from strong team of experts in their respective areas. If you're a self-­starter and eager to make valuable contributions while continuing to grow your skills, we want to hear from you! 


What we offer

Successful candidate(s) will have a truly exciting opportunity to be part of the industry leading fintech company changing the way how global investment banks, institutional investors, corporations and governments access the capital markets. The candidate will work with top notch industry professionals and will be given ample amount of opportunities to learn and contribute.
Job Responsibilities:
What You'll Do

Perform marketing reach out to target clients (investors, corporate executives) and act as a primary point of contact for target capital markets and fintech industry forums and events.
Able to engage in cold calling, prospecting new clients through cold-emailing strategies
Assist sales team on all pre-sales activities including but not limited to client prospecting, booking meetings, and following up on emails
Support business operations activities.
Form and maintain relationships with key stakeholders.
Develop communication and digital marketing & branding strategies, professional social media presence.
Incorporate analytic tools such as Google analytics, online form/survey tools, template design and mass email coverage, weekly newsletter updates, targeted messages, and key results/metrics measurement.
Ensure corporate brand guidelines are adhered to in all Brand and Content design activities.
Required Skills:
What You'll Need

Fluency in Microsoft Office Suite, Google for Work, and other similar programs
Strong organizational and interpersonal skills
Ability to consume, analyze, and synthesize information
Experience with marketing, communications, and growth/sales
Interest and/or experience in fintech, technology, and capital markets is necessary

Job Summary:
About Us
We're a fintech leader in the institutional debt capital markets - the largest capital market sector in the world - that is laser focused on transforming how global investment banks, institutional investors, corporations and governments connect. Overbond is working on developing disruptive AI technology that will bring the latest advances in data science and machine learning to the primary bond market. Our team is composed of individuals with deep expertise, from both a technical and industry perspective, that are truly motivated by the opportunity and the space. We value sharp minds, integrity, high performance, collaboration, and purpose. Our mindset is to innovate and challenge convention. At Overbond, we believe that change is the only constant and that problems are opportunities in disguise.

The Opportunity
This exciting new role is available as part of the Overbond product team. The position is a unique opportunity to build creative solutions for complex problems using cutting edge technology. As an expert in data science, you will be assist the team in charge of the architecture, integration and analysis of large data sets used for developing machine learning models and generating business insights. We are seeking enthusiastic data science co-ops who are excited about utilizing latest statistical, machine learning, and predictive analytics techniques to transform unstructured data to creative solutions that will have direct impact on the business of our clients.

What We Offer
Successful candidate(s) will have a truly exciting opportunity to be part of the industry-leading fintech company changing the way how global investment banks, institutional investors, corporations and governments access the capital markets. The candidate will work with top-notch industry professionals and will be given ample amount of opportunities to learn and contribute.

Collect, analyze and visualize colossal datasets using a variety of emerging technologies to help solidify our understanding of users and improve product decision-making
Assist in designing, building and maintaining an expanding set of robust predictive models and applications to drive forecast accuracy
Assist in data science initiatives to recommend actionable business insights using big data analytics and machine learning techniques
Leverage distributed and open-source computing tools for recommendations, classification, regression, and feature extraction, from logistic regression to matrix factorization, to deep learning neural networks
Prepare detailed documentation to specify data sources, models and algorithms used and developed
Collaborate with the engineering team to deploy models and algorithms in production
Effectively communicate data insights in a non-technical manner to key stakeholders and senior management team

Interest or experience in institutional capital markets industry

Job Summary:
When people think of Owens Corning, they often picture the Pink Panther, who appears predominantly in its advertising campaigns. Best known for its PINK FIBERGLAS home insulation and other products that conserve energy, which helps protect the environment, Owens Corning is a world leader in building materials systems and composite solutions. Owens Corning's people redefine what's possible each day to deliver high-quality products and services ranging from insulation, roofing, siding and manufactured stone to glass composite materials used in high-performance applications.   


A Fortune 500 company for more than 50 years, Owens Corning has cultivated a culture that emphasizes safety, performance and accountability, openness and stewardship. Owens Corning's emphasis on its people and its commitment to its corporate values  Integrity, Respect, Accountability, Fun, Sharing, Candor and Innovation  result in a unique employment experience 

  

About our process: 


The Toronto Plant commenced producing fiberglass insulation early in 1978 and has continuously produced quality products for Canadian and American consumers.  With an overall compliment of approximately 150 employees, we strive to produce the best home building insulation available anywhere.  We are rather unique in that under one roof we receive raw materials and process them into finished consumer products.  This gives our people the opportunity to learn about and deal with a large variety of processes and equipment.

Job Summary:
Ozery Bakery is a family-owned bakery in Vaughan Ontario, founded on the promise to make superior quality bread from real, premium ingredients without compromise. Since 1996, the Ozery family has been inventing alternatives to traditional bread products that are made from hearty whole grains, fruits, and seeds. At Ozery Bakery, our business is based upon this simple foundation: Our bodies deserve the best possible fuel. And our commitment to quality and service is at the core of our daily efforts. Everything made at Ozery Bakery is inspired by the philosophy that you can eat well and feel healthy. All of our products are free of artificial flavours and colours, preservatives, additives and GMOs. They are also certified as Kosher and vegan, so they do not contain any animal products or by-products. Tasty and nourishing, we like to think they inspire a whole new way of enjoying bread! 


We are looking to add a food technologist co-op student to the research and development team.

Arrange R&D samples to be made and sent to customers; assisting sales with gathering and creating samples
Manage lab environment
Generate nutritional facts tables using Genesis
Monitor product lines and spot check process parameters to verify end product quality

Working Conditions

A manufacturing, warehouse and office environment
Moderate noise and temperature levels
Some local traveling may be required
Mostly day shift with some evenings/nights and weekends when required
Must be able to taste test bread products which may include whole grains, fruits, and seeds

Job Summary:
Purpose of role:

  

The Accounting Intern is responsible for general accounting functions such as preparing journal entries, assisting with financial statements, performing reconciliations, assisting with monthly closing - account analysis/reporting and supporting the Finance team in carrying out the responsibilities of the Finance department. This position is available as a 4 or 8 month co-op.
Job Responsibilities:
Main Duties

  

Accounting and Reconciliations

Assist with the financial statement close process by preparing journal entries and reports.
Prepare monthly account reconciliations and maintaining supporting schedules; investigate, identify and document any reconciling items.
System uploads and reconciliation of data fed between systems
Adhere to established internal controls and operating procedures.
Coordinating, updating and formatting financial reporting packages (including but not limited to Balance Sheet and Income Statement review packages)
Manage completeness of journal entries ensuring back-up and management sign-off has been provided.

Analysis and Reporting

Critically analyze ledger accounts by providing explanations for variances and movements.
Prepare financial reports which may include (but is not limited to): Corporate submission filings, regulatory submissions, compliance reports, financial statements, surveys, and/or internal management reports.
Support internal and external audit requirements by preparing audit evidence as required
Support Financial Reporting Team by researching accounting standards in determining accounting policy decisions.


Ad hoc activities

Support the Finance team by completing ad hoc work
Ad hoc Finance project support
Required Skills:
Qualifications & Experience

Knowledge of accounting concepts
Pursuing Accounting/Finance degree
Strong Microsoft Office experience, especially Excel
Excellent analytical, problem solving and technical accounting skills
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Ability to manage competing priorities in a deadline driven environment
Flexibility to work overtime at peak periods

Job Summary:
We are seeking a talented, ambitious individual with the goal of providing an opportunity to gain a unique skill set in a niche sector of the industry and round out the candidate's experience. Our ideal co-op student would thrive in our vibrant, collaborative culture and gain a competitive edge by remotely securing international exposure and global networking opportunities from the comfort of home. 

  

Do you find yourself questioning things and digging deeper when something doesn't quite look right to find the answer?  Do you have an inquisitive mind?  Do you demonstrate excellent judgment and decision-making skills?  Do you have a high level of attention to detail and are you a quick learner? We pride ourselves in thinking differently and so we want people who aren't afraid to challenge the norm. If this sounds like you, we would like to welcome you to apply for our Actuarial Intern position! 

  

  

Purpose of Role:

  

We are currently looking for an Actuarial Intern to work within our Corporate Actuarial team, based in our downtown Toronto office with work from home opportunities available.  You will be assisting in the asset and liability modelling work in support of the PL Re Retro financial planning and reporting activities and other key business unit initiatives.
Job Responsibilities:
Job Responsibilities:

 
 

Support quarterly and annual valuation and financial reporting activities under the following accounting and regulatory bases:
	 
  
US Statutory & US Tax.
US GAAP.
Canadian IFRS & LICAT.
Economic Capital.
Solvency II.
Bermuda Statutory.



This involves performing miscellaneous reserve calculations, reconciliations and analysis.

 

Perform valuation model spot-checks under various accounting and regulatory bases, i.e. for sample policies, perform independent validation of system reserves generated in AXIS actuarial software. 
	 
  
Confirming the accuracy and completeness of the valuation data.
Verifying and understanding actuarial assumptions.
Calculating reserves and capital requirements from first principles.
Documenting and explaining the results.



 

 

Support other activities and projects as needed.
	 
  
Assisting with reserve sensitivities and scenario testing.
Implementing changes in the AXIS actuarial model.
Testing the impact of various valuation system changes.
Participating in various other investigations.
Support the development and calibration of the divisional economic capital model via the "quantifying insurance risk" framework.
Required Skills:
Essential Qualifications & Experience:

 Demonstrates an appropriate level of actuarial knowledge for their experience level.
 Takes responsibility for quality, completeness and accuracy of work.
 Shows initiative, flexibility and resourcefulness.
 Ability to deal with challenging deadlines and prioritizes effectively.
 Provides accurate and timely updates on status of work and escalates issues appropriately.
 Participates actively in meetings, has 'meeting presence'.
 Ability to work well on a team as well as independently.
 Communicates in a clear and practical manner both verbally and in writing.

Targeted Clusters

				MATH - Statistics and Actuarial Science

Job Summary:
Together we're building a company that will endure and products people will love for generations to come.  


We believe that people do their best in a culture that fosters inclusion, innovation, and success. Our values - Champion the Customer, Take the Lead, Run Together, Ack + Own and Bring Yourself - serve as the foundation of our collaborative and dynamic culture.  


Whether it's conducting a retrospective, cranking out a new product feature, supporting our two PagerDuty bands, or doing our day to day work, Dutonians live and breathe these five values every day. Together, we solve real customer issues and fulfill our mission of connecting teams to real-time opportunities and elevate work to the outcomes that matter. 


Solve for what's next at PagerDuty. 


This is a fully remote, 4 month role for the Winter 2022 term that begins on January 3, 2022 and ends on April 22, 2022. Successful candidates will be working from home during the duration of the term.



About You

You are excited to take on the difficult challenges of building highly available distributed systems and the responsibilities that come with developing mission critical software. 

You are confidently self-driven 

You have an insatiable desire to learn 

You are empathetic - you can clearly communicate your thoughts and opinions to others 

You are passionate about high quality, maintainable and testable code 

You have a solid grasp of computer science fundamentals 

You want to build reliable and highly scalable systems  

Our Toolset: Are you interested in learning about these? 

Languages: mainly Ruby on Rails, Scala, Elixir, Swift, Objective C (iOS), Java (Android) and more! 

Back-end: Kafka, Percona XtraDB (MySQL), Cassandra, CouchDB 

Front-end: Backbone.js, Ember.js, CoffeeScript and ES6 

Technologies: Distributed Systems, Databases, High Availability Systems, Machine Learning, Streaming Systems 


PagerDuty Offers:

In addition to working with deeply passionate and intelligent people in a dynamic environment, we also offer: 

Competitive compensation 

Mentorship - each participant is matched with a team mentor 

A chance to participate in our Employee Resource Groups and give back through various volunteer opportunities 



PagerDuty is committed to creating a diverse environment and is an equal opportunity employer. PagerDuty does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, parental status, veteran status, or disability status. 


PagerDuty is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities in our job application process.  Should you require accommodation, please email accommodation@pagerduty.com and we will work with you to meet your accessibility needs. 


Our stewardship of the data of many thousands of customers means that a background check is required to join PagerDuty. We will, nonetheless, consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records in a manner consistent with local requirements. 

PagerDuty uses the E-Verify employment verification program. 


To all recruitment agencies: PagerDuty does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, PagerDuty employees or any other company location. PagerDuty is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.
Job Responsibilities:
How You Contribute to Our Vision

You're passionate about building software and looking for a place to put your skills to use and work with a fantastic team 

You will build and ship new customer-facing features (A number of participants deployed features during their time at PagerDuty!) 

You'll collaborate with product and UX to deliver the highest quality web experience 

You'll be participating in code reviews for your fellow team members
Required Skills:
Minimum Qualifications

Good understanding of CS fundamentals, eg. data structures and algorithms 

Knowledge and understanding of at least one programming language, eg. Java, Python, C

About our Career Accelerator Program (CAP) 

The Career Accelerator Program at PagerDuty offers an opportunity for participants, to learn and build meaningful skills at PagerDuty. Whether you're enrolled  in a post-secondary institution, completed a coding bootcamp, or returning to work after a gap in employment, CAP can provide up to 16 weeks of hands-on experience in a high growth tech company. Through a variety of networking, learning, and mentoring opportunities, our CAP program fast tracks participants for an exceptional career and can serve as a gateway to permanent employment at PD. 


CAP has three cohorts each year beginning in January (Winter), May (Summer) and September (Fall) and participants are paid competitively in their respective industries.

Job Summary:
Investment Banking Intern

  

The Investment Banking team at Paradigm Capital Inc. ("Paradigm Capital") is looking to hire a winter intern to join the Toronto office.           


Overview of Paradigm Capital: Paradigm Capital is a Canadian independent investment banking firm with a sales, trading, research and corporate finance focus providing services for institutional investors and corporations. Paradigm Capital was founded in 1999 and is a member of the Toronto Stock Exchange, the TSX Venture Exchange and the Investment Industry Regulatory Organization of Canada. 


Qualifications and Experience: The investment banking fall intern position at Paradigm Capital will appeal to highly motivated individuals that are interested in pursuing an investment banking career in an entrepreneurial and high-energy environment. We are seeking candidates who have demonstrated outstanding academic performance. Candidates should have advanced technical and analytical abilities, excellent oral and written communication skills, as well as a positive, enthusiastic and co-operative attitude. Paradigm Capital offers exceptional opportunities to learn and contribute in a co-operative team environment that rewards professional excellence and individual initiative.
Job Responsibilities:

Building financial models and comparable tables
Creating and updating presentations and various databases
Assisting corporate clients with marketing materials

Job Summary: Paravision offers best-in-class face recognition technology with the most comprehensive, real-life data set of any private company in the world. Our patent-pending technique for collecting tagged data and integrating it into our models has helped us develop the largest tagged dataset ever used to build enterprise-ready face and object recognition APIs and mobile SDKs.  We are looking for a software engineer to join our Toronto team which includes Machine Learning and Software Engineers.
Job Responsibilities:
What You'll Do - Function

* Create, test, and enhance APIs/SDKs that expose our world-class face recognition models for our customers 

* Architect, implement and scale our data pipeline to efficiently process data for the ML team 

* Develop algorithms to power our facial recognition products 

* Develop major software components, systems, and features
Required Skills:
What You Have - Skill

* First and foremost, you love to write code. You take great pride in your abilities to solve difficult problems with your code and work hard to continuously enhance your skillset. 

* History of teamwork and willingness to roll up one's sleeves to get the job done 

* Strong technical, analytical and quantitative skills with the ability to use data and metrics to back up assumptions, recommendations and drive decisions 

* High attention to detail and proven ability to manage multiple, competing priorities simultaneously. 

* Ability to work in a fast-paced environment where continuous innovation is desired 


Nice to Have - Skill

* Experience with applications of neural nets

Job Summary:
PartnerRe is a leading global Life and P&C reinsurer, providing multi-line risk management solutions to clients around the world.  We are hiring for the North America Life Reinsurance Division, which is a rapidly expanding business unit of PartnerRe Ltd.  


This term we looking to fill 6 internship positions across the business unit.  The internships provide an opportunity to obtain valuable hands-on industry experience from experts in the field while participating and contributing to the organization's work and vision.  The roles are as follow:
 

1 in Canadian Pricing team
1 in Canadian Valuation team
2 in Project team
2 in US Pricing and Valuation: We offer our applicants an unique and exciting prospect - the opportunity to work in a hybrid Pricing-Valuation role.  The role will encompass working in the two US functions simultaneously.

The internships will be situated in our Canadian office, which is conveniently located in downtown Toronto near Union Station, accessible by GO Transit and the TTC.  Note that the posted positions are for a 4 month work term, with the flexibility of extending to 8 months.  Depending on the state of the pandemic, the interns may be required to work remotely.
Job Responsibilities:
Core Responsibilities: 

AXIS Modelling - Design and build projection models for individual life reinsurance transactions. 

Data Analysis - Work extensively with large datasets in SQL and R to perform rigorous analysis of client experience data. 

Financial Analysis - Assist in the preparation and analysis of reserves, required capital, and financial statements. 

Project Work - Provide on-demand support to Valuation and Pricing functions (experience analysis, inforce management, etc). 


We encourage innovations and process improvements from our staff.  If you are someone who would like to leave an impact and make a difference, please apply!
Required Skills:
Required Skills:

1. Third or Fourth year student in Actuarial Science. 

2. A minimum of two Society of Actuaries exams. 

3. Understanding of life insurance products. Previous work experience with life insurance would be considered an asset. 

4. Strong technical skills including MS Excel and MS Access or similar database management tool. R Programming skills are desirable. 

5. Experience with the AXIS actuarial system preferred. 

6. Strong analytical and problem solving skills. 

7. Excellent verbal and written communications skills. 

8. Work independently and as part of a team. 


Please note to us if you are fluent in French.  We value this skillset highly in the Canadian Pricing team.

Job Summary:
About PartnerStack 

PartnerStack helps companies acquire more customers and drive new revenue with partnerships. That's why fast-growing SaaS companies like Asana, Freshworks and Intuit use the PartnerStack platform to power their reseller, marketing and referral programs. 

We pride ourselves on building products people really want to use. Every member of the PartnerStack team is passionate about developing their skills, delivering value to customers and bringing a unique perspective to our company. We love to work with curious people who are excited to grow, and help others grow alongside them. Is that you? 


About you and the role 

Our product managers come from unique backgrounds, but what we share is the ability to apply product fundamentals and stakeholder management skills to customer-facing and internal features. You have broad knowledge and an ability to quickly learn and understand the nuances of various business and partner relationships. You're passionate about being a key source of mentorship and growth for your peers. You learn from your product launch stories, successful or otherwise and want to handle solutions and features from concept to fruition.
Job Responsibilities:
- Support the roadmap for the Partner and Marketplace experience 

- Evaluate and prioritize new opportunities, manage backlog grooming and sprint planning for full-stack software engineers (Python / Vue) and product designers. You will be working extensively in Confluence and Jira 

- Develop clear and detailed product requirements/ user stories 

- Work closely with internal engineers, product designers to execute on the building and iterating on new and existing features of the application 

- Monitor product adoption, proactively identifying opportunities and making actionable recommendations to drive product uptake and effectiveness 

- Manage and communicate project schedules, goals, and dependencies, and drive cross-functional initiatives
Required Skills:
- Experience or interest in Product Management 

- The ability to read code (Python / JavaScript) would be a huge asset 

- Experience or understanding of working iteratively (Agile) directly with an Engineering and Design team and examples where you've successfully adjusted and iterated around constraints 

- Understanding of SDLC, software architecture, and modern product methodologies (Lean, HCD, etc.) honed through dozens of product releases 

- Experience leading teams and delivering to KPIs 

- An aptitude for client management and a special touch for getting buy-in. All of our product managers are client-facing and will work with a wide range of stakeholders
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Computing: Information Systems 
				
			
				- Theme - Computing: Software
				
			
				ENG - Mechanical and Mechatronics Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Systems Design and Biomedical Engineering
Application Documents Required: University of Waterloo Co-op Work History,Résumé,Grade Report

Job Summary:
About PartnerStack 

PartnerStack helps companies acquire more customers and drive new revenue with partnerships. That's why fast-growing SaaS companies like Asana, Freshworks and Intuit use the PartnerStack platform to power their reseller, marketing and referral programs. 

We pride ourselves on building products people really want to use. Every member of the PartnerStack team is passionate about developing their skills, delivering value to customers and bringing a unique perspective to our company. We love to work with curious people who are excited to grow, and help others grow alongside them. Is that you? 


About you and the role 

You are a student in Computer Science or a similar program. A relentless learner, always digging deeper into your code and solutions while collaborating with your team to create the best possible solution. You are not afraid to take on new technology challenges and crave working with latest tools and techniques. You do all of this with a smile and passion, that makes not just your work outstanding but all the people around you. 


Why you'll love working here 

PartnerStack is a fast-growing startup rethinking how SaaS companies go to market and scale revenue with partnerships. We have the full support of both our customers and investors in building something truly new and never settling for the status quo. 


But beyond building great products, our mission is to build a great company. We want PartnerStack to be one of the best places to grow personally and professionally, and that starts with making sure every member of the team gets what they need to feel energized about their work and enthusiastic to learn something new. 


PartnerStack is certified by Great Place to Work® Canada as one of the country's best startups to work at, based on their independent analysis of employee feedback.
Job Responsibilities:
What you'll do

- Develop/maintain/extend PartnerStack's Vue.JS frontend and Python backend software systems 

- Look for and propose changes to the code base 

- Improve the quality and efficiency of the product and team 

- Participate in the team's Agile processes 

- Learn!
Required Skills:
You're a great candidate if...

- 3rd or 4th year student 

- Have completed 1-2 co-op terms 

- Confident with programming fundamentals and concepts 

- Write readable, robust, testable and reusable code 

- Experience with front end frameworks like Vue or Angular 

- Experience with Python 

- Strong communication with the ability to give and receive constructive feedback

Job Summary:
Changing the world, one city at a time! 

  

Are you looking to make a lasting impact in the world and embrace the collective power of micromobility? Join the leading bike sharing company! 

  

PBSC is present in over 42 cities. From Barcelona to Rio de Janeiro, we provide turn key solutions to cities looking for bike sharing systems.  

  

As a One Team, we are driven by passion, performance also imagination. 

  

PBSC develops full stack products including mechanical, electrical and software engineering components. Our solutions range from electric bikes and grid-connected charging stations to solar powered wireless terminals. 

  

Whether you want to tackle circuit design, power electronics, embedded firmware development, PBSC has a spot for you in a rich learning environment.
Job Responsibilities:
We are looking for passionate, self driven interns who like to push the bounds of what is possible to participate in our product development process! 

  

As a function of their interests and competencies, interns will be able to develop hardware solutions that make up our product suite. Your advantage is that you will get to experience many different technologies for a world leader in green technologies.
Required Skills:
Experience with circuit design, power electronics or mechatronics. 

Experience with Windows, Linux and Altium. 

Team worker with an efficient and organized work ethic. 

Curious and passionate about new technologies. 

Autonomous, rigorous and driven by quality. 

French, as an asset. 


*We are eager to learn more about you! Tell us in few words why or how you fit with our values:  passion, performance and imagination.

Job Summary:
Successful student will have a unique opportunity to be exposed to all aspects of Intellectual Property profession. The firm actively uses this position to recruit Patent Agent Trainees to become registered Patent Agents. The student will also have the opportunity to assist our IT Department. The patent agency profession is long regarded as an excellent and rewarding career path for engineers and scientists. This is an excellent foundation for anyone considering law, including patent law, or other professional services profession that combines technology with other professional skills. PCK is a leading Canadian intellectual property practice founded by Stephen Perry and Andrew Currier, recognized thought leaders in Canadian Intellectual Property Law. 


Accommodation is available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.
Job Responsibilities:
As a student here at the firm, you will work alongside highly skilled individuals holding backgrounds in engineering, software development, and the legal profession. The experience will provide you with an opportunity to learn how engineering/science can be applied to the legal profession. Some of your responsibilities will include:
 

Work on large scale projects regarding the automation of patent, trademark and copyright procurement worldwide
Analyze current automated processes for improvements and modifications to optimize performance
Implementing and refining workflows
Composing, reviewing and editing database information for data analysis and report generation

Learning the basics of Intellectual Property for Canada and the rest of the world
Required Skills:
What are we looking for in our candidates? Although every candidate will be considered, the following attributes are very advantageous: 

 
 

Enrolled in a Coop Program with a discipline related to engineering, mathematics, or computer science
Interest in process engineering and/or a career in the field of intellectual property
Attention to detail and Self-motivated/ driven
Technologically inclined
Strong Problem Solving and Communication Skills
Familiarity with the principles of specification development, quality assurance and documentation
Positive attitude, a passion to succeed, surpasses expectation, flexible and able to adapt to change
Well organized and the ability to prioritize work
Understanding of testing methodology and automated testing is an asset
Experience with databases and/or SQL is an asset

Job Summary:
My Career. My Company. My Legacy.

  

At PCL, you are more than just a student. You could be part of a team that works hard, plays hard, and makes a difference in your community. Choosing a co-op at PCL will provide you with challenging assignments and a supportive work environment which promotes personal and professional growth. 

  

Whether you are looking for a corporate or construction career, exciting opportunities are waiting for you. Our people have helped us stand out as a leading general contracting organization, which is why we're always looking for new talent-individuals who can bring innovative solutions and thinking to every project. Construction is a complicated business and our success requires the skills and efforts of a diverse group of people, engaged in a wide variety of activities. Our 100 plus-year tradition of construction excellence is attributable in large part to the efforts of men and women of different cultures, backgrounds, and beliefs. PCL values the additional perspectives, solutions, and ideas that come from a diverse workforce. We recognize that these factors allow us to better achieve company objectives and meet the needs of our customers. 

  

We are currently seeking Engineering Students within our Canadian Buildings Division to work on some of the most exciting projects currently underway specifically in the Vancouver area as well as other locations across Canada. Please identify on your cover letter which location you are interested in being considered for. 

  

The successful candidates will be exposed to many practical construction functions during their work term. This position will be under the direct supervision of the Project Superintendent or Project Manager. We are looking for students available for 4 months from January 2022 to April 2022, or for 8 months from January 2022 to August 2022.
Job Responsibilities:
The role will be involved in a combination of the following duties dependent on the assigned project:

  

Project Coordination

Coordinate drawings
Coordinate work specific scope / trades
Conduct trade quote reviews ? verify material quantities, verify hours, verify rates
Participate in project meetings
Conduct deficiency walks
Input / Update deficiency logs
Issue warranties
Take / Coordinate progress photos
Update field drawings
Produce as-built drawings

Field Coordination

Perform quantity takeoffs
Coordinate sub-trade work
Verify site conditions and coordinate with drawings
Supervise sub-trade work
Set-up / Maintain record keeping
Layout site lines and grades using total station

Scheduling:

Update project schedules
Create manual schedules
Create and update schedules using Suretrak software
Obtain scheduling information from sub-trades
Create and maintain graphical scheduling using AutoCAD.
Monitor Manpower productivity
Required Skills:
Skills required:

Candidates must have a strong desire to work in a construction environment and prior field construction experience will be considered an asset.
Application of various computer software programs will be required, including word processing, spreadsheet applications and drafting. 

At PCL, we aspire to be the most respected builder, renowned for excellence, leadership and unsurpassed value. We're looking for hard working students who want to build their career with a General Contractor, and who thrive in a team environment. We are an equal opportunity employer. 

  

Let us help you build your Legacy today!
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Architecture and Design
				
			
				- Theme - Construction and Infrastructure Development 
				
			
				ENG - Architectural Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Architecture
				
			
				ENG - Civil, Environmental and Geological Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Mechanical and Mechatronics Engineering

At PCL, we build the places where life happens and find camaraderie in the process. We're a community of builders committed to building better communities. That's why we're always looking ahead, and not just to the next project or what's next in our industry. 

  

We're also looking at what's next for you and how we can help you build a career you're proud of. Take your education to the next level and contribute to projects that make a difference in your community. PCL is a place where you are a crucial part of the team from your first day on the job. 

  

We are seeking Engineering and Estimating students within our Calgary District to work on some of the most exciting projects currently underway. Please note that at the time of application, students will be considered for both the engineering and estimating roles; Project assignments are determined prior to the start date of hire. We are looking for students available for 4, 8, 12 or 16 months starting in January 2022.

PCL is an innovative, employee-owned company comprised of people who find passion in their profession and take pride in doing great work every day. Our work powers the infrastructure and utilities that are essential to daily life and our projects are the scene of vacations, careers, education and healing. We are consistently ranked among the best companies to work for because we are committed to supporting and developing our teams. 

  

The PCL Companies celebrate diversity and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. The future you want is within reach.

  

At PCL, we build the places where life happens and find camaraderie in the process. We're a community of builders committed to building better communities. That's why we're always looking ahead, and not just to the next project or what's next in our industry.

We are currently seeking Engineering students within our Calgary District to work on an exciting Solar project taking place in rural southern Alberta. Deemed the largest solar project in Canada, the site is suited over approximately 3400 acres and will generate power to 465MW. This will be a very exciting project for all and a fantastic opportunity to start your legacy in the construction industry. We are looking for students available for 4, 8, 12 or 16 months.
Job Responsibilities:
As an Engineering Student, you will contribute to our team by being involved in a combination of the following duties dependent on the assigned role: 

  

Project Coordination

Coordinate drawings
Coordinate work specific scope / trades
Conduct trade quote reviews - verify material quantities, verify hours, verify rates
Participate in project meetings
Conduct deficiency walks
Input / Update deficiency logs
Issue warranties
Take / Coordinate progress photos
Update field drawings
Produce as-built drawings

  

Field Coordination

Perform quantity takeoffs
Coordinate sub-trade work
Verify site conditions and coordinate with drawings
Supervise sub-trade work
Set-up / Maintain record keeping
Layout site lines and grades using total station
Onsite Logistics coordination of material and equipment
Infield production tracking
Implementation/ daily tracking of Quality Management plan

  

Scheduling:

Update project schedules
Create manual schedules
Create and update schedules using Suretrak software
Obtain scheduling information from sub-trades
Create and maintain graphical scheduling using AutoCAD.
Monitor Manpower productivity
Required Skills:
What you will bring to the role:
 

Candidates must have a strong desire to work in a construction environment and prior field construction experience will be considered an asset.
Application of various computer software programs will be required, including word processing, spreadsheet applications and drafting.

Job Title:
NEW
									



										Engineering Assistant - Integrated Construction Services
Job Summary:
The future you want is within reach.

  

At PCL, we build the places where life happens and find camaraderie in the process. We're a community of builders committed to building better communities. That's why we're always looking ahead, and not just to the next project or what's next in our industry. 

  

We're also looking at what's next for you and how we can help you build a career you're proud of. Take your education to the next level and contribute to projects that make a difference in your community. PCL is a place where you are a crucial part of the team from your first day on the job. 

  

We are currently seeking an Engineering Student for our Integrated Construction Services team within our Calgary District. We are looking for students available for 4 or 8 months. This position provides a unique opportunity to gain experience around construction processes and the software and technology solutions being used and explored on our construction projects to run and enhance them.
Job Responsibilities:
As an Engineering Student within the Integrated Construction Services team, you will contribute to our team by being involved in a combination of the following duties: 

 
 

Interviewing/meeting project teams to determine technology application requirements and timelines.
Gathering an understanding of project processes, needs, users, and extent of application.
Testing potential new software and technology solutions against current solutions and provide feedback.
Becoming familiar and developing expert level knowledge with various software such as Autodesk BIM 360 Field, Autodesk BIM 360 Docs, MS Power BI, Pype Autospecs, an inhouse built project management software (PM4+), and MS suite productivity tools.
Setting up software for use by project teams.
Troubleshooting software to ensure that project teams can proceed forward.
Facilitate software training and support to project teams either virtually or face-to-face.
Assist with a variety of tasks related to drone flights and other reality capture operations.
Assist with support and setup tasks related to project schedules.
Complete periodic data collection and reports.
Assist with the preparation of data dashboards using Power BI to support decision making.
Required Skills:
What you will bring to the role:
 

Interest in technologies pertaining to the construction industry and how technology adds value to construction projects.
Candidates must have a strong desire to develop proficiency in a variety of construction related software programs and technology tools including word processing, spreadsheet applications and drafting.
Prior experience or exposure to construction processes would be considered an asset
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills (written and verbal)
Independent and resourceful in accomplishing day-to-day tasks and assignments.
Initiative and ability to handle multiple tasks and changing priorities under tight deadlines, while maintaining a high degree of accuracy and professionalism.
Will be required to travel to various project sites in Calgary, not all of which are accessible by transit.
