Job Summary:
At PCL/ED, a Joint Venture (PCL/ED) you are more than just a student. You could be part of a team that works hard, plays hard, and makes a difference in our community. Choosing a co-op at PCL/ED will provide you with challenging assignments and a supportive work environment on the most exciting rehabilitation project in the country. 

This co-op placement will provide you with an opportunity to work on the Centre Block Rehabilitation project, one of the most exciting, complex and important construction projects ever undertaken in Canada. The Centre Block project is the first time Canada's two foremost construction companies have pooled their expertise and experience to deliver a project. Both PCL and EllisDon have proud histories in the construction of many of Canada's landmark projects. The Centre Block project is a crowning achievement for each company and will serve as a point of pride for many years to come, during construction and well after the project is complete. 

We are currently seeking an Jr. Conservation Management Coordinator on the Centre Block Rehabilitation project. This position is from January 2022 - April 2021 and will be under the direct supervision of the Lead Conservation Manager.
Job Responsibilities:
The role could involve a combination of the following duties dependent on the assigned project:

You will assist the Lead Conservation Manager with coordination of Heritage Conservation Specialists
You will assist with providing expertise and critical analysis for all technical aspects related to the care and preservation of heritage assets
You will ensure Centre Block Joint Venture team members are familiarized with requirements for managing heritage assets
You will assist the Lead Conservation Manager with preparation of heritage conservation plans, reports and documentation, including risk assessment plan
You will take photographs and document heritage assets impacted by the project, as required
You will assist the Lead Conservation Manager with coordination and tracking of information from management specialists provided by PSPC
You will assist the Lead Move Manager with all movement of heritage assets and associated documentation
You may complete administration, data-input and processing, and assist with producing documents in Microsoft Office and Bluebeam
You may complete ad-hoc responsibilities supporting the Centre Block security team
Required Skills:
Skills Required:

You have a passion for working in a construction environment
You have experience in architectural conservation
You have experience with the application of various computer software programs, including Microsoft Office
You have knowledge/experience in construction industry, you understand terminology and processes
You are a strong decision make and have good problem-solving abilities
You can work under pressure and manage tight deadlines
You have great organizational skills and high attention to detail
You can monitor and forecast resources and staffing for move requirements
You can identify risks associated with asset relocation
You have knowledge of heritage assets with a specialization in conservation
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Construction and Infrastructure Development 
				
			
				ENG - Architectural Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Civil, Environmental and Geological Engineering
Application Documents Required: University of Waterloo Co-op Work History,Cover Letter,Résumé,Grade Report

Job Summary:
PCL Industrial Management is a major constructor of energy projects in Canada, and part of one of North America's largest construction firms.  Our Construction Services division provides professional services to projects to help them operate effectively. Our business is interesting, challenging, and risky, and we collaborate with internal clients and external partners to help make our projects successful. One of our functions is data science: the application of modern data visualization techniques, machine learning techniques, and artificial intelligence to develop insights and address business challenges. We are recruiting a data science student for either a 4 or 8 month work term, starting January 2022. 

  

The successful candidate will work closely with professionals in widely varying disciplines to help deliver solutions that make our processes and systems smarter. We have a focus on custom digital product development, and on delivering value to our field personnel.     


You will participate in the selection, assessment, training, and deployment of AI models, perform exploratory visualizations and analysis, and be trained to use cutting-edge technology platforms on which to perform our work.     

  

This position has a twist. Contingent on successful early work, the team member will have a chance to build their portfolio through a capstone project. For the final two months, a portion of their time will be focused on a machine learning or data visualization initiative of their choosing. You'll be supported in leading: 

 

Developing a proposal 
Preparation and development of the project  
Engaging with the right people 
Assessment and presentation of results 


  Through your capstone, you'll gain valuable experience in the end-to-end cycle, and the resulting addition to your portfolio is intended to be valuable for your future professional and educational endeavours.
Job Responsibilities:
Roles & Responsibilities:

Train machine learning systems using data annotation and benchmarking techniques.  
Gain proficiency in exploratory data analysis, perform it, and present insights. 
Prepare data sets for and machine learning modeling.  
Help your colleagues assess AI/ML model performance and propose paths for potential improvement.  
Prepare data visualizations using industry-leading tools to summarize results for stakeholders. 
Document your results - tell the story of the work, the successes, and the lessons-learned for posterity. 
Keep an open mind, and apply your unique skills and determination where there's opportunity.
Required Skills:
Skills & Qualifications:

You should be an outstanding bachelor's student in engineering, computing, or mathematical sciences. Alternatively, you could be pursuing an MSc in a quantitative field. If your field of study differs, justify why you'll be a good fit regardless.  
Analytical skills - ability to quickly analyze data to identify and visualize key insights - as evidenced by coursework, projects, or research requiring the analysis of large datasets.  
Coursework in statistics. Applied statistics and probability are the focus of the position: if you can converse about regression models, and clustering approaches, you'll be fine.  
Prior exposure to a statistical or scientific programming environment is helpful. If you don't have it, you'll become familiar while you're here.  We have a bias for open source tech, and work with the Python scientific stack, R, and various data pipeline tools.  
Excellent oral and written communication skills will help. You'll work with both experts in the field and business staff, so you'll find it important to be able to communicate appropriately with both as needed.
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Computing: Software
				
			
				- Theme - Data Analytics, Statistical Analysis and Mathematical Optimization 
				
			
				ENG - Electrical and Computer Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Software Engineering
				
			
				MATH - Computer Science
Application Documents Required: University of Waterloo Co-op Work History,Cover Letter,Résumé,Grade Report

Job Summary:
PCL Industrial Management is a major constructor of energy projects in Canada, and part of one of North America's largest construction firms.  Our Construction Services division provides professional services to projects to help them operate effectively. Our business is interesting, challenging, and risky, and we collaborate with internal clients and external partners to help make our projects successful. One of our functions is data science: the application of modern data visualization techniques, machine learning techniques, and artificial intelligence to develop insights and address business challenges. We are recruiting a digital design student for either a 4 or 8 month work term, starting January 2022. 

  

As a Digital Design Student, you will contribute to our team by: 

 

Designing and implementing beautiful visualizations to help interpret complex datasets in novel, intuitive ways 
Helping produce design briefs and alternatives for products in our pipeline 
Producing prototypes of data-driven products and analyses in multiple modes 
Helping facilitate design-thinking workshops with users, stakeholders, and developers 
Participating in Agile processes around scoping, planning, producing, and managing work products. 

This position has a twist. Contingent on successful early work, the team member will have a chance to build their portfolio through a capstone project. For the final two months, a portion of their time will be focused on a design-focused initiative, of value to PCL, of their choosing. You'll be supported while you: 

 

Develop a proposal 
Engage with the right people to inform your work 
Build your prototype or visualization 
Assess and present the results
Job Responsibilities: See above.
Required Skills:
What you will bring to the role: 
 

Currently enrolled in a postsecondary program 
Postsecondary coursework in digital design or interaction design  
Postsecondary coursework in computing science 
Experience using a digital visualization environment (ggplot, d3, bokeh, etc)  
Development experience, particularly in python and web environments, is a plus 
Flexibility to shift focus and work on anything from schematics, to prototypes, to stakeholder presentations and the underlying datasets themselves.

Job Summary:
Ever wanted to work with state-of-the-art flying robots? 


Pegasus Summary
 

Pegasus is a small business working on advancing the capabilities of industrial drones with specially engineered products and systems. Pegasus systems power high end electric UAVs enabling long duration flight times and long distance flights.
Pegasus is a small team comprised primarily of technical focused employees. Co-ops at Pegasus work on many different aspects of the product, which involves a wide variety of skill sets and disciplines in its design.
Pegasus is always looking for self motivated individuals who are able to find problems and learn whatever it takes to solve them. We'd love to hear about anything that you have worked on or have dealt with that involved problem solving and taking initiative.

Job Summary 

    For this position, we are looking for an adaptable and independent individual capable of taking on a list of projects, and working through them in a smart, efficient manner. This individual must be able to defend the design decisions they make while still allowing them to be fairly criticized, and adapting as such. These projects commonly involve a large deal of research to understand design guidelines and physical laws governing the behavior of electrical, chemical, and mechanical systems. 


This position will allow for the opportunity to work with cutting-edge industrial systems and tools, including CNC machining and multiple 3d printing processes. As such, any hands on workshop experience will be highly valued as an asset.
Job Responsibilities:
Job Responsibilities
 

Responsibilities might include any or all of the following depending on what needs to be done:
	 
  
Design, manufacturing, and assembly of test fixtures and prototypes.
Designing and manufacturing mounting brackets, with a particular focus on optimizing for weight.
Machining prototype parts.
Getting quotes for production, understanding 3rd party quoting structures and optimizing parts for said structures
Assembling multirotor UAV components from a combination of off the shelf and custom designed parts.
Plan and run engine tests.
Perform work in a safe manner above and beyond the basic safety guidelines provided by the company
Required Skills:
Essential skills:
 

CAD/CAM experience is a firm requirement. Please send us examples of design work you have done in the past to demonstrate your capabilities.
Machining and prototyping (if you have parts that you have machined/printed, bring them in!)

Desirable, but not necessary:

 

Design for manufacturing experience
GD&T 
MATLAB
Python
Fusion360 CAM

If you have any personal/team projects that can demonstrate your engineering capabilities, please bring them to the interview!
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Scientific Experimental Design and Laboratory Assistance
				
			
				ENG - Mechanical and Mechatronics Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Systems Design and Biomedical Engineering

Job Summary:
POSITION: Supply Chain Co-op/Intern 

LOCATION: Mississauga, Cambridge, or Peterborough available- You can clarify in the interview what you are open to 

DURATION: 4 or 8 month terms available 


Who are we?

PepsiCo is making a difference on a global scale, and so can you!  Competing in a dynamic, fast-paced industry, our ability to grow year after year is driven by our ability to attract, develop, and retain world class people who will thrive at PepsiCo. 

  

https://tinyurl.com/YourTalentOurStage

  

Want to hear from some recent coops and new graduates in Supply Chain about what they did as a PepsiCo Canada Supply Chain Coop?  Check out the link below to learn more: http://tinyurl.com/PepsiCoSupplyChainCampus 

  

What will you do in your first experience?

The PepsiCo Canada Operations Coop program provides candidates a diverse range of opportunities to allow them to gain valuable experiences and build their leadership skills. Pursue your passion, explore the Possibilities, and make an impact with an organization that invests in its people! 

  

Depending on the role that's right for you, you'll be based out of one of our world class manufacturing facilities in Mississauga, Peterborough or Cambridge or at our Headquarters location in Mississauga.  We will discuss during interviews what locations and experiences you are interested in, and while our projects and roles are very challenging, we can flex to fit your experience level and development needs**. Our coop projects and roles span a wide breadth of experiences in several divisions, including Frontline Leadership, Productivity Projects, Sustainability and Energy Conservation and Headquarters Supply Chain (see role descriptions below).  In all positions, you will work on projects that require you to perform cost/benefit analysis and balance our four key imperatives: cost, quality, service, and people. Most importantly, you will develop leadership skills through coaching frontline teams or by leading and implementing project initiatives. 

  

All of these experiences will challenge you to develop a strong foundation and network in supply chain. Many of our coops and New Grads come back for several different experiences, or rotate every 4 months.
Job Responsibilities:
Manufacturing/Warehouse Team Leader 

Lead a group of team members towards operational objectives.
Responsible for people and team development, quality performance, cost, service and safety.
Motivate your team to achieve established performance targets and coaching them on performance processes
Strive to identify and implement productivity and efficiency initiatives (ex. reduction of scheduled downtime, identifying loss points for raw materials, leading front line employees, process changes and product & packaging waste reduction)

  

Resource Conservation 

Through the use of Lean Six Sigma techniques identify and develop engineering solutions and SOPs to provide permanent reductions in water, electricity and natural gas.
Work with front line techs up to site level managers.
Develop or enhance existing daily/weekly/period performance reports.
Coordinate with outside vendors and the plant to execute process changes in the plant.

  

Demand Planning/Commercialization Business Analyst 

Take on the most current demand planning problems in PepsiCo Canada and use your business acumen and analytical skills to work cross functionally on complex issues that need resolution
This role is based in our Mississauga head office
Co-op projects are defined based on highest benefit to the business and urgency to complete
Experience the thrill of bringing your insights to critical issues and presenting back your findings to Executive Leaders

  

Procurement Intern

Designed to develop the intern's knowledge and skills in the procurement of packaging and ingredients both self and contract manufacturing
Learning experience will be focused on opportunities in data collecting and analysis of packaging/ingredient usage and pricing for the purpose of improving planning and forecasting processes and supporting on-going efforts to identify productivity initiatives
The Intern will be exposed to many of the packaging and ingredients purchased by PFC from granola bar wrappers to agricultural commodities (e.g., Potatoes, oats)
This role is based in our Mississauga head office and also spends time with our field manufacturing locations.

  

Co-Manufacturing Intern

Responsible for schedule & management of re-packaging operations in support of weekly sales requirements for displays
Responsible for working directly with 3rd party manufacturers to execute business plans & productivity projects
This role is based in our Mississauga head office and also spends time with our field manufacturing locations.

  

Engineering/Sustainability Intern 

Ideally suited to Co-ops who have already experienced manufacturing or logistics operations roles and have a clear desire to start their career in PepsiCo operations
Take on the challenge of supporting work in PepsiCo's Performance with Purpose Agenda.  Key focus is on activities and projects around our Planet initiative.
Demonstrate your engineering skills in problems for PepsiCo Canada Supply Chain including our manufacturing Sites.
Use your business acumen and technical skills to work cross functionally on complex issues that need resolution.
This role is based in our Mississauga head office and also spends time with our field manufacturing locations.
Co-op projects are defined based on highest benefit to the business and urgency to complete
Experience the thrill of bringing your insights to critical issues and presenting back your findings to Executive Leaders

  

Capital Project Leader 

Responsible for supporting Capital Project Managers in a variety of tasks
Scoping to install of manufacturing, infrastructure or resource conservation projects
Support our TPM group work towards continuous improvement
Required Skills:
What Are We Looking For?

 
 

Must be enrolled in an undergraduate/graduate Business program with an Operations focus or an Engineering program
Strong verbal, written, and presentation skills
Strong technical and computer skills, specifically in Excel and PowerPoint.
Outstanding organizational skills as demonstrated by your ability to handle multiple priorities and problem solve complex or difficult situations by anticipating obstacles and thinking ahead about next steps
A passion for and a demonstrated commitment to extra-curricular activities and/or community involvement
A demonstration of leadership and the ability to work well and thrive in environments where you are equally comfortable working alone or working as a key contributor to a team
Experience in a manufacturing, warehouse, purchasing, distribution or logistics position is an asset but not a requirement
Travel between PepsiCo locations may be required as necessary
Bilingual is an asset
Collaborative team-player with a "roll-up your sleeves" approach
Flexible and willing to work on off shifts (weekends or nights)

Job Summary:
POSITION: Finance Intern (4 month term) 

LOCATION: Mississauga, ON  

  

At PepsiCo Canada, we have great brands, great distribution systems and great quality products, all of which are led by great people!  To ensure we stay on the path of delivering great results, it is important that we continue to develop a deep bench of talented leaders.  Our ability to grow year after year is driven by our ability to attract, develop, and retain world class people who will thrive in the PepsiCo environment.  


Our people are our greatest asset.   By supporting their ability to work effectively together and providing them with the tools they need to succeed, we are ensuring that PepsiCo Canada is the kind of company where talented people of all backgrounds want to work.   The PepsiCo Canada co-op program will provide candidates with a unique opportunity to build their experience and leadership skills.
Job Responsibilities:
What Will You Do In This Role?

Reporting to a Business Unit Finance Manager, the Financial Intern will help lead their business team by ensuring pricing, trade spending, supply chain management, marketing spending, new product initiative launches, and large retail and marketing promotions to optimize the company's revenue and profit objectives. 

This is accomplished with a detailed understanding of the businesses revenue and profits drivers, a bias toward action and active collaboration with the business team. Activities will include: analyzing financial performance; identifying issues, risks and opportunities; developing finance initiatives for your business unit; support business forecasting and strategic planning.
Required Skills:

Enrolled in a graduate/undergraduate Business program with an Accounting or Finance focus
Interested in pursuing a CPA designation is considered an asset
A problem solver who can lead a multi-functional business team of marketing, sales and supply chain professionals
Keen business instincts
Outstanding organizational skills, with the ability to manage multiple projects and meet deadlines
Must be results oriented with a positive "can-do" attitude
Strong quantitative and analytical problem solving skills
Superior interpersonal and communication skills
Ability to work well in a team environment

Job Summary:
POSITION: Data Science Intern 

LOCATION: Mississauga, ON  


Are you hungry for an exciting and challenging opportunity in a fast-paced, diverse organization? 

  

If so, you have a future at PepsiCo. As a world class organization, we strive for excellence in everything that we do!  To accomplish our goals, we need talented, innovative, creative people who know how to work hard and have fun. 

  

Taste the success with Canada's fastest growing CPG Company and discover how our passion for growth creates big challenges and big opportunities: personally, professionally, and financially. 

  

At PepsiCo, we leverage an amazing range of technologies throughout our business; from mobile apps to advanced analytics, from cloud connected sensors to complex data integrations and everything in between. 

  

Reasons to Consider PepsiCo for your Co-op Placement:
 

Ongoing professional development to expand your business knowledge
Opportunities to work with a wide range of functional departments and leaders
Make an impactful change with your projects
Ability to flex work arrangements
To work with, and learn from business partners to gain key decision making skills
Take part in monthly department and company social events, such as social meet-ups, volunteer events, and PEP talks! 

Previous Co-op Student's Experiences: 

We've had co-op students of all different levels; Junior, Intermediate, and Senior, all have great, impactful terms! They were given the opportunity to work with various functions such as Customer Development, Sales, HR and Supply Chain; gaining business knowledge to provide key insights. 

  

Our students have made large impacts in providing visibility to the company, and driving key decisions to be made through the use of Tableau dashboarding. Whether it is Sales Forecast Accuracy, Sales Fundamentals, or year-end reporting, our co-op students are given the opportunity to make an impact and leave an impression on upper management with their data analytic skills.
Job Responsibilities:

Support project plan development, monitoring and tracking project schedule, and tracking issues and risks.
Consult with Business Partners to provide key insights using various Business Intelligence tools
Engage technology and business leaders to leverage business tools to solve real world business challenges
Oversee creation and maintaining comprehensive project documentation, plans and reports
Act as the point of contact and communicate project status to all stakeholders.
Support the Project Manager with generating project status and executive reports
Liaise with clients to identify and define requirements, scope and objectives.
Learn various data analytic tools such as Business Objects, Tableau, and more.
Become a dependable technology leader in the analytics space
Required Skills:

Motivated learner enrolled in a Business, Computers, Engineering, or IT related program
Experience in Project Management and/or Analytics from conception to delivery preferred
Motivated learner with the eagerness to enter the Project Management or Business Analytics fields
Previous work experience as a Project Coordinator/Business Analyst or similar role preferred
Exposure to Waterfall and Agile Methodologies
Solid communication, organizational skills, including multitasking and time-management required
Strong skills in developing presentations and reports
Strong working knowledge of Microsoft Suite (Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and Knowledge of SQL required
Working experience with Dashboarding (e.g. Tableau, Business Objects, Power BI) and Data wrangling tools (e.g. Trifacta, VBA Macros) preferred.
Hands-on experience with Project Management tools (MS Project, MS Teams) preferred
Fun, social, outgoing!

Job Summary:
Term: January to May 2022 

  

Locations: Brampton, Scarborough, Barrie, Ottawa, London, Ancaster, Halifax, and Moncton. Please include your location preference in your cover letter. 

  

At PepsiCo Canada, we have great brands, great distribution systems and great quality products, all of which are led by great people! To ensure we stay on the path of delivering great results, it is important that we continue to develop a deep bench of talented leaders. Our ability to grow year after year is driven by our ability to attract, develop, and retain world class people who will thrive in the PepsiCo environment. 

  

Our people are our greatest asset. By supporting their ability to work effectively together and providing them with the tools they need to succeed, we are ensuring that PepsiCo Canada is the kind of company where talented people of all backgrounds want to work. The PepsiCo Canada co-op program will provide candidates with a unique opportunity to build their experience and leadership skills. 

  

Position Summary

During your 4-month (possible extension to 8-month) co-op term, you'll be fully immersed in our operations, learning the business from two unique perspectives: 

  

Ground Up

During your first project, you will learn what it takes to develop and sustain a growing CPG business and stretch your current skills by delivering, selling and marketing our products to a set group of retailers. You will be responsible for managing our business with these customers from start to finish, including:
 

Delivering consistent sales targets
Understanding, planning and executing advertising displays in conjunction with customers
Performing inventory and cash management on a weekly basis
Merchandising product for customers
Job Responsibilities:
Building Critical Business Skills

As you progress through your term, you will have the opportunity to apply the knowledge you attained on the front-lines. Our Sales interns will work closely with our Zone Leadership Team and will be responsible for utilizing strong analytical and communication skills to help the team deliver results with our most important customers. Key aspects of this assignment include:
 

Frontline leadership training
Sales forecasting
Daily and weekly Area Sales reporting
Assist Zone Leadership with sales projects
Market execution projects
Other unique projects
Required Skills:
Qualifications

Completion of second or third year of a Business Degree
High academic achievement along with demonstrated ability to pursue other interests at the same time
A skilled problem solver who enjoys challenges
Strong oral and written communication skills and the ability to confidently interact with all levels within the organization, from front-line to executive
Valid, full driver's license, with a flawless driving record
Reliable and consistent access to a personal vehicle
A self-starter with the ability to plan work to meet objectives, set priorities and manage work schedule
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Business Administration
				
			
				- Theme - Sales and Business Development 
				
			
				ARTS - Business

Job Summary:
Operations Management Co-op 



Who are we?

PepsiCo is making a difference on a global scale, and so can you!  Competing in a dynamic, fast-paced industry, our ability to grow year after year is driven by our ability to attract, develop, and retain world class people who will thrive at PepsiCo.  

  

Follow the link below to find out more about our culture and commitment to Performance with Purpose.  We believe that delivering value for our consumers and customers, protecting our environment, sourcing with integrity and investing in our employees are not simply good things to do, but that these actions fuel our returns and position PepsiCo for long-term, sustainable growth. 

  


Operations Co-op Program

At PepsiCo Canada we're always on the lookout for great talent ? and that search often brings us to campuses like yours! So, why choose the PepsiCo Operations Co-op Program?
 

Early Responsibility: Accelerate your career progression with early responsibility and leadership
Make an Impact: Lead change in a fast paced, dynamic, and evolving industry where you can sink your teeth into challenging opportunities and drive for growth
Development and Coaching: Develop yourself and learn to develop others at a company where our People are a strategic priority
Mega Brands:  Make tangible impact on Globally Recognized Billion Dollar brands! Your friends and family can touch and taste the impact you make!
	 

At PepsiCo you will have total ownership over your success; by Delivering Results and Doing Things the Right Way your future possibilities are endless.  From our great brands, to our great culture; come for one experience, you'll stay for 10! 

  

What will you do in your first experience?

You'll be based out of one of our world class manufacturing facilities in Western Canada; Lethbridge or Taber, AB. Your role will be to lead a team of 15-30 frontline employees and manage through the challenges of doing so in a Supply Chain organization, including motivating the team, problem solving issues, and removing barriers in order to help "win the shift". You will hold responsibility for the operations of the department on your shift and will set the agenda for your team in order to enable them to achieve the Business Unit expectations in the Key Performance Metrics for the area. Ultimately your initial assignment will help to familiarize you with our day to day business and work independently in a fast-paced and challenging work environment on a non-traditional shift schedule.
Job Responsibilities:
What are we looking for?

Currently pursuing a degree in Commerce, Engineering, Supply Chain, or similar
Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills
Demonstrated commitment to working with and leading people
Proven problem solver and ability to manage competing priorities
Collaborative team-player with a "roll-up your sleeves" approach
Required Skills:
What are we looking for?

Currently pursuing a degree in Commerce, Engineering, Supply Chain, or similar
Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills
Demonstrated commitment to working with and leading people
Proven problem solver and ability to manage competing priorities
Collaborative team-player with a "roll-up your sleeves" approach

				ENG - Chemical Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Mechanical and Mechatronics Engineering

Job Summary:
PEPSICO BEVERAGES CANADA - Calgary Sales Intern


Get a glimpse of a real sales career at PepsiCo Beverages Canada during our 4 month Sales Intern Program! 


Who are we?

PepsiCo is making a difference on a global scale, and so can you! Competing in a dynamic, fast-paced industry, our ability to grow year after year is driven by our ability to attract, develop, and retain world class people who will thrive at PepsiCo. 


We believe that delivering value for our consumers and customers, protecting our environment, sourcing with integrity and investing in our employees are not simply good things to do, but that these actions fuel our returns and position PepsiCo for long-term, sustainable growth.
Job Responsibilities:
Start Building Your Career 

This is not a cold calling role. It is an opportunity to learn the fundamentals of sales and start your career with Canada's Top Employer for Young People! At PepsiCo Beverages Canada, the Sales Intern role is a stepping stone to our Sales Leadership Program, specifically designed to develop new graduates into future sales leaders. 


Make an Immediate Impact 

During your Internship you will contribute to our success by executing exceptional sales & customer service within your territory and team, while selling the world's best known brands, including Pepsi, Gatorade, Pure Leaf and bubly. You will work alongside our local field selling leaders to learn the business from the ground up.
 

You will bring some of the best known brands to life in store through exciting national and local programs like Super Bowl, Grey Cup, and NHL programs!
You will foster and build relationships with our customers to help them grow our brands
You will make an impact by achieving sales targets, market share, product distribution, and customer service targets
You will be part of a bigger team and have the opportunity to support branch targets by communicating with different departments
You will have the opportunity to be a part of volunteer opportunities, charity events or other passion projects through our Employee Resource Groups (ERGs)
You will be merchandising our brands and building exciting displays to grow sales
You will spend part of your internship taking on exciting projects related to delivering results and present your findings to our leaders
Required Skills:
You are available to work from January 2022 to the end of April 2022
You are graduating before August 2023
You are enrolled in an undergraduate program at an accredited University
You have experience with people - customer service work, volunteering, associations or societies
You have experience with a team environment - varsity or club sports, case study teams, members of an executive for a society or association are all great examples of team environments
You have the ability to work independently and get results - educational achievements or work experience count for this
You have time management and organization skills - managing your class workload, extra curricular activities and/or your work experience
You demonstrate solid communication skills - from school presentations, extra curricular activities and/or work experience
You possess a valid class 5 driver's license and have access to a vehicle - this is a non-negotiable job requirement
You are able to perform the physical aspects of the job involved in display building, and merchandising our products - you need to be comfortable lifting and standing for most of the day

Job Summary:
Peraso's software engineers develop the next-generation wireless technologies that will change how millions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. 

  

Software engineers at Peraso work in small teams designing features across various software layers, from real-time, hardware dependent firmware to performance hungry networking protocols and device drivers. Our software runs on various operating systems and is used for a variety of target applications, for example, networking, virtual reality and infrastructure. We need our engineers to be versatile and passionate with an ability to tackle new problems as we continue to push technology forward. 


The Device Software group creates software to run in an embedded, real-time environment on our multi-core ASIC. The firmware handles low-level management of the custom hardware peripherals, performance critical data path data paths, end to end management protocols and interactions with the host device driver. Additionally, we create tools and tests that are used to verify correct operation of our hardware and software across a variety of operating conditions.
Job Responsibilities:
Minimum qualifications 

Exceptional problem-solving skills. Be adaptable, proactive and willing to take ownership.
Strong written and oral communication, including a proven ability to clearly explain complex ideas.
Experience with software development in Windows and/or Linux environments.
Good knowledge of C/C++.
Proficient in one more scripting languages, such as Tcl, Javascript or Python.
Required Skills:
Preferred qualifications

Experience in or familiarity with object-oriented design practices and patterns.
Knowledge and exposure to one or more networking protocols, e.g. TCP/IP.
Familiarity with concurrency and multi-threading issues.
Familiarity with device driver concepts.
Experience using lab equipment such as spectrum analyzers, signal generators, and real-time oscilloscopes.
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Computing: Hardware
				
			
				- Theme - Computing: Information Systems 
				
			
				- Theme - Computing: Software
				
			
				ENG - Electrical and Computer Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Mechanical and Mechatronics Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Nanotechnology Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Software Engineering
				
			
				MATH - Computer Science

Job Summary:
Peraso Technologies, Inc. is a fabless semiconductor company specializing in development of integrated circuits for the 60 GHz wireless technology. Peraso is an original member of the Wireless Gigabit (WiGig) Alliance and a key contributor to IEEE 802.11ad specifications. Peraso's WiGig solution are aimed toward next generation of virtual reality, media streaming, wireless back-up and video monitoring systems. 


Software Automation & Tools is seeking a COOP student to design, implement and maintain Javascript and C++ frameworks & APIs to support test development. We need our engineers to be versatile and passionate to tackle new problems as we continue to push technology forward. 

We are seeking a capable student to migrate our automation interpreter solution from existing use of Qtscript to NodeJS. This involves rewriting custom C++ hooks for Peraso functionality from the existing JS interpreter engine to NodeJS.
Job Responsibilities:
Working with base distribution of NodeJS, provide compilation product for Windows
Develop build framework, modify and add WAF scripts for Peraso build system to create nightly builds
Research, design and implement host environment extension methodology based on NodeJS architecture for native extension
Rewrite Peraso native extensions current designed to work with Qt and QtEngine (Qt5) level of API to be called from NodeJS based script interpreter engine
Add proprietary extensions to the language as necessary to support Peraso automation test JS
Thorougly test the completed project by running existing Peraso automation tests currently based on QtScript
Required Skills:
Minimum Qualifications:

Extensive knowledge of C/C++ (Object orientation principles as it relates to C++, pointers, memory management)
Windows API knowledge
Good knowledge of JavaScript
Good knowledge of Python

Job Summary:
Job Summary:   

  

This is a machine learning co-op position with the AI & Analytics Team at PerkinElmer. Our company offers software and hardware (instrument) solutions to researchers and scientists across life sciences, health care, diagnostics, and applied markets (food, air, and water quality).   

  

The position is based in Kitchener, ON with the option of being fully remote.  


The Company:  

  

PerkinElmer is involved in the life sciences, health care, diagnostics, and applied markets. We have solutions in imaging, informatics, and detection through instrument and software products, as well as service capabilities.   

  

We offer a wide variety of software and hardware solutions for researchers in chemistry, biology, clinical & translational, and pharmaceutical development. Some of our instruments include mass spectrometry, chromatography and atomic spectrometry. Some examples of our software solutions include the Signals Research Suite, Signals Translational, ChemDraw, and more.  

  

The Team:   

  

We are the AI & Analytics Team inside the Advanced Research Group in R&D. As the central AI team across the company, we take on a variety of challenging Proof-of-Concept machine learning projects from various product lines. We spend most of our days doing the following:   

  

1) Building machine learning prediction models using advanced frameworks/libraries  

2) Training & testing these models using one of our blazing fast NVIDIA GPU workstations  

3) Productizing and deploying machine learning models   

4) Experimenting with advanced tech to automate most of the workflow  

  

Candidates should have an entrepreneurial spirit and eagerness to learn new tech/frameworks.  

  

Past Projects:

  

Newborn Disorder Classification: Using a set of key biomarkers in blood samples as well as demographic information we used a custom-built neural network to detect and classify disorders for pre-screening purposes with high recall.   

  

High Content Screening for Drug Discovery: We identified the most important cellular attributes that allow us to classify which substance the cell was affected by. We approached this problem using numeric and image data, using a combination of custom CNNs & transfer learning, and leveraging the PyTorch model interpretability library Captum.   

  

AI-Assisted Chromatogram Annotation for Mass Spectrometry: We leveraged deep learning techniques to learn peak annotations and account for domain expert corrections to chromatograms annotated by traditional peak-detection algorithms. We built an end-to-end machine learning solution that provided both local and cloud inferences using AWS ecosystem.    

  

This is just the tip of the iceberg - we've completed projects in NLP, deep learning, imaging, object detection, and much more!
Job Responsibilities: Involvement of full machine learning life cycle and software development using modern tech stack and machine learning toolkits.
Required Skills:
Technical: Python, Data Science/ Machine Learning frameworks & libraries (PyTorch or TensorFlow, Scikit-Learn, etc), Linux, Git, Remote Access tools: ssh/sftp 


Preferred skills: Agile mindset, great ability to research, team player, quick learner, self-driven, problem solver with an entrepreneurial spirit 


Other: Team Player, Quick Learner, Problem Solver with an Entrepreneurial Spirit

Job Summary:
Opportunity Overview


Come build product for a high-growth startup in the Fintech space. Reporting directly to the Head of Engineering, we are hiring two Software Developers who will work primarily in Javascript and with technologies such as React, Firebase, Cloud Functions, Cloud Firestore, Stripe, and many other modern tools and frameworks.   


This is an opportunity for students to help design and make an immense impact at a fast-growing company. You should value and practice transparency, have the humility to accept your weaknesses, and continuously strive to improve personally and professionally. 


About PerkUp


PerkUp drives employee engagement by allowing companies to issue pre-loaded credit cards to their employees to spend freely on perks they actually want, such as child care, wellness, fitness, home office, and education. These pre-loaded credit cards are marketed as "perk cards" and only work with merchants that are supported by PerkUp and approved by the employer.  


In today's work environment, companies must innovate beyond free lunches in order to effectively acquire top talent, improve engagement, and retain high performers. Outside of traditional benefits, it's difficult for HR and finance teams to deploy perk programs that are flexible, inclusive, tax-efficient, and easy to manage. Most companies manage cumbersome and cost-inefficient reimbursement processes or issue a cash stipend which is treated as salary.
Job Responsibilities:
Language stack: Typescript/Javascript, Go split over frontend and backend
Architect, design, and develop new features while using Firebase Authentication, Hosting, Firestore & Functions
Build components in React while leveraging a component design library
Integrate platform with Stripe Payments, Connect, and Issuing
Talk to customers and contribute to the product roadmap
Coordinate with product, design, and marketing on the release of new features
Take ownership, research, explore and deliver novel experiences 
Help define engineering best practices and processes
Required Skills:
You have experience writing Javascript for client-side web or mobile runtimes
You are familiar with modern Javascript language features, and tooling
You have experience debugging issues in a variety of browsers
You have an eye for great user experience (UX)
Willingness to go beyond what you know today
Good oral and written communication in English
Nice to have: experience maintaining and contributing to open source projects
Nice to have: experience writing Node.js applications, Go programs

Job Summary:
Persona is a Series B startup (raised $67M total in funding) based in San Francisco, and we're working hard to build the best identity platform for the internet. Our co-op's are full-time engineers who have a significant impact on our product and customers; they have full deploy access and push code into production from day one. You will work on projects that span technologies, systems, and processes where you will design, test, and ship great code every day. The work you do will affect Persona, our customers, and their users. Throughout your time here you will be working with our engineering, design, and product team on important features, communicating with our customers, and helping us build Persona! We keep our co-op class lean (typically 4 engineers) to ensure every single one has dedicated mentorship and gets to work on tough technical challenges and new product ideas that happen every day at this fast-growing start-up. We are expecting our co-op students to be full-time remote, but we also welcome students who want to move to the bay area for the term and commute to our office in downtown San Francisco. This is not required! 


About Persona's Mission


Every online interaction between an individual and a company requires a level of trust based on who you are and what that company will do with your data. Persona is the identity platform that helps organizations know that their users are who they say they are and keeps this sensitive data secure. Some of our customers include DoorDash, Robinhood, Postmates, Brex and Coursera!
Job Responsibilities:
As a co-op Software Engineer, you will be responsible for all aspects of product development. This not only includes design & coding of new architecture and services, but also measuring the impact that your product makes with our customers. We are obsessed with our customers and partner with them closely. We develop high-quality and scalable systems, including beautiful frontend UI using modern web technologies (React), distributed backend services in Ruby on Rails, and computer vision in Python. 


Part of the Team


You will be fully embedded with our team and working on actual production features. In addition to being part of the product team, you will be expected to jump right in to life at Persona by participating in weekly all-hands meetings, working with customers, and having regular one on ones with the CEO and CTO cofounders.
Required Skills:
Have strong CS fundamentals through a current pursuit of Bachelor's, Master's, or PhD degree in computer science, engineering, math or related discipline Programming experience.
We work with Ruby / Rails, Typescript, React and Redux, Android, iOS and Python. However, languages can be learned: we care much more about your general engineering skill than knowledge of a particular language or framework
Thrive in a collaborative environment involving cross functional stakeholders and subject matter experts
Take pride in working on projects to successful completion involving a wide variety of technologies and systems
Excel in a fast paced environment. Persona is an early stage startup and we have a lot to build!

Job Summary:
About Us

Phonic was founded by Waterloo grads and is building a next-generation feedback platform designed around voice and video. We make it easy for businesses, marketers, and researchers of all kinds to collect and understand audio and video feedback at scale. We are backed by Y Combinator and other great investors, and are quickly expanding. We're a typical early stage startup: growing fast, juggling multiple things, pushing huge projects weekly and having a ton of fun. 


We love to work with smart, fun, kind people who are passionate about building great products. 


What we're looking for

We're looking for a backend software engineering intern to help us deliver new data-driven features in our survey platform. You'll be working in our engineering team to quickly prototype, test and ship client-facing features across the stack. 


You are a code guru, with a track record of tinkering, hacking, and building awesome things. You thrive in open-ended environments with minimal hand-holding, and you over-execute. You're interested in algorithms, data, machine learning, or software architecture and you love to learn new things. You're comfortable reading and implementing a research paper. 


Possible projects

- NLP theme extraction across thousands of responses: Open-ended text is tough to understand at a high level, and extracting themes gives users the high-level takeaways. 

- Data platform/infra: storage, indexing, and analysis of audio and video. 

- Integrations with Google Sheets/Zapier: Users want Phonic to play nicely with their other tools, and a platform like Zapier enables thousands of other integrations. 

- API Rollout: We're launching the Phonic API soon, and need to bulletproof our API codebase and develop supporting materials, tests, docs, etc.
Job Responsibilities:
Responsibilities

- Design and implement features in Python 

- Use data science and machine learning techniques to extract insights from large datasets 

- Interface with databases, pipelines, messaging queues, APIs, etc. 

- Write and test production-quality code 

- Write supporting documentation and articles for new features 


Our Process

1. Understand a new problem, use case, or opportunity in Phonic. Work with design and leadership to refine the use case and scope out the feature MVP in a design doc. For your first project, we'll do this for you. 

2. Consider all possible solutions, trade-offs, and break the project into manageable sprints. 

3. Build it. 

4. Test it. 

5. Ship it. 

6. Get user feedback and improve it.
Required Skills:

Job Summary:
This position is working at the employer's physical location and is an essential service.
The employee is required to be on site working in the lab/greenhouse.

Corteva Agriscience has a Worldwide Canola Research Centre in Caledon Ontario.  The research centre is located 20 minutes from Brampton and 25 minutes from Mississauga and 45 from Guelph and Toronto.  The facility is located on the corners of Mayfield and Mississauga Roads.  We implement strong core team commitment, environmental stewardship, a leading sustainable future and cutting-edge scientific technologies.  As part of the Corteva/Pioneer team the candidate will learn professionalism and many transferable job skills in future positions.  Some skills may include understanding the techniques involved in a research facility, learning organizational culture, improving on verbal and written communication and excellent problem solving skills.  Currently, the Caledon Research facility is seeking a temporary greenhouse assistant to assist with various tasks involved with a research greenhouse.

Assisting in the care and maintenance of greenhouse canola research trials.
Developing, researching, and running several projects (examples, banker plant systems for pest control, trialing new pesticides, trialing biologicals/toxicity testing of biologicals, new scouting methods) to contribute to the successful completion of canola research trials.
Contributing to the overall operation of the greenhouse, facility, and labs at the research station
Experiencing many off-site events and opportunities such as workshops, conferences, trade shows, and tours, as well as networking with external consultants and contractors.
Completion of training courses, examples include farmers assistant certificate, working at heights, fall protection.
Job Responsibilities:
Responsibilities:

As a Facilities Research Assistant, students will:
Take ownership of the Integrated Pest Management (IPM) program. This includes weekly scouting, biological application, pesticide spraying, and conducting weekly meetings.
Assist with the ISO/RMS program by completing regular calibrations of scientific equipment, reviewing documents and training materials, and prepare for audits.
Providing support to research associates by setting up, monitoring and controlling greenhouses.
Assist with sourcing inventory for all research groups on site.
Assisting with other projects onsite.
Maintenance, indoor and outdoor, grass cutting, snow shoveling, greenhouse repairs and upgrades.
Required Skills:
Qualifications:

Completion of 1st year Biology, Environmental Sciences, Toxicology, Microbiology, or similar program
Experience in a research facility and/or greenhouse is considered an asset
Grower Pesticide Safety Course certificate is considered an asset
Ability to work in a team and independently
Good time management, organizational and problem solving skills
Ability to manage multiple projects and deadlines
Comfortable working in a variety of conditions
Good interpersonal skills
Meeting hosting/presentation skills
Ability to lift up to 50lbs

Job Summary: Pioneer Hi-Bred Production Company, a division of Corteva Agriscience, is seeking a hard-working, motivated, and independent co-op student for the position of Research Assoist - Canola Douled Haploid located in Caledon, Ontario.  Canola is a high-quality rapeseed used especially for its "healthy" oil and one of the major oilseed crops in Canada and Europe.  The successful candidate will be part of a highly successful and motivated multi-disiplinary group involved in canola improvement.  This position will be involved primarily in canola doubled haploid (DH) production and research activities to regenerate doubled haploid plants from isolated immature pollens.
Job Responsibilities:
Duties and responsibilities for this position will be as follows:

- Grow DH donor plants in growth rooms and sample tissue
- Transfer and culture embryos for shoot regeneration
- Subculture shoots for plantlet regeneration and transfer to soil.
-  Sample tissue for ploidy analysis.
- Collect tissue samples from plantlets for molecular characterization.
- Record research and production data.
- Assist with miscellaneous tasks such as cleaning, handling, autoclaving, packaging and storing laboratory materials.

This position will be involved primarily in canola doubled haploid production, research and routine activities.  Employment period is for three months or more based on requirement.
Required Skills: The ideal candidate would possess the ability to work under minimal supervision after an initial training period to achieve the research and production goals in a team environment. Good aseptic technique and attention to details are required.  Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and verbal communications skills is preferred

Targeted Clusters

				SCI - Earth, Environmental and Geological Sciences

Job Summary:
At Pixlee TurnTo, we look for talented, high-potential individuals who aren't jerks. Our proposition is simple: Pixlee TurnTo offers a unique opportunity to thrive and grow rapidly in a small-team startup environment operating at big-company scale. 


We're looking for determined and hungry individuals who thrive under pressure to join our Software Engineering team in Toronto. It will be your job to help us design, build, and deliver the Pixlee TurnTo platform to companies and organizations around the world to revolutionize how people connect to the brands they love.  


Our team is currently working remotely, with optional office attendance a few times a week. As the Covid situation evolves we will continue to evaluate our policy to ensure all of our team is safe, comfortable and productive. 


Pixlee recently merged with TurnTo, setting us up for an exciting year, come join us on that journey! 


Check out https://www.pixlee.com to learn more about us! You can also check here to read about some of our previous co-op's experiences working at Pixlee TurnTo
Job Responsibilities:
As a key member of our engineering team you will:


- Work closely with designers, PMs and engineers to tackle challenging problems in the ecommerce and content marketing space, and lead feature projects from start to finish 

- Use your experience to expand engineering best practices, tooling, QA/testing, documentation, and other key processes for our growing team 

- Lead projects across a variety of Pixlee TurnTo services including scalable back-end APIs, beautiful consumer-facing galleries, and our curation platform, just to name a few 

- Consistently challenge and influence the direction of our product offerings with confidence through both technical and user focused thinking 

- Leverage your expertise across the entire tech stack to build and improve our Rails and Javascript based applications at scale 

- Communicate clearly with the customer success team and customers themselves to ensure they are getting maximum value from all of our product offerings 

- Apply your infrastructure and scripting knowledge to support team wide DevOps initiatives and engineer enablement work
Required Skills:
Essential skills to help you succeed at Pixlee:


Product Mindset - Approach problems from the perspective of our users with a "product first" mentality to deliver intuitive and easy/fun to use products which provide maximum value to all of our customers. 

Engineering Excellence - Tackle projects with technical feasibility, efficiency and best practices in mind. Always strive to improve scalability and make the life of all other engineers easier through clean, reusable code 

Seek Ownership - Take pride in your work and strive to create an ever growing set of tools and features which resonate with you. Be comfortable questioning the status quo and always pushing yourself and others to rethink how we as a team approach problems. 

Pragmatism - Balance innovation and product stability effectively to continually push the envelope while meeting deadlines under quickly changing conditions  



Some of the tech you'll be playing with:


-Javascript (Backbone, Marionette, LitElement) 

-Ruby/Rails 

-HTML/CSS/LESS 

-Kubernetes/Docker/AWS 

-Elasticsearch 

-PostgreSQL, MongoDB 

-Scala/Play 

-Python
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Computing: Software
				
			
				ENG - Electrical and Computer Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Software Engineering
				
			
				MATH - Computer Science
Application Documents Required: University of Waterloo Co-op Work History,Résumé,Grade Report

Job Summary:
About the role:

Reporting to the Manager of Data and AI Governance, the Data Governance Analyst Co-op is responsible for assisting the Team to develop, implement, and evaluate a data governance framework that applies to the entire organization. This position will work with subject matter experts across various business domains within PointClickCare to understand and address data quality issues and help expand the data stewardship network to achieve data quality and governance goals. 

Data governance encompasses the people, processes, and information technology required to create a consistent and proper handling of an organization's data across the enterprise. This position brings value through the insights and recommendations from data analyses and collaboration with the business to enhance data quality, improve data practices, and enable strategic decision-making. 

As we demonstrate value from data, we are looking for knowledgeable, passionate, and curious people like you to join our important journey to advocate for data quality initiatives and evangelize the data excellence culture. 

This position has been created to support the expansion of the growing emphasis on data governance in a highly data-driven organization. The ideal candidate brings experience and enthusiasm in data quality, governance, and unlocking the business value from data.
Job Responsibilities:
Responsibilities:

Provide the Data Intelligence and Governance team with data analyses from researching systems and processes, profiling data, and validating data quality requirements.
Partner with data stewardship across the organization to operationalize the Data Governance framework.
Assist in developing data governance policies, processes, and documentation.
Support corporate data quality initiatives through guidance for data stewardship and facilitating solutioning processes.

Job Summary:
PointClickCare is the leading cloud-based software provider for the senior care market in North America. Driven by a passion for innovation and technology, we build innovative healthcare technology for seniors and their caregivers that improve their quality of life and well-being on a daily basis. Recently named one of Deloitte's fastest growing technology companies and Canada's best managed companies, PointClickCare provides vast opportunities and a great culture for our employees. We believe work is much more meaningful when you're doing it with a higher purpose. For more information on PointClickCare, please connect with us on Glassdoor and LinkedIn. 


If you are ready to tackle real challenges, and aren't afraid to get your hands dirty, this might be the right role for you. We are looking for someone with a curious mindset, who wants to explore and work on meaningful & challenging projects. 


You will be involved in troubleshooting issues related to the delivery of data between PointClickCare and our vendors, utilizing mainly HL7 messaging via the Rhapsody Engine. You will collaborate and work closely with internal teams such as Help Desk, SaaS operations, Development and Engineering to ensure that issues are promptly resolved. Additionally, you will work with our vendors and partners to investigate and troubleshoot issues and help resolve application/system issues related to data delivery.
Job Responsibilities:
OK, I am interested. Tell me more. What would my day to day look like?

You will investigate and troubleshoot various alerts received from servers and applications.
You will create documentation for knowledge sharing of problem resolutions and troubleshooting
You will write and execute basic SQL queries related to data analysis
We are always looking to be more efficient, and so you will participate in Process Improvement and Documentation
You may also be involved with Incident Management.
You will be participating in building automations.
You will be participating in managing cloud infrastructure such as AKS pods.
You will manage the CRM queue and action incoming cases and take ownership of escalated issues related to application performance.
Required Skills:
What qualifications we're looking for:

Superior communication skills
Ability to work with minimal supervision and take initiative
Strong sense of urgency with the ability to handle multiple priorities simultaneously
Team player mindset
Excellent problem solving and decision-making skills with high attention to detail
Experience with MS SQL and ability to write and execute SQL queries
Some automation experience using Powershell, Jenkins, Bash, Python.
Some experience with cloud infrastructure such as Azure, AWS or Google.

Nice to have:

Experience with Ansible tower.
Experience with CI/CD pipelines.
Some understanding of the long-term care and/or healthcare industry
Knowledge and experience in systems administration/network, Java and Webservice programming
Previous Experience in Software Engineering SRE or Quality Assurance type Roles

Job Summary:
Due to Covid-19, our employees continue to work from home. PointClickCare will ship out a work laptop/necessary equipment for your work term.


Have you ever wanted to be at the founding stages of defining and building a whole new large-scale SaaS platform?  Does finding solutions to complex issues and concurrently figuring out if it can also scale and perform not only have you curious - but drives that passion in you as an engineer? 


Operating in an Agile SW Development environment, you will be helping define and build our new Service-Oriented Platform, and enable solutions that service our internal systems as well as our external partners. These solutions can be a cocktail of apps, services, frameworks and maybe some pixie dust. 


Meet the Team:

The Product Engineering team is our largest business unit yet, and we are on a journey to evolve into a World-Class Organization. Although the leadership style may vary depending on who you will report to, there is a foundational approach that we live and breathe every day. These are the behaviors that are critical to us: 
 

We work in the open
We set public deadlines with concrete deliverables
We don't bury the lead
We make evidence driven decisions
We learn from our mistakes
Job Responsibilities:
You will help architect, design and build high-quality software, as well as work with the business to iterate over software requirements. 
You will work with Sensors, API's, 3rd parties, mobile apps, hybrid apps, and modern web frameworks (like VUE & React). 
You will collaborate cross-functionally with other Engineers, and business analysts to specify, design, develop, test, and implement software. They're all great people to work with. Trust me. 
Time permitting, debate Star Wars versus Star Trek.

What qualifications we're looking for: 

Excellent organization, critical-thinking and personal leadership skills
Self-starter with the ability to deliver with minimal supervision
Team player
Analytical mind with problem-solving aptitude
Some experience with Java language/ecosystem as well as the Spring platform (or similar)
Some experience with UI development and frameworks
Some experience using system and performance monitoring tools (e.g. New Relic) 
Some experience with automated testing frameworks
Some knowledge of relational databases (e.g. PostgreSQL, MySQL)
Enrolled in Computer Science or a related degree

Job Summary:
Points is looking for someone who is passionate about turning innovation (whether technical or process or both) into meaningful outcomes for the members of the loyalty programs we partner with, the loyalty programs themselves and Points' business to join our Product Management team for a position in our downtown Toronto office. 


We're an industry-leading organization that is continuously reshaping how loyalty programs engage with their members. We work with the world's largest airline, hotel, financial, and retail rewards programs, to tackle complex challenges and come up with innovative e-commerce solutions. If you'd like to be a part of it, we'd love to hear from you.
Job Responsibilities:

Identifying an opportunity and gathering requirements from the various stakeholders invested in its success.
Working together with our product design team to work out the user flows and, where appropriate, take the lead on wire-framing the solution.
Putting together a high-level business case founded on solid key performance indicators and, where applicable, working with our finance team to evaluate the financial implications of the innovation.
Pitching the business case to the Points leadership team and getting their buy in on moving forward.
Solutioning and working out a minimal viable product with the Engineering and Scrum Master teams.
If time permits, launching the minimal viable product, reporting on the early results and recommending tweaks that could be made towards the second iteration of the minimal viable product.

Job Summary:
Grapevine is here to help connect you with a role that fits your talents, interests, and goals without the complications of the usual co-op process. Grapevine has successfully placed over 100 students this year with dozens of companies around the world. 


Grapevine partner companies include: Polar, SocialFlow, Orbiseed, Unyte Health Inc., The Breach, Year Zero Studios, LetAlone, ToolBx, Nova, Georgian, Sentient Science, CAMH, and more. 


If hired by one of the companies through Grapevine, you will get exclusive access to The Collective - a learning program and community tailored to equipping you with everything you need to be successful in your career. This includes:

 

  - Monthly Summits featuring keynote speakers and AMAs with industry experts 
 
- Skill development workshops on productivity, public speaking, networking, work life balance and other important career skills 
 
- Social events with your peers to team build and network  
 
- Grapevine Bootcamp hosted by Kunal Gupta 


Through this program you will grow alongside other entrepreneurial-minded students, as you learn how to make the best of your time as a co-op. 


Grapevine is led by Kunal Gupta, Director for Year Zero Studios. Visit bykunal.com to learn more about Kunal and check out his blog.  


There are only 2 steps in the entire application process:

 

  1. Submit your resume and fill out a 5-minute self assessment 
 
2. Perform a 10-minute pre-recorded video interview (no live interview needed!) 


This process must be completed through the Grapevine website student application (https://www.grapevine.fit/for-students) 


That's it! You will be considered for multiple remote-work opportunities across the entire network of companies that hire through Grapevine.  


Only Grapevine companies that you express an interest in working with are allowed to rank you. Academic grades will not be evaluated as part of your application.

Are you someone who:
 

  - Has a solutions-first mentality and strong customer empathy 
 
- Enjoys solving problems, doing research, and testing solutions  
 
- Is interested in bridging the gap between business, technical, and design teams 

  

Then this role is for you! 

  

In this role you will: 
 

  - Roadmap timelines for products, from conception, research, design, and testing to the product launch 
 
- Communicate the strategic decisions you make with full transparency to internal stakeholders 
 
- Analyze large datasets and user feedback to maximize product value 
 
- Review how various departments within the organization interact, share and use information 
 
- Make recommendations on how to reduce costs, improve cycle times, and enhance customer satisfaction 
 
- Develop training procedures and guidelines to increase workflow efficiency

Students who are successful in this role demonstrate the following skills:
 

  - To be successful in this role, you should feel comfortable performing all the tasks described in the Job Responsibilities section 
 
- Quick learner and able to work under minimal supervision 
 
- Excellent written and verbal communication skills 
 
- Must be a team player and collaborate well with others 
 
- Organized and great time management skills 
 
- Passion for solving complex problems 
 
- Interest in developing practical business skills through workshops 
 
- Entrepreneurial mindset and desire to work for a small business 
 
- Identify as generalists who are open to developing breadth in their skills

Grapevine partner companies include: Polar, SocialFlow, Orbiseed, Unyte Health Inc., The Breach, Year Zero Studios, LetAlone, ToolBx, Nova, Georgian, Sentient Science, CAMH, and more. 


If hired by one of the companies through Grapevine, you will get exclusive access to The Collective - a learning program and community tailored to equipping you with everything you need to be successful in your career. This includes:

 

  - Monthly Summits featuring keynote speakers and AMAs with industry experts 
 
- Skill development workshops on productivity, public speaking, networking, work life balance and other important career skills 
 
- Social events with your peers to team build and network  
 
- Grapevine Bootcamp hosted by Kunal Gupta 


Through this program you will grow alongside other entrepreneurial-minded students, as you learn how to make the best of your time as a co-op. 


Grapevine is led by Kunal Gupta, Director for Year Zero Studios. Visit bykunal.com to learn more about Kunal and check out his blog.  


There are only 2 steps in the entire application process:

 

  1. Submit your resume and fill out a 5-minute self assessment 
 
2. Perform a 10-minute pre-recorded video interview (no live interview needed!) 


This process must be completed through the Grapevine website student application (https://www.grapevine.fit/for-students) 


That's it! You will be considered for multiple remote-work opportunities across the entire network of companies that hire through Grapevine.  


Only Grapevine companies that you express an interest in working with are allowed to rank you. Academic grades will not be evaluated as part of your application.
Job Responsibilities:
Are you: 

- Genuinely curious to learn, open-minded and resourceful 

- Analytical in your approach to most things in life 

- Likely to know your way around a spreadsheet 

  

Then this role is for you! 

  

In this role you will: 

- Gather, interpret, and use data to develop actionable steps that will improve processes and optimize results 

- Assess company and client needs, receive, and analyzes information, looking for trends or areas for improvement 

- Use data-driven decision-making to enhance the efficiency and effectiveness of a service, product, or system 

- Focus on solving organizational problems by analyzing processes, workflows, and systems to identifying opportunities for improvement 

- Improve, execute, and communicate significant analyses that identify trends and opportunities across the business 

- Use your knowledge of spreadsheet functionalities (like Vlookup and pivot tables) to turn raw data into meaningful information
Required Skills:
Students who are successful in this role demonstrate the following skills:
 

  - To be successful in this role, you should feel comfortable performing all the tasks described in the Job Responsibilities section 
 
- Quick learner and able to work under minimal supervision 
 
- Excellent written and verbal communication skills 
 
- Must be a team player and collaborate well with others 
 
- Organized and great time management skills 
 
- Passion for solving complex problems 
 
- Interest in developing practical business skills through workshops 
 
- Entrepreneurial mindset and desire to work for a small business 
 
- Identify as generalists who are open to developing breadth in their skill
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:

Job Title: Software/Full Stack Developer Marketing and Analytics Platform
Job Summary:
Polaris Intelligence is an innovative company developing cutting-edge online data analytics applications for businesses to gain market and consumer insights. Our online analytics platform provides businesses with indispensable strategic consumer data, as well as spatial and analytical intelligence for sustainable growth. Our clients range from individual franchisees, to Fortune 500 retailers, to real estate companies and international consulting firms. Ideally, the co-op will have web development experience and work on full-stack web development. If the co-op is less comfortable with development, the co-op student will likely do some QA. 

 
 

  We strongly encourage collaboration and sharing, informally and formally. 



Our quick twice-a-day Stand Up meetings are an opportunity to briefly share what we are working on, ask questions, discuss some challenges.
Our weekly Code Review sessions are meant to encourage team members to show their work to the team, ask questions about the code and best practices, and let the team offer suggestions.
During our biweekly Code Base Architecture sessions, a full-time team member walks our software team through a piece of our code base and we discuss how that fits into the overall platform, as well as best practices to use.
During our weekly Demo/Presentation sessions, someone on our client team walks the whole team through a presentation, demo, or use case that we worked on recently, so that our whole team can see the business applications of our company, as well as the business applications of individual components our team members work on.

Our Tech Stack

We use JavaScript in a Symfony framework. We want to use some React. We are also in the middle of implementing an API. Bring your toolkit of skills and help us make choices about our environment going forward.
Job Responsibilities:
Co-ops have the opportunity to make a large impact. Previous co-ops have worked on features in our full codebase like a full-time full-stack developer, customized functions and features for major clients, modernized the look of our webapp, developed a regression testing framework in Python from scratch, built on existing code to create new data products, and written the user manual that all new employees and clients receive. 


Possible Responsibilities:

Work on various web development projects with Javascript and PHP, hopefully with some React
Learn from and share knowledge in weekly code reviews, biweekly codebase architecture meetings, weekly demos
Software QA
Refactor code
Write monthly release notes for our webapp to communicate new features, capabilities, and offerings
Ad hoc support as needed
Required Skills:
Who are you?

You have programming experience
Ideally you are comfortable programming in PHP and Javascript.
You are high-energy, eager to learn, excited by new challenges, and a self-starter. Ambiguity doesn't scare you, and you're not afraid to ask questions when you need help.
You will also have the opportunity to wear many hats and get involved in many aspects of a business.
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:

We need your help to create a world-class experience for our users.
