Job Summary:
We're Pontosense, a proudly Canadian Wireless Technology company with a mission: to innovate and improve daily life. Our founders are world-renowned experts with over 480 patents, one of which was an original technology lead at BlackBerry from its inception. Their designs for smartphone antennas and satellites are the foundations for today's wireless technology. Currently, Pontosense has offices in Toronto, Germany and China, and works with some of the largest telecommunication, electronic, and automotive companies in the world. 

  

Why this, why now: Pontosense is launching our new revolutionary Wireless Sensing product, that is able to measure heartbeats and breath rates without wearables! We're seeking an individual to help pave the product roadmap and build our market traction to successfully deploy Wireless Sensing in the industry. 

  

The Role: We're looking for an ambitious and inventive individual to join Pontosense as a Project Engineering Co-op. Working in a fast-paced start-up company, you will have the opportunity to grow your skills with our team, who's passionate about innovation and collaboration. This role requires a high degree of critical thinking, efficiency, and organization, and will provide you with a unique opportunity to build the Wireless Sensing product roadmap from the ground up.
Job Responsibilities:
What you'll be doing:

Work directly alongside our General Manager Alex Qi and R&D team; you will need to understand and support product design initiatives, conduct research on technology and industry, as well as support business development operations surrounding Pontosense's Wireless Sensing.
Become a product expert; understand our sensor technology and its key features to help enable and build better traction within the industry.
Interact directly with clients and investors to build strong partnerships; you will need to lead meetings, create project proposals and facilitate product integration initiatives.
Oversee many diverse projects in an agile, project-based role.
Required Skills:
Who we're looking for:

You are an undergraduate student pursuing Engineering or Math.
You have previous internship and/or work experience. Experience in roles that demonstrate leadership is a bonus.
You have the capability of leading projects and doing data analysis identifying key trends
You are tech-savvy, a critical thinker and an efficient multi-tasker, who thrives under pressure.
You present a solid set of interpersonal skills; high EQ, positive attitude, and team player.
You have strong capabilities in Microsoft Office, especially in PowerPoint and Excel.
You have native written and spoken proficiency in English.

Job Summary:
With an overall co-op experience rating of 9.2/10, Powerhouse prides itself on giving our co-op students more opportunities than standard co-op experiences. Our students are treated like real employees. You'll get exposure to projects from cradle to grave - from design and programming, to testing, onsite and commissioning.

Previous high performing co-op students left their placements with job offers for when they graduate, many of which are now in senior engineering, management and VP roles within the company.

Learn more about our co-op opportunities at: https://powerhouse.ca/co-op/  

About Powerhouse 

From the start in 1992, Powerhouse Controls has been on a mission to be recognized as a world-class, single-source drive and automation systems integration supplier. The primary products and services we provide are:

Engineered drive, motor and motion solutions, and equipment
Custom industrial automation engineering services and equipment
Panel manufacturing (CSA or UL certified)
On-site, remote or emergency 24/7/365 service
Full turnkey solutions

We've built an enviable reputation as a global provider of state-of-the-art, cost-effective solutions with expertise in PLC, HMI, and variable speed drive installations. With our facilities in Canada, and the U.S. plus an international network of suppliers and associates, we've successfully completed projects across the globe including Canada, the U.S.A., Mexico, Europe, China, Japan, Thailand, and South America.

Powerhouse has a dedicated social committee, a friendly atmosphere, and a team of knowledgeable peers and mentors for you to learn from.  All of our projects are different so each co-op experience is unique.  However, each of our students is provided a real opportunity to make significant, meaningful contributions to the projects they are part of.  We firmly believe this is why so many of our co-op students return for multiple terms.  

What Powerhouse can offer you!

Competitive compensation packages
Hybrid model of remote and office work 
Worklife Balance focus; including flexible working hours
Culture initiatives including monthly social days, Christmas party and family outings such as Wonderland and ice skating
Newly renovated office with the latest technologies, large lunchroom, ping pong, and foosball and various types of working spaces

What it takes to succeed

A commitment to quality and service
Respect for others
Action-oriented
Dedicated
Detail-oriented
Critical thinking and problem solving
Hard-working
Honest
Humble
Positive attitude
Organized
Self-starter / action-oriented
Customer service mindset

To learn more about Powerhouse Controls, visit  www.powerhouse.ca .  Make sure you check out the "Meet the Team" section to learn more about the people you would be working with.
Job Responsibilities:
Key Accountabilities

Programming and troubleshooting of PLCs (machine/safety logic)
Programming and troubleshooting of HMIs (user interface)
Programming and troubleshooting of VFDs (motor control)
Hardware design (component selection and creation of schematics)
Factory acceptance testing (verifying functionality before we ship to the customer)
Commissioning (final testing at the customer's facility)
Various other tasks (as assigned by your Team Lead)
Required Skills:
Qualifications

Enrolled in a related program (Electrical, Mechatronics, Robotics, Computer, etc.)
Strong desire to learn how industrial machines work
Meticulous attention to detail
Ability to learn new things quickly and apply that knowledge to real-world applications
Excellent communication skills
Basic computer skills (Microsoft Office, etc.)

Assets

Hands-on experience with PLC/HMI/VFD programming (Siemens, Allen-Bradley, GE, etc.)
Familiarity with control system design software (ePlan, Electric P8, etc.)
Past experience working in a manufacturing facility (automotive, food, etc.)
Knowledge of application development programming languages (VBA, C#, SQL, etc.)
Valid driver's license with access to a vehicle for professional use

Job Summary:
If you enjoy working in a fast paced challenging environment with exposure to high-end projects, Pow Engineering is a perfect fit for you. Located near London Ontario, we are seeking a Civil EIT capable of thinking outside the box. Mechanical aptitude, experience in steel erection or fabrication, a desire for continual personal growth, and experience in project management are all beneficial traits for this position. We are looking for an individual to help manage multiple stages of the design and build process including (but not limited to) design, detailing of drawings, project management and quality assurance.  


Pow Engineering is a well established engineering firm that specializes in design, analysis, modeling, testing, and supply of equipment and structures for the automotive, aerospace, mining, transportation and construction industries. We take pride in the range and difficulty of our projects, as well as our ability to incorporate our high-end technologies to deliver practical solutions to site. 


Our areas of expertise allow for a range of exposure to various design and supply projects. We take tremendous pride in our aggressive mindset to take on new challenges made possible by our employees, reputation, office environment and the range and quality of our client base.
Job Responsibilities:
Range of Responsibilities:  Involved from Conception to Completion 

- Create concepts, designs and detailing of structural systems for various applications 

- Support installations and manage projects on site 

- Read and extract specific information from Architectural and Structural design drawings, specifications and sketches. 

- Prepare accurate, clear and concise detailed fabrication drawings, general arrangement plans, anchor bolt layouts, sketches and written instructions using - Tekla Structures 3D automated detailing software and AutoCad. 

- Review drawings to ensure completeness and accuracy. 

- Perform changes, additions and/or revisions as necessary to meet contract requirements. 

- Procure parts and materials. 

- Meet established goals and objectives and communicate project status to internal and external clients.
Required Skills:
Final year student in Bachelor of Science Structural/Civil Engineering program
Self starter with a high level of initiative
Strong attention to detail.
Excellent communication, interpersonal, organizational and visualization skills.
Excellent problem solving and critical thinking skills
Able to work efficiently and produce immediate results with minimal supervision.
Able to work with all types of people including fellow designers, shop floor workers, installers, project managers, clients, suppliers and colleagues
Experience with Tekla Structures or similar detailing software desired.
Manufacturing and erection experience desired
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Construction and Infrastructure Development 
				
			
				ENG - Architectural Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Civil, Environmental and Geological Engineering
Application Documents Required: University of Waterloo Co-op Work History,Résumé,Grade Report

Job Summary:
POW Engineering is always looking to add talent to our base of outstanding professionals. We have long participated in various cooperative education programs and have only but good things to say about it.  We wish to continue that beneficial experience for both parties:  students looking to develop their skills and determining their passion and future career, while we get to show them what we are passionate about and add to our professional fulfillment by being able to coach and mentor them. 

We are currently seeking a Controls Systems Designer Intern to join our team of experienced professionals located at our head office in Ingersoll, ON. 


Working with other highly motivated engineers, you will be involved with designing, programming, integrating, troubleshooting, and supporting new and existing automated controls systems. We treat interns as an integral part of our team such that you will carry out tasks just as if you were with us on a full-time basis.  We will work closely with you to develop the skills you may not have or wish to acquire.  We hope that in the process you will develop a passion for controls like we have. There is nothing more exhilarating than seeing our designs come to life;  whether it is programming or an electrical circuit design to make a machine move or operate a different way, we love when we can say things like: "you see that car over there, well we made the machine that installs and welds the roof on it".
Job Responsibilities:
Responsibilities:

Control system design
PLC programming
Electrical design
Design/programming of Human Machine Interfaces (HMI)
Troubleshooting of electrical, PLC, and HMI systems
Interfacing with real-time database applications to manage critical production information
Preparing functional specifications
Assisting with equipment selection and procurement
Site commissioning and installation
Performing other duties as required
Required Skills:
Requirements:

Enrolled in engineering degree program, preferably Mechatronics, Electrical, Industrial, or Computer discipline.
Communication is key for this position. Individual should have excellent interpersonal skills and ability to adopt to various working cultures.
Self-motivated, fast learner, and career interest in engineering.
Good technical background in electrical and/or process automation is an asset.
Computer skills (excel or database skills)
Proficient in any programming language, but preferably machine automation languages (STL, SCL, SFC, LAD, or equivalent), or AutoCad/Solidworks would also be an asset.
Able to legally work in Canada.
Canada Driver's license.

Job Summary:
About Precision NanoSystems Inc. (PNI)

Precision NanoSystems Inc. (PNI) is a global leader of innovation solutions for the discovery, development, and manufacture of gene and precision therapies used in oncology and rare and infectious diseases. PNI is enabling the future of Biotechnology by committing to our mission of accelerating the creation of transformative medicine that significantly impacts human well-being. We have over 350 NanoAssemblr instruments deployed worldwide (including the top 25 large pharma companies) and more than 200 publications that feature our technology. 


Position Summary

This position will be responsible for maintenance of various cell culture systems as well as the testing of various nanoparticle formulations made using NanoAssemblr platform to support internal research projects and product development.
Job Responsibilities:
Areas of Responsibility

Assist in the routine care and maintenance of various cell culture systems
Perform cell-based experiments to determine the biological activity of lipid nanoparticles in vitro
Perform routine validation studies to support product development
Support the optimization and development of new cell-based assays
Lead small independent projects on novel nanoparticle formulations including experimental design and reports.
Prepares Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs), reports and technical presentations.
Assists in the day-to-day management of the lab
Performs other duties as assigned
Required Skills:
Qualifications and Experience

A degree (or currently enrolled in a Bachelor's program) in a Life Sciences discipline.
Previous work experience in a related laboratory environment or completion of at least one previous co-op assignment.
Previous experience with cell culture techniques is a must.
Experience in analytical assays, strong analytical and troubleshooting capability.
Experience of cell and molecular biology techniques such as flow cytometry, ELISA, qPCR, western blotting, etc. is an asset.
Must be a resourceful, proactive, detail oriented individual.
The individual must be a team player who thrives in a dynamic environment with multiple tasks and aggressive deadlines.
Excellent communication skills.
Be able to work with minimum supervision.
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Pharmacy and Pharmaceuticals
				
			
				- Theme - Scientific Experimental Design and Laboratory Assistance
				
			
				ENG - Nanotechnology Engineering
				
			
				SCI - Biological Sciences
				
			
				SCI - Chemical Sciences
				
			
				SCI - Pharmacy
Application Documents Required: University of Waterloo Co-op Work History,Cover Letter,Résumé,Grade Report

Job Summary:
About Precision NanoSystems Inc. (PNI)

  

Precision NanoSystems Inc. ("PNI") is a manufacturer of instruments, kits and reagents in the global nanomedicine market providing tools for drug development and cell-specific delivery to study, diagnose and treat disease. PNI's NanoAssemblr™ family of instruments allow scientists to rapidly develop novel nanomedicine drug candidates for pre-clinical testing. PNI's NanoAssemblr™ Scale-up platform enables the translation of these drug candidates to clinical testing and eventually to commercial use. PNI's NanoAssemblr™ Transfection Reagents use nanomedicine technology to deliver genetic materials in primary cells in vitro and in vivo, enabling disease researchers to easily study gene function in high-value models of disease. PNI sells its products to leading pharmaceutical and biotechnology companies, and leading academic institutions in over 20 countries worldwide.  Please find more information at http://www.precisionnanosystems.com/. 

  

Position Summary

  

This co-op position will be responsible for assisting with routine analysis, improvement of analytical test procedures, supporting drug product manufacturing and characterization of nanoparticle formulations using variety of analytical methods to facilitate internal and collaborator projects and product development.
Job Responsibilities:
Areas of Responsibility

 
 

Perform routine preparation of various reagents, solutions and standards to be used for the testing conducted by the Quality Control group.
Conduct and assist with routine analysis of novel lipid nanoparticle formulations using a range of analytical instruments.
Follow Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) and conduct test methods (TMs) to evaluate the physical, chemical and stability properties of nanoparticle formulations.
Support development of novel lipid nanoparticle assays and impurities using the UPLC-CAD system.
Perform equipment calibration as required for GMP compliance.
Perform sampling of various raw materials and other components as required.
Maintain and replenish Quality Control supplies by ordering, and release of GMP materials for use in conjunction with Quality Assurance and Supply Chain departments.
Comply with Good Manufacturing Practice (GMP) and maintain strict and accurate quality control documentation of all test procedures and results.
Prepare Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs), reports and technical presentations.
Participate in the laboratory housekeeping tasks and ordering of laboratory supplies.
Performs other duties as assigned.
Required Skills:
Qualifications and Experience 

 
 

A degree (or currently enrolled in a Bachelor's program) in Chemistry or Life Sciences discipline.
Previous work experience in a related laboratory environment or completion of at least one previous co-op assignment is an asset.
Good understanding in analytical assays, strong analytical and troubleshooting capability.
Good understanding of nanoparticles and polymer chemistry fundamentals is an asset.
Experience of techniques such as gel electrophoresis, particle sizing, familiarity of pipetting techniques, etc. is an asset.
Must be a resourceful, proactive, detail oriented individual.
The individual must be a team player who thrives in a dynamic environment with multiple tasks and aggressive deadlines.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Be able to work with minimum supervision.
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Computing: Quality Assurance 
				
			
				SCI - Chemical Sciences

Job Summary:
Prime Design Build Corporation is a growing general contractor in the Toronto area that manages construction projects in the residential, commercial, institutional and industrial sectors from conception through successful completion.
 
Candidates will work closely with project managers, having direct access to senior staff with P. Eng., E.I.T. and G.S.C. credentials, and will gain valuable experience in the entire construction process; including on site assignments, preparation and administration of job budgets, control of changes, drawing control and dissemination, attendance at job site subcontractor and safety meetings, working with the project manager and site staff to achieve the project schedule, preparation of cost estimates for change order and audit purposes, and in general achieving the overall project goals.
 
Prime provides a flexible, dynamic, fast paced workplace, professionally managed in a positive team environment. Candidates must be interested in construction estimating and/or project management as a career.

The principals of Prime Design Build Corporation have hired many students from this program as permanent staff, and use this program to train and to prospect for future employees. 

For more information about Prime and the types of projects we've been involved in, visit our website at http://www.primedb.ca/.
Job Responsibilities:
Visit project sites to evaluate progress and to respond to customer queries
Coordinate with subcontractors
Create digital O&M manuals
Prepare bid packages, solicit and evaluate bids
Assist with planning and budgeting for projects, developing, preparing and disseminating documents, correspondence and materials as needed
Provide construction administration assistance, including issuance of change orders, contracts, and agreements for project
Monitoring long lead times interacting with consultants, clients and contractors.
Maintain cost ledger and job cost estimates and statements to ensure assigned projects remain on budget and schedule during construction
Review vendor invoices for accuracy and proper job costing and make the required changes prior to approval for payment
Ensure they are well versed in and consistently follow and enforce Prime's safety program procedures and policies
Make decisions to ensure that safety remains a top priority
Assist with accounts payable processing and payment

Computer proficient
Able to prioritize duties and work under pressure
Able to work in compliance with tight deadlines
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Able to demonstrate initiative and a proactive approach to daily tasks
Excellent interpersonal skills for working as a part of an effective team
Excellent organizational skills
Self-motivated and able to take responsibility
Punctual and reliable
Proficient in MS Excel, Word, Outlook and Project
A driver's license is required

Job Summary:
Did you know P&G products are enjoyed nearly 5 billion times a day?  With the strongest portfolio of trusted, quality, leadership brands like Pampers, Tide, Always, Pantene, Bounty, Downy, Febreze, Gillette, Crest, Oral-B, Olay, Old Spice, and Braun, we focus on improving lives through our people & products. P&G has been named one of Canada's Top 100 Employers for 12 consecutive years, and other recent accolades include Canada's 10 Most Admired Corporate Cultures, Canada's Best Diversity Employers, and Canada's Top Employers for Young People. Global awards include being named one of the World's Most Admired Companies (Fortune), World's Most Attractive Employers (Universum), and #1 on the list of the 40 Best Companies for Leaders (Chief Executive Magazine) for 3 of the past 4 years. 

  

The Product Supply organization integrates the contribution of Engineering, Purchasing, Manufacturing, Distribution and Customer Service in order to provide a sustainable competitive advantage in cost, quality, and speed to market.   Co-op positions are available at our Belleville, Ontario product supply location. 

  

The Belleville plant is the single supplier of Always products for North America and is the worldwide leader of product & technology development for our biggest category of Always products.  The Belleville plant has experienced significant technological and facilities investment over the past several years.
Job Responsibilities:
The Product Supply organization has opportunities focusing on process optimization projects in the areas of reliability, process control, and quality improvement in our Manufacturing operations. You will be given a detailed scope of work with varied level of responsibility, and will be exposed to many aspects of manufacturing during your term: project management, systems improvements, process engineering, etc. 


The Product supply organization is also looking for individuals to join the Engineering team where responsibilities will include the development, delivery and documentation of process and technology improvements to eliminate machine stops, reduce scrap and enable machine speeds increases on high speed converters, working with operating teams, other engineers and contractors. 


The work term can be 4 or 8 months. The starting assignment is determined by your skills, interest, and the needs of the site.
Required Skills:
Preference is given to those individuals with at least 3 years completed in Electrical, Chemical, Physics or Mechanical engineering programs at an accredited University. 


Skill Set P&G is developing and/or looking for: 


Leadership / Coaching Networking Technical Development 

Team Player / Collaboration Risk taking Organization 

Communication written / Oral Innovation Initiative 


Please apply online at www.pgcareers.com. If your skills match our requirements, you will be asked to complete two online assessments. Applications are reviewed on a rolling basis, so please apply as soon as possible.

Job Summary: Procter & Gamble is looking to develop the next generation of leaders in the world of technology. We are currently hiring for 8 month Digital Technologies (IT) starting January 2022 in our Toronto headquarters. If you are passionate about data and technology and wish to learn and grow continuously, a career at P&G is the right fit for you. Learn more about our Digital Technologies Internships in this video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QHUY7AHOsOA
Job Responsibilities:
In Any Position You Play, You Will Have The Opportunity To- 


You can expect meaningful work from Day 1. Depending on the team you join, you could, for example, lead projects that solve challenging supply chain problems, or drive digitization initiatives using the latest technology to optimize company's go to market strategy, or apply business analytics skills to improve brand building experiences, among other interesting opportunities.
 

Deliver results with measurable real business value
Build relationships and collaborate with others
Work autonomously and in teams
Use data, technology and innovation to drive business value
Communicate effectively on your work status and ask others for help to remove roadblocks as needed



We Will Support You By-
 

Providing a comprehensive onboarding so that you get to know the company, your role, expectations, perks and peers
Continuously providing formal and informal training opportunities, coaching & mentorship from your direct manager and others
Providing honest and constructive feedback on your performance throughout your internship highlighting opportunities for improvement
Adding you to the New Hire Network, where you can get support, guidance and perspective from other interns and recent hires who are in similar roles to yours
Giving you the chance to take part in any of our diversity networks, which include specific networks for women, LGBTQ, Francophones, among many others

A Passion for data and technology
A proven track record of leadership and success
Ability to build relationships and work in diverse, multidisciplinary teams
Passion about continually improving your capabilities and learning new things
Superb communication, problem solving and analytical skills
Ability to handle multiple priorities under pressure

What would make you a great fit?

 

You are currently studying towards a Bachelor's or Master's degree, with graduation planned in 2023 or 2024
You are available for a 8 month work term beginning January 3rd, 2022
You have a passion for data and technology
You have the ability to build relationships and work in diverse, multidisciplinary teams
You have excellent communication, problem solving and analytical skills

Students with Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics and Business backgrounds have typically found our roles to be a good fit with their interests, but we have had successful interns from a variety of other disciplines as well. Job Summary:
About Propulo Consulting

  

Are you looking to change the world of work, drive impact and know that your work positively impacts the safety and wellbeing of team members? 

  

The leading Safety & Operations Strategy Advisory firm. With over 15 years' experience, 8 offices and Global reach, our team brings expertise to solve the most complex Safety and Operational Challenges for a broad range of Fortune 500 and mid-sized organizations. 

  

Tapping into insights from brain science and psychology, we help organizations improve their Safety, Operational performance and Culture. 

  

The opportunity: Improving the world of work 

  

At Propulo, you'll have the chance to build a truly exceptional experience. We'll empower you with the latest research, surround you with high-performing teams, and provide the diverse and inclusive culture you need to discover your full potential. Through our internship developing programs, you'll develop the skillsets you need to stay relevant today and in the future. 

  

Propulo Consulting is seeking a dynamic and organized Content Writer & Communications Intern to enrich our digital contents, blog posts, publications, and marketing copy. 

  

If you're familiar with producing and writing content, development of communications and publications strategy and have an eye for detail, we'd like to meet you. We encourage you to share samples of your work or portfolio of published articles along with your application (Email: kyounghee.choi@propulo.com).
Job Responsibilities:
1. Communications & Public Relations
 

Working under the direction of our Chief Marketing Officer, prepare key messages, backgrounders, presentations, promotional items, executive briefing notes, story pitches, media releases, fact sheets and press kits.
Ensure quality of communications and their compliance with corporate standards; ensure all necessary corporate messages are approved prior to publication.
Ensure all internal & external communications are focused on strengthening Propulo's brand through strategic fit and appropriate tone and content.
Contribute to the development, implementation and evaluation of a social media strategy using consistent processes, templates and tools.
Conduct industry-related research on related topics (combining online sources, interviews and studies).
Assist in the development and execution of external communications strategy by working closely with Marketing teams.
Digital Marketing corporate messaging and ensure the brand narrative is accurately and effectively communicated.
Build and foster media relationships, including those with print, online and media outlets.
Develop and execute on a PR campaign to capture speaking and written opportunities in media, podcasts, magazines and conferences.


2. Content Writing & Development 
 

Review and enhance current promotional literature and content.
Develop a content strategy and research key topics.
Coordinate with marketing team to develop and support content schedule.
Develop marketing collateral and copy to support the successful launch of new service introductions.
Proofread and edit before publication ensuring all-around consistency (style, fonts, images and tone).
Preparing well-structured drafts of articles.
Working under the direction of our Marketing team, develop Safety & Safety Culture articles, Publications and white papers.
Creating thoughtful, unique, relevant and engaging written content. 

3. Our Team

 

Contribute positively to the Propulo culture and brand by living the Propulo values
Support our Propulo Team and Marketing Team 
Contribute to Propulo's team-based approach to business
Required Skills:
Qualifications & Experience

Journalism, Communications or English Literature student currently enrolled in a recognized Canadian University with an eligible internship. 

English language mastery (written/verbal) 

Ideally prior similar work experience in content writing, PR or communications are preferred. Preference for applied marketing experience in content development.
 

Strong written & verbal communication skills.
Effective time management and ability to obtain and organize resources.
Manage & organize work deliverables.
Strong words & presentation skills.
Have an agile, growth-oriented mindset.
Purpose driven with high initiative.
Detailed oriented and capable of conducting self-directed research.
Demonstrate attitudes of accountability, vulnerability, and a willingness to learn.
Be committed to integrity within a professional environment.
Urgency and responsiveness.

Job Summary:
The Price Support Directorate (PSD) is a group of professional accountants that provide expertise in price and cost analysis, advice, financial negotiation support, audit and other assurance services; in support of government procurement. 

  

PSD is comprised of three inter-related and collaborative groups.  The Price Advisory Group provides financial analysis services in support of contract pricing, rate negotiations and price certification. The Assurance Services Group provides professional audit and related assurance services of private sector contractors, in support of departmental, interdepartmental, and international contracts. The Professional Practice Group (PPG) supports the operations of the Directorate by reviewing and developing guidance material and conducting research in support of operations. Overall PSD, is an important support area to the Department's Procurement function and its clients. 

  

Successful candidates would be placed in the Assurance Services Group, providing them with an excellent opportunity to gain an appreciation for the services we provide and to contribute to the work objectives of the organization. 

  

The Chartered Professional Accountant (CPA) institutes of Quebec and Ontario recognize that the hours worked in this position comply with the practical experience requirements to obtain a CPA designation. These hours would not be considered towards the practical experience requirements for public accounting purposes. 

  

Successful completion of both your educational program and a minimum of two work terms with the CO-OP Program, or one term with the CO-OP Program  plus  a Federal Student Work Experience Program (FSWEP) work assignment may lead to temporary or permanent federal public service positions for which you meet the merit criteria and conditions of employment.

Job Summary:
Overview 

PulseMedica is looking for a Junior Software Engineer to join our team at our Edmonton location. This person is responsible for integrating with our software team. They will be focused on developing our desktop application alongside our hardware and software interfaces. We are looking for a candidate who will be able to help program well-constructed, testable and scalable code. 


The ideal candidate will have a broad technical background, with a solid understanding of C++, Java, and C# programming. This person has a natural curiosity for building effective solutions, is a team player, patient and has effective communication skills. 


About the Company

PulseMedica is an Edmonton-based company with a very bright future. We are developing a medical device to treat eye conditions. Our vision is to revolutionize retinal treatments to provide patients with exceptional outcomes and, ultimately, change the world by preventing blindness resulting from eye diseases. 

In 2020, PulseMedica graduated from one of the most successful technology and business accelerator programs in North America called Creative Destruction Labs (CDL). This experience has solidified PulseMedica's determination to become a billion-dollar firm. 

Our focus is now on developing a state-of-the-art 3-dimensional eye imaging and high precision laser surgery medical robot, and we're looking for exceptional engineers to join us and be part of making our vision a reality. 


The Opportunity

The Jr. Software Engineer role provides a unique opportunity to work with a group of talented and energetic people and to contribute towards setting the direction for the company's future technology. The successful candidate will actively work within our team of scientists and engineers for projects involving development of new technologies, concept engineering and new product development in the ophthalmic medical device industry. 

  

Duration: 16 weeks, Temporary Full Time (Monday to Friday at 8 hours per day or 40 hours per week) 


Schedule: 8 Hour Shift, Monday to Friday
Job Responsibilities:
The person will support the following:

Data acquisition from hardware devices
Basic image processing
Programming microcontrollers
Development of the Medical Application UI
Investigating new technologies and software methods   

Responsibilities include:

Communicating with internal stakeholders to gather requirement
Providing support to the hardware team to facilitate their testing and development
Working with the hardware team to integrate hardware and software
Writing short progress reports to help the team understand your accomplishments and challenges you faced/are facing
Doing solution analysis to quantifiably compare different methods of solving a problem
Documenting implemented solutions
Required Skills:
Requirements

Bachelor of Computer Science degree (completed or in progress), Computer Engineering Degree, Software Engineering Degree, or other equivalent education.
Strong programming skills and experience in one of C++, Java, C#, C, or golang.
Strong grasp of structured and clean programming with a focus on high efficiency and performance.
A self-motivated team player who is comfortable and adaptable with working in a dynamic and high-paced environment.

Experience:

Computer Programming (Object Oriented): 1 year (Required)
GitHub (Preferred)
Agile Methodologies (Preferred)
Image Processing (Preferred)

Education: Bachelor's Degree in progress or completed (Required) 


Highly Desired Skills and Experience:

Experience with image processing tools such as VTK, OpenCV, or other similar tools.
Experience javascript/typescript or another scripting language
Experience using any unit testing framework but gtest preferred
Experience working with FPGA 
Familiarity with early-stage product development in the medical device industry and good documentation practices.
Microprocessor programming
GitHub
Agile development methodologies
CUDA/GPU programming

Preferred Skills and Experience with:

OCT, SLO or similar imaging devices
Algorithms, application development and optical imaging systems
Experience with React and/or Electron
Experience in high-speed data handling and management, GUI design, project planning and defect management

Job Summary:
PURPOSE BUILDING - SUSTAINABILITY ANALYST

Do you love wicked problems? Do you like continuously improving what you are producing? Do you think learning is really fun? Do you think buildings must be good citizens of their community? So do we! Join Purpose Building and let's go Farther Faster, together!
 
WHO WE ARE
We created Purpose Building to accelerate real estate toward planet-positive pathways. We draw out the best of everybody to create a better future through healthy, circular, low-carbon, financially successful buildings.
 
We deliver market-leading strategies to achieve leading edge performance for new and existing facilities. We aim to be the premier provider of this service in the geographies we serve.
 
Our core values are:

Team Success - enable great lives for each other through commitment to the Mission
Collaboration Excellence - highly effective knowledge-building, partnerships and communication
Social Responsibility - contribute to the success of the communities we live and work in
Honesty - what you say is what you do
Job Responsibilities:
WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING
As a Sustainability Analyst, you will be responsible for analysis that supports delivering high performance design strategies on projects and maintaining the firm's best-in-class knowledge and reputation with respect to building performance. To achieve this, you will: 

Engage in continual learning to apply principles of energy/carbon/material flows in buildings, human comfort and business performance to contribute solutions to climate change
Research relevant real estate trends and technologies
Perform calculations, report on outcomes of the analysis and prepare presentations to help the team develop high performance design solutions for new and existing buildings
Contribute to the development of new ideas, workflows and tools for the Company
Apply problem-solving, communication, critical thinking and interpersonal skills
Required Skills:
WHO YOU ARE
We work with individuals who take initiative, enjoy solving difficult problems, listen very well and express themselves clearly, bring passion to their work, are fun to be with, are adaptable and are invested in personal betterment.
 
The skills and experience you bring include:

Proficiency in written and oral communication, using Excel, Word and PowerPoint
Best of market problem-solving, critical thinking and communication skills
Working knowledge of some of the following: Sustainability / Sustainable Design, Construction, Operations and Management, Real Estate, Business Management or Finance
Ability to deliver results that meets the scope, budget and schedule
At least 3 years of undergraduate studies in Architecture, Architectural Science/Technology, Mechanical/Electrical/Civil Engineering, Construction or Building Science
LEED GA/AP or WELL GA/AP accreditation is an asset

Job Summary:
PwC Canada
 

Our purpose is to build trust in society and solve important problems. Our shared global values help us achieve our purpose and guide our actions. We act with integrity, make a difference, care, work together and reimagine the possible. 

  

At PwC, we work together to provide exceptional industry-focused services to clients from 26 offices across Canada. We're a member of the PwC network of firms, with more than 223,000 people in 157 countries. 

  

Our culture

  

We pride ourselves on providing equal opportunities for success and development, with leaders focused on ensuring everyone's success. We work together and create an environment that's fun and social, where everyone can bring their passions and whole selves to work. Plus, as part of a global network, there's opportunity to work with international teams and clients while based in Canada or as part of a global secondment. 

  

The role 

  

PwC's Actuarial professionals use complex financial and statistical theories to calculate the likelihood of events - anything from a natural disaster to a wholesale IT system failure - to help our clients understand uncertainties and what that means financially for them. We help clients evaluate these risks by carrying out complex calculations and developing forecast models. It's highly technical work that is also challenging and creative, as you find new and innovative ways to distill complex findings into easy-to-digest information for clients. 


What you'll benefit from

  

We provide industry-leading opportunities to develop you as a professional, while ensuring flexibility for you to pursue your personal interests. With us, you'll have a clear career path, leaders who care about and support your development and many learning and development opportunities on and off the job. 

  

Our Enhanced Working Practices really set us apart. We teach rather than tell, developing you through shadowing, lessons learned, team workshops, rounds and observation, and feedback. 


We recognize the importance of providing flexible ways to work, so we've developed a variety of flexibility programs to help our people make the most of their working time. We're also flexible in the way we work and how we embrace technology like Google Hangouts and tools for work. 

  

Benefit from where you work - join us and seize the opportunity of a lifetime.
Job Responsibilities:
Actuarial Services at PwC offers consulting services to insurance companies, reinsurance companies and government agencies, as well as audit support for various insurance entities. You will work directly with our actuaries and other actuarial associates on a wide range of projects to gain invaluable working experience in the insurance industry and exposure to a multitude of actuarial concepts. 

  

As a co-op student in our LIfe Actuarial Services practice, you'll work as part of a team of problem solvers, helping to solve complex business issues from strategy to execution. Responsibilities include but are not limited to:  

  

- Acting as the actuarial specialist in audit support engagements, including analysis and review of product features, valuation methodologies and assumptions, valuation processes and data, experience studies, FCT reports and regulatory capital reporting 

- Working on IFRS 17 implementations, insurance systems modernization, model governance and AXIS modelling 

- Assisting with Appointed Actuary and actuarial liability valuation work 

- Supporting other strategic analysis work or ad-hoc projects
Required Skills:
What you'll bring to this role::  

  

- An interest in upskilling for a digital world and technology trends, an openness to learning new tools and adapting how you work 

- A demonstrated commitment to valuing differences and working alongside diverse people and perspectives 

- Basic knowledge of actuarial theories, insurance products, and prior actuarial work experience 

- Strong technical skills using Moody's AXIS and MS Office suite 

- Strong written and verbal communication skills to articulate ideas 

- Strong analytical and problem solving skills with strong attention to detail 

- Ability to manage multiple, concurrent priorities and work effectively under tight timelines 

- Ability to work independently and effectively as a part of a team 

- Commitment to providing excellent client service 

- An entrepreneurial mindset and passion to make a difference for our people and clients 

- Working towards a bachelor degree in actuarial science or related degree 

- Successfully completed 2 or more SOA/CAS exams 

- Proven ability working with data analytic tools (e.g. Tableau, Alteryx) considered an asset 

- Bilingual proficiency in English and French considered an asset
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Insurance and Risk Management 
				
			
				MATH - Statistics and Actuarial Science
Application Documents Required: University of Waterloo Co-op Work History,Cover Letter,Résumé,Grade Report

Job Summary:
PURPOSE OF POSITION 
The purpose of the Process Engineering Co-op position is to help manage manufacturing engineering projects from start to finish.  This position will be the primary internal contact for customers and suppliers. The position will help maintain and improve manufacturing processes, launch new manufacturing processes, and lead root cause analyses and corrective action teams.
 
NATURE AND SCOPE OF POSITION 
The Process Engineering Co-op position will report directly to the Lead Process Engineer.  The position interacts with Managers, Supervisors, Team Leaders, Operators, Skilled Trades, and Quality personnel from all departments in order to assure an ongoing state of the art and high quality manufacturing processes which meets all defined requirements.
 
This position will provide the technical leadership, guidance and expertise to ensure all manufacturing processes follow best practices as defined by the PWO Group.  This position works in conjunction with the PWO Group and Engineering Teams to understand and to ensure that all international codes, customer and PWO Group specifications and standards are executed to maintain the best practice as defined by the PWO Group.
 
This position is responsible for his/her own work and assignments and may direct the work of others within all other departments.  The incumbent must be able to travel internationally and be able to adapt to different cultures.
Job Responsibilities:
1. Provides technical leadership, (from the front), guidance and expertise to ensure the manufacturing processes follow best practices as defined by the PWO Group.
2. Works together with Project Managers and Quality Engineers on new and continuous improvement projects from the start to finish of each project.
3. Understands and ensures that all international codes, customer and PWO Group specifications and standards are executed to maintain the best practices as defined by the PWO Group.
4. Creates protocols and specifications, manages the progress of processes from design to implementation, and gets the necessary sign-offs prior to start of production.
5. Analyzes all processes and continuous improvement initiatives for safety, preventative maintenance, process optimization, and upgrade purposes.
6. Aids continuous improvement activities through the review of current work instructions, procedures, and assembly schedules to ensure the best practice as defined by the PWO Group, (set this up via an audit schedule).
7. Evaluates existing and future state product designs and their processes, (capability, sustainability and capacity), at the appropriate stages of fabrication of the production systems by integrating with the Product/Process Engineering and Project Management teams to achieve the highest levels of safety, quality and production (our target is zero defects and zero ppm).
8. Generates and archives continuous improvement activities, root cause analyses, countermeasure activities, 8D reports, and training procedures to show a record of these activities.
9. Manages the costs and expenses for all TPM and PM activities in the efforts to control and reduce costs.
10. Any other job related duties as may be assigned from time to time by the Manager and management team.
Required Skills:
Education: Enrollment in a post-secondary education; preferably in Mechanical Engineering.
 
Knowledge and Skills:  Strong engineering knowledge, both practical and theoretical, with a focus in manufacturing, assembly and welding techniques are ideal.  Strong analytical thinking and problem solving skills are essential.  Mechanical design and CAD experience are beneficial.   
 
Communication Skills:  Strong oral and written communication skills are required for normal technical/business communication, both internally and externally.  Must be able to use new technologies and various media to communicate effectively and efficiently with the headquarters, external institutions, systems suppliers, and customers.  Strong computer skills are essential. 
 
Nature and Length of Experience:  Similar experience in an automotive manufacturing environment is an asset.
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Manufacturing and Process Engineering
				
			
				- Theme - Professional and Technical Writing 
				
			
				ENG - Mechanical and Mechatronics Engineering
Application Documents Required: University of Waterloo Co-op Work History,Résumé,Grade Report

Job Summary:
QBuild Corporation is a rapidly growing, progressing software systems developer. We specialize in Engineering software integrating CAD and ERP systems, and healthcare charting systems. Our partners include CAD systems such as SOLIDWORKS, Autodesk, PTC, etc., and manufacturing ERP systems such as SAP, Oracle, Epicor, etc. We invest in providing the best environment possible for employees to maintain a healthy and balanced workplace. 


We require a vibrant and exceptional Engineering intern to help drive business development and think of innovative keys to success. The successful applicant will be comfortable in a small company environment. This position is ideal for applicants with a technical background who want to learn more about the business side of engineering and manufacturing.
Job Responsibilities:
Tasks:

Evaluating and classifying important paperwork
Assisting sales with presentations and proposals
Taking incoming calls and inquiries
Data entry into CRM
Testing software and building/updating documentation
Marketing activities such as social media, preparation for trade shows, etc.
Learning about our products and shadowing professionals in the field
Manage software implementation projects for engineering teams
Miscellaneous tasks assigned by the sales team

QBuild has partnered with many large software companies and one critical success factor is being able to be effective within large organizations. The successful candidate will be able to understand the tools and effective motivation methods to drive development.
Required Skills:
Key Qualifications:

Business development skills - able to recognize a product niche/opportunity
Able to apply technical background in a business environment
Strong English communication skills
Ability to work with minimal supervision. Must be a self-starter.
Strong analytical skills
Quick learner
Proficient in Microsoft Office programs including Excel and Word
Work between developers and the sales team to determine the best fit solution
Familiar with CAD and ERP is an asset
Working towards an engineering degree is an asset.

				- Theme - Computing: Quality Assurance 
				
			
				- Theme - Computing: Software
				
			
				ENG - Electrical and Computer Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Mechanical and Mechatronics Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Software Engineering
				
			
				MATH - Computer Science

Job Summary:
QM Environmental is one of Canada's largest full-service industrial and environmental contractors. Always committed to health, safety and environment, QM has been experiencing consistent growth and we would like to invite you to be part of our team. 


We offer exciting career growth, professional development, and a culture that is supported by teamwork and open communication. At QM, you will have the opportunity to learn from, and collaborate with, some of the most talented professionals and innovative leaders in the industry. 



POSITION SUMMARY:

QM is currently seeking a Co-op Student (Surveying) to join our team for the January to April 2022 work term for the delivery of a major project in downtown Toronto.
Required Skills:
QUALIFICATIONS:

Currently enrolled in a University or College program related to civil, geomatics or survey engineering, survey science or geomatics technology

Have a valid Drone Pilot Certificate or able to acquire a Drone Pilot Certificate issued by Transport Canada

Experience in scheduling, ordering, field supervision, quality control, field data collection

Job Summary:
QM Environmental is one of Canada's largest full-service industrial and environmental contractors. Always committed to health, safety and environment, QM has been experiencing consistent growth and we would like to invite you to be part of our team. 


We offer exciting career growth, professional development, and a culture that is supported by teamwork and open communication. At QM, you will have the opportunity to learn from, and collaborate with, some of the most talented professionals and innovative leaders in the industry. 


POSITION SUMMARY

  

QM Environmental is seeking a co-op engineering student for the January to April 2022 term, with opportunity working at a large scale environmental remediation project in Downtown Toronto. 

  

A Co-op Engineering Student is responsible for the following duties:
 

Assist Project Managers, Coordinators, Administrators, and Site Superintendents on a daily basis, providing support as required
Assist with oversee operational staff and monitor the activities of subcontractors
Implementation of safety and quality control plans and programs
Focus on project management support for the team, to ensure deliverables are met and client requirements are sourced in a timely and professional manner
General office support duties will involve data entry, tracking, and word processing
General field support duties daily tracking, reporting, quality control testing, and construction oversight
Job Responsibilities:
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

Assist Project Managers, Site Superintendents, Coordinators, and Administrators with project related tasks as needed
Field level tracking of personnel, equipment, materials, and subcontractors
Completion of daily field packages for project level data capture
Assist quality control personnel with daily testing and coordination with third party subcontractors for testing of various construction materials (i.e. geosynthetics, aggregates, clay) and geotechnical soils testing
Assist site superintendent and surveyor with field layout, quantity takeoffs, material tracking, and grades to support construction and excavations
Assist with field level implementation of safety, quality, and construction implementation plans
Potential to assist Project Managers and Coordinators with the preparation of bids for other projects including assisting with quotes, cost estimating, and technical proposal writing
Read, understand and follow Corporate Health and Safety Program, Policy and Procedures
Ensures health and safety is considered in the performance of all activities
Consistently act as a leader, mentor and role model with respect to QM LP's Health and Safety Program, both on and off the work site
Commit to positively influence QM LP's Safety Culture
Required Skills:
QUALIFICATIONS, SKILLS AND KEY COMPETENCIES

  

Education:

 

Enrolled in an undergraduate program majoring in Civil, Geotechnical, or Environmental Engineering

  

Experience:

 

Construction industry exposure / experience and project management
Excellent analytical ability
Construction materials testing and/or geotechnical soil testing
Surveying, AutoCAD, Trimble
Data tracking, entry, and review

  

Knowledge:

Of environmental legislation, standards, and guidelines related to contaminated sites and civil construction
An understanding of engineering design, tender, and construction management processes and related contractual conditions for a variety of remediation technologies

  

Abilities:

To assist management, technical, and field operations personnel and external consultants to execute technically challenging environmental construction projects
To communicate effectively with Field Personnel, Project Managers, and Regional Manager
To work effectively with various computer software applications such as spreadsheets (Microsoft Excel or similar), project management and scheduling (Microsoft Project or similar), financial accounting (Microsoft Dynamics, Coupa, or similar)

  

Personal Suitability:

Excellent time management skills
Exceptional organization and communication skills
Takes initiative and has good work ethic
Maintain effectiveness to changing priorities
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Work effectively with various computer software
Ability to manage deadlines; multi-task
Strive for efficiency without sacrificing quality
Ability to work independently as well as a team member
Effective problem solving skills; ability to make decisions
Ability to manage all personality types
Ability to work with individuals at all levels



WORK ENVIRONMENT

 
 

Work is primarily in the field at a large environmental construction project located in Toronto, but may require infrequent travel to QM's corporate office in Mississauga for training or reporting
Candidates must be able to successfully complete a project specific criminal record/background check

				ENG - Civil, Environmental and Geological Engineering
				
			
				ENV - Environment, Resources and Sustainability
				
			
				ENV - Geography and Environmental Management
				
			
				ENV - Geomatics

Job Summary:
Our HQ is in San Francisco, CA a Y-Combinator backed company that helps secure smart contracts at scale using computer-aided reasoning tools, with a mission to help boost adoption of this exponentially growing technology.

Work with a diverse and talented team of PhDs from UWaterloo and security professionals with a wealth of experience. We come from companies like Google, Facebook, Apple, Goldman Sachs, BMW, Visa, and MathWorks. Together, we are here to do some of the best work of our careers, driving smart contract security while defining a new standard in blockchain security.

To date we have 170+ enterprise clients, get the experience of working with some of the most innovative and exciting projects using distributed systems and blockchain with Toyota, Siemens, Mitsubishi, eToro, Binance, MakerDao and more.
Job Responsibilities:
Working closely with Senior Software Engineers, you will:

* Inspect and evaluate the correctness of blockchain protocols of various types and of various qualities
* Explaining to both technical and non-technical clients the way in which a vulnerability manifests, the methods and consequences of an exploit, and a recommended fix, often in the form of written reports
* Writing and evaluating tests
* Using static analysis tools to discover vulnerabilities (and weeding out the false positives)
* Assisting the protocol team from time to time with internal audits and protocol-level discussion
Required Skills:
* Previous experience designing and/or evaluating distributed systems protocols
* Knowledge of how machines work

** Binary representation
** How memory is mapped

* Familiarity building and/or auditing smart contract projects preferred
* BS/BA in CS, Math, or equivalent experience
* Technical expertise in one of the following:

** Cryptography
** OS/Database security
** Programming languages/formal verification

* Familiarity with Solidity and JavaScript highly preferred
* Familiarity with blockchain relevant topics (tokens, AML/KYC, identity) a plus
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Computing: Systems Security and Cryptography 
				
			
				- Theme - Data Analytics, Statistical Analysis and Mathematical Optimization 
				
			
				ENG - Electrical and Computer Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Software Engineering
				
			
				MATH - Computer Science
Application Documents Required: University of Waterloo Co-op Work History,Résumé,Grade Report

Job Summary:
Quantum Mob is a Toronto-based digital innovation partner that helps ambitious companies build successful digital products. We provide custom solutions to the complex problems facing our clients, which range from innovative early-stage startups to elite Fortune 500 companies.   


The Role 


Quantum Mob is looking to hire a creative, passionate, and talented marketing coop for fall term (September to December) who is motivated by the opportunity to bring innovative ideas to the table and build interactive designs for our organization.  

You will be responsible for assisting the corporate Marketing team with day-to-day tasks, conducting market research and developing comprehensive designs for the brand. Overall, we are looking for an individual who has a strong affinity for creating digital content and delivering outstanding experiences.
Job Responsibilities:
Conduct market research, competitor analysis, social media analysis. 
Experience creating graphics, animations, illustrations and other visuals for content spanning many mediums and topics
Can work well in close collaboration with the team and act as a key player in new and exciting initiatives
Participates in brainstorming concepts and ideas for various Marketing led initiatives 
Work with the Digital Marketing Specialist on automation and paid advertising 
Learn about our services, technology stack, and clients
Design for interaction (UI/UX, design systems and digital products) and design for communication (brand, marketing, and visual storytelling)

Job Summary:
Company:
Questat is a start-up company that develops point of care systems for blood testing. These blood diagnostic systems, are intended to be used in all distributed testing applications, where high sensitivity and lab quality accuracy is required.

Purpose of Position:
Questat is looking for highly motivated team members looking to support the growth and development of the start-up, as well as to develop their own cross-functional skillset. The ideal candidate will assist the Scientists and Engineers, as directed, in designing, developing, testing and validating chemical sensors, fluidic devices and associated instruments, as well as equipment and processes to manufacture these. The successful candidate will experience a demanding, fast paced medical application, while interacting with highly multidisciplinary groups.
Job Responsibilities:
Key Accountabilities and Major Activities:
- Help establish and maintain mechanical, chemical and electrical labs 
- Design and execute instalation and operational verifications on new equipment
- Maintain Instruments and Equipment in good functioning for smooth and reliable execution of various experiments.
- Design experiments to characterize sensors, fluidic systems and/or associated instruments.
- Test sensors, fluidic systems and/or associated instruments.
- Perform first steps of analysis and summarize experiments leading to the design and characterization of sensors, fluidic systems and/or associated instruments.
- Help develop an optimized manufacturing equipment and/or process for sensors, fluidic systems and/or associated instruments.

Job Challenges /Complexities:
- Integrate in a highly multidisciplinary team.
- Manage assigned tasks in an extremely interfaced team on tight timelines.
Required Skills:
Technical Skills / Business Knowledge:
- Engineering preferred (Chemical, Mechanical, Electro-mechanical, Electrical, Systems Engineering, Biomedical background would be an asset)
- Lab experience and good lab practices
- Understanding of statistical methods
- Good communication and interpersonal skills
- Sound knowledge of Microsoft Office applications and statistical analysis
 
Attributes / Competencies
- A strong ability to work well in a team setting and individually.
- Must be able to effectively manage change and shift priorities as required.
- Ability to communicate clearly and effectively to peers and management.
- A willingness to "roll up the sleeves" and become personally involved in the delivery of a project when required.
- Integrity, professionalism and overall commitment to excellence are paramount.
- Creative and innovative and able to contribute new ideas.
- A sense of urgency and results orientation with a dedicated focus toward product development

Job Summary:
The Questrade Technology Group (QTG) is home to a unique environment, where our culture thrives and, most importantly, we get stuff done! Questrade is continuing with its digital transformation initiative, and our infrastructure footprint is growing beyond our data centres and into the Google Cloud Platform, on an exciting strategy that is driven by business value. Join us and help solve exciting challenges such as handling low latency and high traffic market data and order flow in a hybrid cloud environment, event streams and messaging, in an industry that has so much room for disruption. 

  

The Cloud Infrastructure Engineer will be part of a team that drives the implementation of core cloud infrastructure components and infrastructure/platform for cloud-native applications, create tools and services that power our Engineering teams and collaborating with the project and the architecture teams influencing the design and delivery of our footprint.  


The Cloud Infrastructure Engineer is part of the team that provides the cloud infrastructure components that enable engineering productivity in QTG. You will work on building cloud-native and hybrid infrastructure through Infrastructure as Code, create toolsets and services the delivery of applications and infrastructure components. Some of these components include container orchestration platforms (Google Kubernetes Engine or OpenShift), container provisioning engines, configuration and secrets management, stand up / provisioning Terraform modules and others.
Job Responsibilities:
Champion "Production Quality" and create cutting edge cloud infrastructure through Infrastructure-as-Code and automation.
Build and improve cloud infrastructure self-service tooling that powers our internal platform used by hundreds of developers
Lead and participate in technical discussions to aid system design, analysis, and troubleshooting
Help engineering teams to develop, test, debug and release scalable, resilient and high available cloud-native applications quickly.
Rarely required to be available after hours for planned activities
Required Skills:
Understanding of Cloud computing concepts and solutions including public, private, hybrid cloud.
A good understanding of Cloud Security, specifically IAM Roles & Policies, Security Groups and Encryption keys
Demonstrated experience supporting at least one of the predominant public clouds (AWS, Azure, or GCP) 
Hands-on experience with container technologies, like Docker runtime and Kubernetes orchestration. Knowledge of Google Kubernetes Engine or OpenShift is nice to have.
Ability to write clean code in at least one language (i.e Python, Golang, Bash etc.)
Experience working with Infrastructure-as-Code tools such as Terraform, CloudFormation, Cloud Deployment Manager. 
Exposure or familiarity to Linux Operating system administration and a good understanding of Linux fundamentals like signals, scheduling, filesystems
TCP/IP networking knowledge in either cloud or on-prem deployments: DNS, network, routing, L3/L7 protocols etc.
Experience with Hashicorp Vault or other secret management approaches is nice to have.
Understanding of the basic building blocks of a resilient and scalable software
Good organizational, communication, analytical and interpersonal skills and ability to write clear technical documentation.

Job Summary:
The Operations Analyst (OA) Intern will work with Operations Engineering team members to complete assignments and deliverables for product increments or small to medium sized projects. The work may include engaging various stakeholders at Questrade Financial Group companies to optimize operational processes while adhering to existing policies, compliance, risk, legal and regulatory requirements.  


The Operations Analyst (OA) Intern role will work with Operations Engineering team members on various deliverables scheduled for the work term under the supervision of his/her team lead, peers or other QTG project leads using agile or non-agile software development practices. The OA Intern will establish a deeper understanding of business, operations and systems analysis methodologies during the term.
Job Responsibilities:
Genuine interest to help Canadians with their financial solutions
Demonstrate ability to learn new skill, technology and be comfortable with general instructions
Diligently follow instructions and perform tasks as assigned and seek clarification as needed
Evolve to work on small to medium sized deliverables independently or with minimal supervision
Apply previously internship/co-op experience and school learnings into his/her assignments
Ability to switch direction with frequent feedback from supervisors and peers to improve the deliverables and the quality of the delivered tasks
Be flexible and comfortable with collaboration tools and not afraid to ask for help when necessary
Feel empowered to ask questions about the work assigned and seek feedback after first draft of work to ensure he/she is going in the right direction
Be able to independently gather requirements, attend meetings, capture pertinent notes and summary for OE team colleagues and represent the OE team in various meetings as needed
Collaborate with other members of the Questrade Technology Group (QTG) members for assigned tasks, projects and product increments
Be able to prioritize and deliver tasks on time and with few or no errors
Facilitate small meetings for projects on behalf of the OE team
Provide continuous support to the OE team members
Perform various research and analysis necessary to provide inputs on business cases, competitor products, new ideas and existing products and systems
Required Skills:
Be enrolled in a post-secondary program in the fields of Information Technology, Business Administration, Engineering, Computer Sciences or other related disciplines
Be able to clearly explain complex matters in simple language
Strong interpersonal, communication, conflict resolution and expectation/relationship management skills
Strong time management, collaboration, listening and documentation skills


Nice to Have:
 

Knowledge of Google Suites Applications, process re-engineering and PowerBI
Understanding of agile and non-agile software development life cycle (SDLC) practices
Basic understanding of financial products such as banking, investments, mortgages, loans etc.
Interest in mobile apps for financial products, keen eye for streamlining complex workflows

Job Summary:
As the fastest growing online brokerage in Canada, Questrade is committed to helping Canadians become much more financially successful and secure. Our vision is to revolutionize financial services by offering the most innovative and cost efficient financial services - including banking. 


This is an exciting time to join Questrade, as we are in the midst of transforming ourselves from an investing platform to a bank. In order to make that transition, we must understand our current and future customers' needs - and that is where UX Research comes in.  


We are looking for two UX Research Interns to join the UX Research team. We are a team of three researchers who work closely with UX designers, UX Writers, and Visual Designers  on studies aimed at monitoring and improving the experience of our customers. 



Why choose Questrade? 


We know you have many companies to pick from, but we feel you'd get the most value at Questrade because:
 

You will be mentored and coached by a very experienced team of researchers, so you can build your skills and experience 
We are a household name for many Canadians - your work will impact friends, family and Canadians across the country
Questrade is a rapidly growing company with a lot of opportunities
Job Responsibilities:
Define and execute research studies involving various methodologies - moderated and unmoderated usability studies, interviews, AB Tests, Card and Tree studies, more
Present findings to our stakeholders
Propose topics of research our stakeholders haven't considered as yet
Be the administrator (on UserTesting.com) for any smaller studies our designers will be running
Help socialize our past, present and upcoming projects within the organization
Required Skills:
Pursuing a degree in HCI, Psychology, Anthropology, Design, or similar spaces
Skilled in one or more relevant user research methods is a plus
Able to adapt in a fast-paced environment
Able to work well in a cross-functional team
Able to demonstrate strong written and verbal communication skills
Able to demonstrate strong interpersonal and collaboration skills
Detail oriented 
Empathetic towards our customers but understands the reality of working within time and budget constraints
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters

				- Theme - Visual, Urban & Industrial Design

Job Summary:
As the fastest growing online brokerage in Canada, Questrade is committed to helping Canadians become much more financially successful and secure. Our vision is to revolutionize financial services by offering the most innovative and cost efficient financial services ? including banking.  

  

The Product Analyst, Digital Banking will play a meaningful role in developing and executing on Questrade's Digital Banking strategy, product and vision.   

  

What's it like working as a Product Analyst, Digital Banking at Questrade? 

  

You will support the strategic development of new digital banking products and services. Reporting to Product Manager, Digital Banking, you will assist in aspects of product management and product life-cycle, including product design and product features and research.
Job Responsibilities:
Questrade is looking for someone with strong business acumen, a foundational understanding for product design and management, creative thinking and strong research skills. In addition a desire to rethink banking products  

As the Product Analyst you will assist the Product Management team in the following areas. This will include but not be limited to: 
 

        Product Planning and Roadmap: Ideate, design, develop, implement and manage the expansion of the digital banking product line and product features 
        Revenue Optimization: Track key business metrics, analyze and evaluate product performance, develop supporting business cases and contribute to forecasting       and P&L management 
        Marketing: Work with internal and external Marketing partners on a "go-to-market" strategy, analytics and leads, acquisition strategy. Accountable for the continual usage and adoption of product 
        Customer Experience: Represent Questrade's customers and prospects and develop/deliver an integrated customer experience that exceeds their expectations and meets Questrade's standards. Collaborate with internal colleagues to develop business requirements/user stories, and client journey roadmap 
        Market & Industry Knowledge: Perform on-going competitive and market analysis, including global market trends and continually maintain a complete understanding of the Financial Services landscape as it relates to threats and opportunities for Questrade existing and future product

Education: Currently studying within a Post-Secondary Degree in Commerce, Management, Economics, Finance, Engineering, Computer Science, etc. 
        An asset if some existing experience in Product Analysis/Management 
        Excellent communication skills -- verbal and written, across all levels including management 
        Strong financial acumen and analytical skills, ability to interpret large sets of data and draw insights 
        Ability to drive change and challenge status quo, deal with ambiguity and make informed recommendations
