Job Summary:
Company Profile 


Founded in 1970, R.J. Burnside & Associates Limited is a growing values-driven employee owned multi discipline engineering and environmental consultancy firm with over 350 staff and a proven track record of providing highly responsive service to clients in the Public, Private, Aboriginal and International sectors.   We work on a variety of projects throughout Canada, with nine office locations in Ontario and one in Manitoba. Over the past two decades, we have also been active internationally, with varied and ongoing projects across the Caribbean and Africa.  


Burnside has expertise in many technical disciplines beyond traditional civil engineering including air and noise, environmental services, GIS, hydrogeology, land development, renewable energy & conservation, solid waste, structures, transportation, traffic, water/wastewater and well drilling & diagnostics.   


We take pride in our people and in our culture and the company has a strong reputation as being a great place to work.  We are always interested in speaking with talented people who wish to share their careers with us at any of our offices.  We offer competitive compensation and benefits, including RSP Matching Plans, Fitness Benefits, Flexible Hours and Work Locations, Career Development Opportunities, Continuing Education, Social Activities and a positive & inclusive working environment.  


R.J. Burnside & Associates Limited is looking for an energetic engineering student to assist professional engineers and technical staff in our Barrie office for the January - April 2022 work term.
Job Responsibilities:
The Role  

The teams in our Barrie office focus on transportation, municipal infrastructure, residential land development and environmental disciplines for both private and public sector clients. The successful student will have the opportunity to assist the private sector team on a variety of assignments in a dynamic and flexible role.  The team works on many land development projects including large subdivisions, site plans and individual lot grading. The student will provide design assistance and drafting support throughout the various levels of design.  


The entire team is committed to providing the successful student with opportunities to gain technical skills and industry knowledge, moving towards a target of full-time employment on graduation. Opportunity will exist to work directly with senior staff.   


Tasks may include, but certainly are not limited to:  

•    Civil design and plan production; 

•    Report preparation assistance; 

•    Data entry and general office duties; and 

•    Other tasks as assigned.
Required Skills:
Professional Knowledge & Requirements

Writing skills and computer excellence including AutoCAD, Civil 3D, design software, and Excel spreadsheets are required.    

Applicants should be completing at least their second year of a post-secondary civil engineering program, have excellent communication skills; and the ability to work in a fast-paced environment with a variety of project leaders.   


We are looking for someone who is a quick learner, independent and willing to take on anything. Related work experience is a definite asset.
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Sustainable Development
				
			
				ENG - Civil, Environmental and Geological Engineering

Job Summary:
RadComm Systems Corp. is a privately-owned Canadian company specializing in the design, manufacture and service of highly sensitive radiation detection systems for a variety of industrial, civilian and government applications. 

  

RadComm has established its reputation as a market leader in the Steel, Scrap Metal and Waste sectors by providing customized design solutions that help our customers mitigate the risks of radioactive contamination. 

  

We are working on a new Research & Development initiative that includes CO-OP students in the area of Nuclear Physics, Applied Physics, Applied Engineering, Software Engineering and Computer Engineering. Guided by our Research & Development Department, you will be part of a project team developing a new gamma spectral analysis design concept. 

  

We are a small, tightly-knit team of people that are truly motivated and engaged in their work and are driven to succeed. If you're looking for an opportunity to learn about radiation detection and analysis, we want to hear from you.
Job Responsibilities:
Contribute to software architecture and modelling activities.
Write and maintain efficient code for mathematical and statistical models.

Job Summary:
Very flexible start and end dates. We're happy to have you work for us as long as you're available and interested. 


Radix is a relatively early stage startup building an optimizing compiler that takes biotech procedures and compiles them to instructions that can be executed in a physical biology lab. Well plates are our "memory" and our move instruction is telling a lab worker or pipetting robot to move a substance or physical object from one location to another. We build fundamental abstractions over biology labs including work-flow specification, optimized program compilation to varied back-end targets (real labs) and put it behind great UX. The current industry status quo has talented PhD Biologists spend 5 hours a day on hard to reproduce, unoptimized minutia that isn't innovative. We hope to accelerate biotech innovation like early compilers did for computing by enabling lab protocols to seamlessly operate and be optimized across physical labs. We have funding from some pretty cool people (Ycombinator, Firstminute Capital, MIT's The Engine, and Nikesh Arora) and have multiple pilots in academic research labs and commercial biotech corporations, and this number is growing. 


We're looking for pragmatic individuals who are able to appreciate well done code and are also pragmatic about getting useful solutions. This co-op position will focus on algorithm implementation that forms the core of our compiler and runtime system. Your code will need to reliably and quickly produce solutions in on-prem deployments that will be executed with lab automation, equipment, and lab workers in real time. 


We're 100% a Scala shop. While we don't require that you already know Scala, you will need to become proficient in it quickly. It is a dual paradigm object oriented and functional programming language. If you have experience with Scala, Ocaml, Haskell, and/or Java, we're especially enthusiastic to hear from you. We don't hire people who don't enjoy learning and teaching. You can expect to learn from and teach world class engineers. 


Radix is a exciting work environment. We care about each other. We're also LGBTQ+, polyamoroy, kink, gender, minority, and most other things supporting. We're an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.
Job Responsibilities:
Work on Radix's heuristic based scheduler trading off scheduling speed and performance
Implement algorythms for the scheduler 
Make memes and MS Excel jokes as needed
Required Skills:
Key skills: 
 

Experience with functional programming (Scala, Ocaml, Haskell, Erlang, Elixer) or a strong desire and at least somewhat demonstrated capacity to learn (say by reading Essential Scala from underscore.io)
Constraint-based solver integration (SMT/heuristic/MIP)
NP-complete problem solver
Comfortable with metaheuristic implementation
Experience with compiler implementation
Comfort with actor systems (we use Akka)
Experience with GNU/Linux (we do all our work in Linux) and Git for version control
Keen to learn and make biologists' work lives better

Nice to have: 

 

Have done some things in a bio lab or think this sounds cool
Human factors, user centered, or general design exposure

Job Summary:
We are extremely flexible about start and end dates. Tell us when you'd like to work, and it's likely fine. Longer is typically better. 


Radix is a relatively early stage start-up building a next generation visual programming language and optimizing compiler that takes biotech procedures and compiles them to instructions that can be executed in a physical biology lab. Biologists describe their protocol in our front end language and our compiler and run-time system realize this in their physical lab. The user experience here is key because biologists shouldn't need to be programmers to not have to spend 5 hours every day doing manual pipetting for hard to reproduce unoptimized minutia that isn't innovative. We hope to accelerate biotech innovation like early compilers did for computing by enabling lab protocols to seamlessly operate and be optimized across physical labs. We have funding from some pretty cool people (YCombinator, Firstminute Capital, MIT's The Engine, and Nikesh Arora) and have multiple pilots in academic research labs and commercial biotech corporations, and this number is growing. We're looking for pragmatic individuals who appreciate great interfaces and want to make a big difference for our users - biologists and lab workers and biology as a discipline, and enable them to have good tooling that simply abstracts away menial work. 


In this position, you'll work on our web-based visual programming language, decision support tool, and operations monitoring interface. Biologists use these to describe their science, make data based decisions, and manage their lab. This position is relatively customer facing. You will co-design interfaces with biologists on a weekly basis. While most of our code is in Scala, our front-end is in Typescript. We don't hire people who don't enjoy learning and teaching, and you will learn from and teach world class engineers. 


Radix is a exciting work environment. We care about each other. We're also LGBTQ+, polyamoroy, kink, gender, minority, and most other things supporting. We're an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.

Collaborate with other engineers

Radix is a relatively early stage startup building an optimizing compiler that takes biotech procedures and compiles them to instructions that can be executed in a physical biology lab. Well plates are our "memory" and our move instruction is telling a lab worker or pipetting robot to move a substance or physical object from one location to another. Test your drivers with the physical hardware, often in collaboration with our customers and PhD level biology scientists

Job Summary:
Radix is a software start-up, building a system that would significantly change how biologists and scientists in Biotech and Pharma companies go about doing research and production. Radix brings to biology a framework and a set of tools much like the tools for CAD/CAM/CAE or VLSI Design. https://www.nature.com/articles/d41586-019-02875-z 


Currently, research process in the labs of pharma and bio-tech is very labor intensive. It doesn't have to be this way. Our technology is a compiler and operating system for biology labs. We create a next generation visual programming language and optimizing compiler that takes biotech procedures and compiles them to instructions that can be executed in a physical biology lab. Biologists describe their protocol in our front end language and our compiler and run-time system realize this in their physical lab. We hope to accelerate biotech innovation like early compilers did for computing by enabling lab protocols to seamlessly operate and be optimized across physical labs. We have funding from some pretty cool people (YCombinator, Firstminute Capital, MIT's The Engine, and Nikesh Arora) and have multiple pilots in academic research labs and commercial biotech corporations, and this number is growing. Before COVID-19 we were based out of The Engine in Central Square in Cambridge, MA within sight of the Red Line MBTA stop, but are presently working from home. 


This paid position will report directly to our COO. He's a tech start-up veteran with previous successful exit. You will perform market research to build up a list of potential customers in the various market segments. You will work closely with the COO & CEO to build out specific value proposition and supporting presentation for these potential customers. You will identify specific individuals in these segments to present the value proposition of Radix. You will also participate in sales and other customer meetings to help present the value of Radix's software offering and help customers identify key cost savings and operations benefits of incorporating Radix's software. You will develop powerful customer communication tools to help potential customers and investors see the power of the Radix software. 


This is a technical position. You will speak tech with our customers every day and advocate for their needs. You'll also get to do a decently deep technical software dive so you really understand how our software works and can explain it to prospects. 


Radix is a exciting work environment. We care about each other. We're also LGBTQ+, polyamoroy, kink, gender, minority, and most other things supporting. We're an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.
Job Responsibilities:
Perform cold outreach to biotech prospects, focusing on the North East and SF geographical regions of the US
Perform warm outreach when relevant 
Follow up with leads and support Radix's overall buisness development and sales activities 
Create marking materials for social media and distributing to prospects and customers
Required Skills:
Key Skills:
 

If using search engines was a competitive sport, you'd be on the varsity team. You enjoy internet research and are skilled at finding leads.
You enjoy talking to potential customers, determining the parts of their current job that are painful, and identifying and presenting potential solutions.
You're able to find people online, track down connections, and facilitate contact through a personal introduction or publicly accessible contact information.
Create slides and written work that communicate complex information simply and efficiently.
You're able to identify what would create value for potential and current customers based on their needs and work.
You like to get technical, especially with biology, software, or manufacturing.

Job Summary:
Radkl's internship program offers students an extraordinary opportunity to learn about the firm and the world's financial markets. We have built a thoughtful and challenging curriculum with projects that introduce students to many complex and ever changing problems to solve. Students can expect real quantitative problems to solve throughout the program and engaging social events to get to know our team and culture.
 

Training: Ongoing training throughout the term from the quant-crypto desk and other quantitative specialists at the firm
Projects: Real problems to solve throughout the program. Interns will work from a list of projects and have several senior mentors throughout the summer program.
Job Responsibilities:
Data Science is a fundamental discipline practiced by the crypto trading team, which works to improve and enhance trading algorithms through transforming large data sets into usable trading models. Successful data scientists work well independently and collaboratively, enjoy learning and applying new algorithmic techniques, and are excited to see their ideas turn into tangible results. 


Interns will work directly with senior members of the team on our data pipelines and analysis framework used for optimization of Radkl's crypto market making business. Interns in this track will apply their quantitative analysis and research skills to improve the quality of decisions made by our trading models and to refine our understanding of crypto markets.
Required Skills:
Pursuing a degree in Science, Math, Engineering or other quantitative field
Strong programming skills - Python/Pandas, R, Julia, Matlab, or similar preferred!
History of diverse, challenging, and interesting coursework paired with a strong GPA
Exceptional quantitative, mathematical, and problem-solving skills
Great communication skills and the ability to collaborate with peers
Ability to solve technical and or quantitative problems under pressure
Ability to express ideas mathematically and algorithmically
Intellectually curious and self-motivated
Ability to communicate within and across teams, at a high and low level, on both technical and non-technical subjects
Ability to seek guidance and learn new skills from peers
Extraordinary mental flexibility and a high tolerance for ambiguity
Strong drive for success within a collaborative team
Interest in cryptocurrencies

Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Data Analytics, Statistical Analysis and Mathematical Optimization 
				
			
				ENG - Software Engineering
				
			
				MATH - Computer Science

Job Summary:
Raise Your Edge is an online poker community that offers teaching resources in the form of one on one coaching, online videos and courses and has recently ventured into creating software to serve the poker community with more scale.  Check out our web platform Pairrd.com and stay tuned for the upcoming launch of our iOS version of Pairrd.
Work closely with a UW graduate and former Software Engineer at Amazon with 10+ years in the software industry to build the latest in cutting edge mobile and web software for professional poker.  Learn to take professional level ownership over your projects and work at a high level with senior developers.  Learn to be a professional developer at the level required by the top companies in Seattle and San Francisco like Amazon, Google, Facebook, etc.  It is not expected that you come to the job knowing already how to perform at this level but rather that you come to work each day with a positive attitude and always looking to improve your performance and abilities from the day before.  We will select candidates based on the depth of their previous software development experience (especially mobile), intelligence and desire to improve and grow and as a software professional.

Job Perks:
Work remotely.  We are an international group and don't have a physical office.  The lead developer is based out of London, Ontario and will meet occasionally or as needed on campus at UW or at an agreed alternate location.  Stay at your place in Waterloo, live with your parents back home - we don't care where you work so long as you put in a quality, UW level effort for 40 hours a week for the duration of the work term.
One on one coaching and skills development.  Meet daily or as needed with the lead developer to improve your hard and soft development skills.  We believe in investing in our co-ops to help them reach their potential in return for their hard work and dedication to the project.
Work on the latest technologies and platforms.  We make native and webapps using the latest in Swift, Angular, Firebase, and more.  
Competitive compensation.  In addition to saving time and money by working remotely, we will pay you by the hour in accordance to your co-op experience and program.

Job Summary: As a member of a highly motivated, dynamic, multi-disciplined team, you will assist in designing and developing world-class automation solutions.  Duties involve contributing to machine concepts, process development and building internal systems.
Job Responsibilities:
Involved in the full design life cycle of a project including the following:
 

Understand and analyze the customers' requirements, products, and processes
Complete feasibility studies, concepts designs, and cost estimates for the internal sales team
Work with cross functional teams to generate a functional requirements specification (FRS), failure mode and effects analysis (FMEA), and cycle time charts to verify concept success
Perform engineering calculations and analysis with respect to strength of materials, speeds, horsepower, temperature, pressure, force, etc. as related to machine and tool designs
Create 3D CAD designs using SolidWorks to satisfy all design requirements, design for manufacturability, safeguarding of machinery, ergonomics, and other project requirements
Generate Bills of Material (BOMs) and manufacturing and assembly drawings utilizing proper tolerances and GD&T
Support the design through manufacturing, assembly, and integration
Write acceptance test plans to validate the equipment to satisfy all project requirements
Build and develop internal systems and processes to increase efficiency and quality of designs
Complete accurate documentation for each project
Required Skills:
Strong mechanical aptitude and problem solving skills
Experience with robotic equipment including the following: 
	 
  
Pneumatics - Cylinders, grippers, valves, valve banks, fittings etc.
Hydraulics - Cylinders, valves, accumulators, power packs, etc.
Electrical - Servo motors, sensors, LVDTs, PLCs, HMIs, etc.


Programming experience an asset including Visual Basic and writing macros
Knowledge of materials, finishes, and heat treat processes
Must be capable of designing tooling from sketches or verbal concepts
Must have thorough knowledge of drafting principles and GD&T tolerancing
A working knowledge of common machine shop techniques
Must be proficient in SolidWorks and AutoCAD / Draftsight
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Manufacturing and Process Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Mechanical and Mechatronics Engineering
Application Documents Required: University of Waterloo Co-op Work History,Résumé,Grade Report

Job Summary: Controls Systems Design Students are responsible for working with our internal teams and clients performing equipment programming (PLC, HMI) and integration tasks within a multi-disciplined team environment. Key responsibilities may also include internal system building and process development. Where applicable, students would also assist in electrical design tasks for our control hardware team.
Job Responsibilities:
Design and implement PLC and/or PC based programs specific to customer and project requirements
Develop controls architecture and code for partial or wholesale changes, as well as new system development
Specify, test and qualify control hardware components in conjunction with other design teams
Develop or progress internal software tools using C#, VBA, and SQL
Provide written summaries and reports reflecting current and desired states as well as recommendations
Create, procure and/or manage electrical schematics related to the hardware design
Manage drawing packages and documentation
Perform efficiency studies including OEE and Failure analysis
Complete all required internal time reporting and customer update reporting 
Track and record all expenses such as job costs and travel
Ensure that all activities are performed with highest ethical standards and in compliance with RAMP Inc business policies
Adhere to both internal and customer site health and safety rules and procedures
Required Skills:
Knowledge of AutoCAD/AutoCAD Electrical, and Solidworks
Working knowledge of PLC systems (AB, Siemens, Omron, Beckoff)
Working knowledge of Robot systems (ABB, Kuka, and Fanuc)

Job Summary:
Who is Ratehub Inc?


We're a company on a mission. Every single team member, from product & engineering, to sales & marketing, finance, operations and everything in between is obsessed with one thing; helping Canadian's make better financial choices. And we're pretty great at it, too. Via our digital application technology and our award-winning in-house brokerages, we help over 1m Canadian's per month make a positive impact on their finances. 365 days a year we deliver our users the best online mortgage experience, personalized credit card options, and cheaper auto & home insurance policies than they typically get from their existing financial adviser. 

Changing how people make financial choices isn't easy, though. We know that achieving our mission is full of challenges; challenges that can be complex and often unexpected, but that are always interesting, rewarding and fun to solve as a team. This is where you come in. We are on the hunt for the right kind of people to join us and help lead us forward to continued growth.
Job Responsibilities:
RESPONSIBILITIES

Creating elegant and responsive web interfaces that work across a range of browsers and devices using HTML5, CSS3, ES6, React, and Webpack
Maintaining and extending our blog and content management systems
Building integration points between systems using web services and leveraging external web services to provide functionality
Working with support, marketing, business and other team members to identify product and process improvements, suggest implementation options, trade-off alternatives, and make engineering decisions
Required Skills:
YOUR QUALIFICATIONS

1+ years experience building web and mobile-optimized websites
Proficiency with HTML and CSS, and experience implementing complex layouts with a high degree of fidelity to designs; experience with SASS
A high degree of comfort with JavaScript; experience with a modern JS application framework (React/Flux, Ember, Angular, etc.) a strong plus
Knowledge of content management systems (CMS) and experience customizing/extending CMSes to provide web applications
Experience with source version control; Git strongly preferred
Familiarity with Linux, MacOS or another Unix-like operating system; feeling at home in the terminal
Excellent verbal and written communication skills

Our tech stack

Language/Framework: Javascript/React, styled-components/CSS
State Management: React hooks, Mobx & mobx-state-tree for complex applications
CI: GitHub Actions
Observability and Monitoring: New Relic, Heap
Backend: Microservice and FaaS-based HTTP APIs

CULTURE FIT

Fun: You bring your whole self to work and make an effort to contribute to our workplace culture in a positive way
Do the right thing: You are able to assess both customer and company needs to make good business choices
Growth mindset: You love to learn and try new things
Willing to Help: You care about your team members and are willing to help out outside your realm of expertise.
Impact orientated: You are motivated by results and track to completion
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Computing: Software
				
			
				ENG - Electrical and Computer Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Software Engineering
				
			
				MATH - Computer Science

Job Summary:
Interested applicants must apply through WaterlooWorks and directly to the employer to be considered for this position (see "Additional Application Information" section).


What is the opportunity?

At RBC, AI and machine learning are powering the next generation of electronic trading solutions for our clients. AI Engineering on our Toronto trading floor are at the centre of this effort, applying cutting-edge methods utilizing the latest hardware to process torrents of high-frequency transaction data. Working collaboratively within global, cross-functional teams of traders, developers, and relationship managers, your technical skills, creativity, and entrepreneurial mindset will enable you to see things differently and drive initiatives to deliver value and insights for the world's largest money managers. Get ready for a PEY experience like no other. 


The nature of finance is changing, and RBC Capital Markets is looking to recruit the next generation of AI engineering to build cutting edge electronic trading algorithms. 

 
Global Markets Artificial Intelligence Lab - AI Engineering (8 months)
 

The Global Markets AI Lab offers the opportunity to work at the forefront of AI and trading, leveraging state of the art research on pioneering projects within Global Markets. The team has a broad mandate to transform the way we do trading through the application of cutting edge AI technologies, working in an innovative new research lab space located directly on Canada's largest trade floor (the first of its kind). 


Joining the Global Markets AI Lab as an AI Engineering, you will have the opportunity to work with cutting-edge machine learning research, build systems to support a first of its kind AI-based trading algorithm, and lead projects that have real-world and significant impact for the firm.
Job Responsibilities:
What will you do?

Apply unconventional and innovative machine learning techniques to solve cutting edge trading problems
Use your critical thinking and problem solving skills to improve the performance of reinforcement learning algorithms that trade millions of shares daily
Develop key support systems to help train, and explain the actions of our reinforcement learning algorithms
Collaborate with traders and subject matter experts across the trade floor
Be challenged to think critically within a collaborative team working on Canada's largest trade floor
Required Skills:
What do you need to succeed?

Creative and novel problem solving approach
Programming experience in machine learning framework (Python preferred)
Proficiency in optimization and Bayesian statistics
Experience developing reinforcement learning models
Strong desire to be part of a team and excellent communication skills
Experience in finance not required

				- Theme - Information Science and Data Management 
				
			
				ARTS/MATH - Finance
				
			
				MATH - Combinatorics and Optimization
				
			
				MATH - Computing and Financial Management
				
			
				MATH - Statistics and Actuarial Science

Job Summary:
What is the opportunity?


RBC Capital Markets is a part of the Royal Bank of Canada, one of the largest providers of financial services in the world. RBC ranks among the top five banks in North America by market capitalization and has one of the highest credit ratings of any financial institution in the world. 


Internship opportunities exist within RBCCM for energetic, bright and talented undergraduates and graduates. The co-op program extends for 4 months and provides interns the opportunity to gain in-depth, hands-on experience while working and learning alongside our experienced market professionals. 


In selecting intern candidates, we look for well-rounded individuals with a track record of outstanding academic achievement, proven technical and analytical skills and a diversity of extracurricular activities. Other essential qualities we look for include strong oral and written communication skills, leadership qualities, initiative and the ability to play a key role as a team member in a fast-paced and challenging work environment. Fluency in more than one language is an asset.
Job Responsibilities:
What will you do?
 

This opportunity will be highly initiative-driven and in addition to set responsibilities the student will excel by seeking out their own opportunities to learn and add value. Key responsibilities include:
 

Researching news and information sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, and any online media sources to develop consolidated reports, and information.
Creating the morning notes, mid-day update, energy/mining notes and market share/close notes that are distributed to clients and internally.
Analyzing trading volumes, trading values, internal communications and internal research reports to document and summarize trading activity
Support our Corporate Access Team - Help with Corporate and Analyst marketing data, events, etc
Complete various research projects which include: investment ideas, industry analysis, client analysis
Liaising directly with Equity Sales Professionals and Traders to complete special assignments and support as necessary
Improve processes - bring ideas for making things better.
Required Skills:
What do you need to succeed?

  

Must-have:

Successful completion of a minimum of first year of a business/economics/finance or related degree
Basic market knowledge and a demonstrated keen interest in capital markets
Strong research abilities and excellent analytical and communication skills
Extremely motivated and able to take initiative in order to identify ways to add value and improve practices
Demonstrated problem-solving skills, business sense and the ability to multi-task and prioritize in high pressure environments
Proficient with the use of Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook, etc.
Office hours tied to global markets:  6 a.m. to 6 p.m.


Nice-to-have:

CSC and CPH preferred and enrolment in CFA a strong asset
Prior related work experience valued
Prior use of Bloomberg, Reuters Eikon preferred


Candidates have usually focused their studies on commerce or economics, although this is not a prerequisite.  Most importantly, candidates must demonstrate a desire to learn and an eagerness to make a meaningful contribution to the team environment at RBC Capital Markets.
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters

				ARTS/MATH - Finance
				
			
				MATH - Combinatorics and Optimization
				
			
				MATH - Computing and Financial Management

What is the opportunity?

The Algorithmic & Quantitative Trading group is seeking students with creative and structured thought processes who have an interest in the fast-paced world of electronic trading. 

  

Global Equities - Algorithmic & Quantitative Trading

  

If working in a fast-paced and exciting environment with a group of passionate and like-minded individuals appeals to you, the Algorithmic & Quantitative Trading group is looking for you. 


As a member of Global Equities, the team is responsible for continuously improving and creating new automated execution strategies covering North American equities and is widely known as one of the most progressive groups in finance in terms of both culture and innovation. 

By being a part of the team, you will contribute to and start new projects that have real-world and significant impact on how RBC Capital Markets does business on a daily basis.  Members of the team possess a diverse set of skills ranging from creating thinking to quantitative modeling and machine learning and apply them to market structure research and algorithmic trading strategies. 


Past accomplishments have included RBC's patented smart order routing technology known as THOR (as mentioned in "Flash Boys") and Canada's first artificial intelligence trading network.
Job Responsibilities:
What will you do?

Research, create, and implement quantitative trading strategies using optimization and cutting-edge machine-learning techniques
Apply critical thinking and problem solving skills to expand already-existing algorithms that trade millions of shares and thousands of times a second
Analyze market data to investigate previously unexplored structural research areas
Think critically and creatively within a collaborative and close-knit team working on Canada's largest trading floor
Required Skills:
What do you need to succeed?

Creative and novel problem solving approach
Programming experience in statistical modeling languages (R or MATLAB preferred)
Proficiency in optimization and Bayesian statistics
Experience developing reinforcement learning models
Strong desire to be part of a team and excellent communication skills
Experience in finance not required

RBC Capital Markets' Global Investment Banking division seeks out and hires energetic, bright and talented undergraduates for our Co-op Analyst program.

What is the opportunity?

As an FRTB Analyst within RBC Capital Market's Strategy & Transformation (S&T) group, you will support RBC's implementation of the Basel Committee's latest Market Risk regulation, the Fundamental Review of the Trading Book (FRTB). The FRTB Program is a large strategic initiative driving transformational change across multiple Business and IT teams in RBC. 

  

For this role, we are looking for an eager and high performing individual to work closely with FRTB Program Leads to assist in various project management activities, including managing, tracking, and reporting on the FRTB Program's delivery. Extensive interactions across Business and IT groups will make this a valuable learning opportunity for any student interested in the implementation of cross-functional programs across Capital Markets.
Job Responsibilities:
What will you do?

Working under the direction of the FRTB Program Leads, you will support FRTB implementation at RBC by:
Creating and maintaining project artefacts, meeting materials, reports and status updates
Monitoring project schedules, deliverables, and milestones
Assisting with communications and tracking action items to closure
Developing relationships and coordinating across teams to facilitate project execution
Contributing ideas and concerns, and escalating issues for resolution
Required Skills:
What do you need to succeed?
 
Must-have

General knowledge of Canadian Financial Services industry
Excellent communication skills; ability to interact effectively with project managers, team members and senior business stakeholders
Strong organizational skills, with attention to detail
Proficiency with Microsoft Project, PowerPoint, and Excel
SharePoint 2010 usage and development (ie: experience working with SharePoint lists)

Nice-to-have

Capital Markets product and regulatory knowledge would be an asset

Job Summary:
Interested applicants must apply through WaterlooWorks and directly to the employer to be considered for this position (see "Additional Application Information" section).

What is the opportunity?
Looking to start your career in Financial Services? RBC fosters a positive learning environment for students by providing the support and resources to help strategize your career path. Since we opened our doors in 1864, RBC has grown to become one of North America's leading diversified financial services companies. RBC Global Asset Management (RBC GAM) is a global asset manager with industry-leading investment management capabilities with teams located around the world. Globally, RBC GAM companies manage approximately CAD $425 B+ in assets on behalf of individual, high net worth and institutional investors. Phillips, Hager & North Investment Management is the division of RBC GAM responsible for serving institutional clients in Canada. RBC Global Asset Management Inc. is the manager of RBC Funds and PH&N Funds. PH&N Funds won the Lipper Awards for "Best Overall Fund Group" in 2010 to 2013, 2016, 2018 and "Best Bond Fund Family" in 2007, 2008, 2010 - 2013, 2016, 2018. RBC Funds won the Lipper Awards for "Best Bond Fund Family" in 2009 and "Best Overall Fund Group" in 2007, 2008 & 2014. RBC GAM was also recognized as Best Bond ETF Group in 2015 & 2017. Does the Global Asset Management segment interest you? If yes, then be sure to check out the co-op opportunity below!

The primary purpose of the role is to provide support to the Advisor Channel Sales (ACS) Management Team, a national team of wholesalers, and inside business development managers whose mandate is to promote and support the sale of RBC Global Asset Management mutual funds to Canadian Investment Advisors
Job Responsibilities:
What will you do?

Sort through the daily sales alerts, identifying uncategorized transactions and following a multi-step search process to attach rep codes to their appropriate investment advisor. A metrics report will be completed at the end of each month to record progress.
A focus is placed on advisor prospecting. The student will complete a variety on routine tasks in Word and Excel to find and communicate new advisors to the national sales team as well as produce reports analyzing prospecting progress.
Students are strongly encouraged to create new tools to improve efficiencies in existing processes. Students are also encouraged to go beyond existing processes and create entirely new reporting processes and data analytics if an opportunity to do so is found.
Run and format a variety of standard and ad hoc reports from the CRM system to support the Relationship Liaison Team and the ACS Management Team
Participate in event planning and pre-event reporting for ACS events and conferences.
Lead "data hygiene" effort in on our CRM system to ensure accurate quality data.
A focus is also placed on tracking the success of various sales initiatives. The students will create Excel reports that analyze the progress of our sales initiatives and the net benefits.
Administrative tasks as required.
Required Skills:
What do you need to succeed?
Technical

Excellent computer literacy, particularly with Microsoft Excel and Word, and an ability to learn new programs (i.e. Microsoft CRM, Salesforce, Tableau, SharePoint).
Specific to Microsoft Excel skills, candidates must have the ability and knowledge to:
Create and update pivot tables.
Manipulate, organize and retrieve data through the use of formulas and logic functions (particularly vlookups).
Utilize the 'Sort' and 'Filter' functions to efficiently organize large files of data.
Create and manipulate macros to improve the efficiency of reporting.
Format data appropriately into list, chart, or graph forms.
Knowledge of VBA is an asset although not required (Nice to have).

Financial


Basic knowledge of the Canadian Securities Industry and regulatory environment.
An understanding of the fundamental types of mutual funds and their structures. (Nice to have)
An interest in Investment Management

Soft


Ability to quickly solve a problem while analyzing and interpreting data
Keen attention to detail
Strong communication and interpersonal skills
Comfortable working both independently and as a part of a group
Excellent time management skills and experience in multi-tasking
Ability to work efficiently in a fast-paced environment, under various time restrictions

Job Summary:
Interested applicants must apply through WaterlooWorks and directly to the employer to be considered for this position (see "Additional Application Information" section).


RBC fosters a positive learning environment for students by providing support and resources to help your development. As the leading financial institution in the country and one of Canada's Top Employers for Young People, RBC is a great place to start your career. By applying to this role, you will be highlighted to roles across Internal Audit (see descriptions below) that are more traditional audit/assurance.  


What is the opportunity?

Internal Audit works to review what's going on behind the scenes of all lines of business across RBC. It is the ideal work environment if you're interested in seeing how things work, are curious about digging deep into data to discover new things and like to use your imagination to make recommendations or drive insights. By joining us for a 4-month long position, you will be involved in a variety of challenging assignments, allowing you become familiar with a wide range of areas across RBC, while also strengthening the skills and knowledge you need to launch a successful career. Our students benefit from interesting work and networking opportunities, and are encouraged to collaborate on innovations.
Job Responsibilities:
What will you do?


CAPITAL MARKETS

Assess and provide objective assurance on the effectiveness of internal controls, risk management practices and corporate governance processes in order to identify whether controls are operating effectively to improve business operations. Key tasks may include:
Participating in audits, control design review, continuous audit review and consulting engagements
Participating in planning sessions to develop audit techniques using data analytics
Using Tableau to develop data analytics and visualization reports
Preparing management reports

Requirements: 

Post-secondary education major in Business, Finance and Accounting, Statistics or Computer Science
Demonstrated knowledge and experience working with data analytics software packages, data visualization tools and programming languages (Tableau, Python, etc.)
Experience in using MS tools; Powerpoint, Word, Excel
Prior exposure to capital markets, valuations and/or risk analysis of financial trading products would be an asset

PERSONAL & COMMERCIAL BANKING

Assess and provide objective assurance on the effectiveness of internal controls, risk management practices and corporate governance processes in order to identify whether controls are operating effectively to improve business operations. Key tasks may include:
Participating in audits, control design review, continuous audit review and consulting engagements
Participating in planning sessions to develop audit techniques using data analytics
Using Tableau to develop data analytics and visualization reports
Preparing management reports

Requirements: 

Post-secondary education major in Business, Finance and Accounting, or Statistics
Demonstrated knowledge and experience working with data analytics software packages, data visualization tools (Tableau would be an asset)
Experience in using MS tools; Powerpoint, Word, Excel

TRANSFORMATION, OPERATIONS, PRACTICES & REPORTING

Provide support to the Learning, Methodology, Quality Assurance, Strategy, Communications & Change, Audit Planning, Analysis & Reporting, Project Assurance, Operations and Operational Risk teams within Internal Audit. Key tasks may include:
Training as a Scrum Master to support Audit teams deploying the Agile Audit approach
Project management for internal audit strategic initiatives
Acting as a business analyst on complex, multi-faceted initiatives
Assisting with reporting to the Audit Committee and executive management
Researching leading practices and emerging topics
Assisting with Methodology creation and documentation
Assisting with creation of dynamic Learning presentations

Requirements:

Post-secondary education major in Business or Accounting
Prior experience in internal audit would be an asset
Experience in using MS tools; Powerpoint, Word, Excel
Required Skills:
What do you need to succeed?

Along with pursuing a post-secondary education and being available for a work term commencing in January 2022, there are some other qualities that we look for in members of Internal Audit. 


Must-have:

Be Curious. You don't have to have an audit or accounting background in order to be successful here. What we look for is someone who has an interest in understanding and learning about auditing principles and techniques. Someone who is able to think critically and isn't afraid to recommend an approach or challenge others' opinions in a constructive manner. Someone who has a passion for learning and personal development, and wants to spend their term collaborating with a diverse group of talented individuals.
Be Tech-Savvy. Internal Audit is a leader in finding innovative ways to use technology to be more efficient and impactful. Proficiency in Microsoft Office tools, including Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Excel, is required. Experience with data analytics tools such as Python and visualization tools like Tableau are also an asset.
Be Adaptable. We are a busy part of RBC where there is always a lot on the go. We are looking for someone who thrives in a dynamically changing environment with strong project management skills, allowing you to multi-task, prioritize and work independently under tight timelines.
Be Collaborative. Internal Audit is a supportive and welcoming environment, and we are looking for team players who proactively seek out development opportunities. Someone with excellent interpersonal skills and a positive attitude. Someone who demonstrates strong verbal and written communication skills, allowing you to work effectively with people across the organization.

Does this sound like you? If so, then a coop position with RBC's Internal Audit team is the job for you. See below for information on some of the Winter 2022 co-op opportunities available within Internal Audit.

Job Title:
NEW
									



										Data Analyst, Corporate Treasury Liquidity Parameterization
Job Summary:
Interested applicants must apply through WaterlooWorks and directly to the employer to be considered for this position (see "Additional Application Information" section).


What is the opportunity?

RBC's Corporate Treasury is responsible for managing the capital and liquidity position of the bank through a variety of risk measures, funding actions, liquid asset buffers, and other strategic initiatives. The Applied Liquidity Research 'ALR' team in Treasury leads behavioral research work on the extensive array of retail and wholesale products the bank sells to clients with the goal of understanding how to cost effectively fund these products in a way that is robust to a wide variety of risks and stress scenarios. 

  

The Liquidity Parameterization team within ALR is seeking to fill a 4 month internship for the Winter period from January through April and would like to find an individual interested in expanding their knowledge of treasury and liquidity risk management.
Job Responsibilities:
What will you do?

Aid in the development of user-friendly tools that allow stakeholders to quickly access information on current liquidity parameters across internal and regulatory metrics across the same product type.
Help develop infrastructure for liquidity scorecards which will accelerate the time to arrive at a liquidity parameterization conclusion and ensure a consistent treatment across like risks.
Enhance the current approach to documentation and project tracking so that liquidity management teams can quickly identify priority items.
Other bespoke requests as needed.
Required Skills:
What do you need to succeed?

Must-have:

MBA or Master's Degree in a quantitative discipline (e.g. Finance, Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, etc.)
Strong knowledge of Microsoft Excel, including advanced formulas and ability to manipulate large data sets.
Comfortable with matrix based calculation approaches.
Working knowledge of banking products such as deposits, securities finance, and loans.
Good business acumen, ability to anticipate potential needs when working through projects without prompting, and comfortability making recommendations and proposing solutions.

Nice-to-have:

Coding experience in VBA, Python, and/or MATLAB
Experience with Tableau and data visualization
Ability to understand and construct basic to intermediate SQL queries
Research and writing experience
Ability to draft technical documentation to support IT development as required

Job Summary:
Interested applicants must apply through WaterlooWorks and directly to the employer to be considered for this position (see "Additional Application Information" section).


What is the opportunity?

The primary objective is to work closely with the Director of HR Metrics to build engagement and alignment across all platforms regarding metrics used across all the various reports, dashboards and analysis provided to key stakeholders.  

  

It will involve liaising with key partners in gathering information and requirements on what is currently being used, seeking to understand the key purpose of the artefact, understanding the underlying assumptions on what the metric is that they are currently using, and identifying and documenting opportunities for alignment and highlighting gaps.  It may also involve referencing the various sources of data that are used in generating the artefact and identifying where mapping documents may be required in order to ensure a common understanding and language around the attributes and measures used to generate truly enterprise-wide metrics.  

  

Success in this role will ensure we continue to break down silos and operate as OneRBC, enabling opportunities to not only streamline resources, reduce duplicity but also allow for more value-add work.
Job Responsibilities:
What will you do?

Develop metrics definitions and visualization strategies that can be adopted on an enterprise wide basis through collaborative design thinking. The Student will ensure each platform is included in each and every metric being assessed: Capital Markets, Investor & Treasury Services, Insurance, Personal & Commercial Banking, Technology & Operations, Wealth Management, Ventures and Corporate Development, HR, Administration, Finance, Group Risk Management, Internal Audit, the Office of the CEO.  Where a platform is de-scoped for a metric, the rationale for this decision will be clearly documented by the Student.
Define and document a catalog of metrics, ensuring that the key metrics needed for the Workday launch in Spring 2022 are prioritized - the number of metrics scoped for inclusion and assessment over the duration of the rotation is still to be determined.  This will require an aggressive, but carefully metered approach to ensuring timelines for work sprints of Workday launch are not impeded by, but rather complimented with, the Metrics work.
Ensure that documentation of the process used in gathering requirements, underlying assumptions about metrics definitions, identification of alignment opportunities and valid exceptions is clear enough to serve as a key foundation for future work that will continue on with the metrics and serve to be part of the institutional memory that may be used for other purposes (including the facilitation of change management efforts, and possible effort-to-outcome measurement of the value-add activity).

Design Thinking
Experience with using Tableau, Power BI or any other Data Visualization tools
Proficient use of Microsoft Excel and Word
Intellectual Curiousity
Data driven 
Analytical research and diagnostic capabilities
Strong communication skills

Knowledge of SQL 
HR knowledge and experience strongly valued

Job Summary:
Interested applicants must apply through WaterlooWorks and directly to the employer to be considered for this position (see "Additional Application Information" section).


What is the opportunity?

Are you interested in the opportunity to work as a Credit/Risk Analyst student? If you are a student who has a combination of experience that demonstrates mastery of data analytics, math, computer science, financial engineering, modeling, statistics, or complex problem solving-- by applying to this job posting, you will be considered for positions available across the Group Risk Management group, specifically in the folllowing areas! 
 

Enterprise Model Risk
Global Risk Analytics
Enterprise Credit Stress Testing
Market Risk
Balance Sheet Risk
Wholesale Credit Risk
Counterparty Credit Risk
Job Responsibilities:
What will you do?


Enterprise Model Risk team is looking for a student that will work with the Credit Models and Methodology team. They are responsible for developing and maintaining models in compliant with various (regulatory) programs, including IFRS 9, CECL, CCAR, Basel AIRB, EWST. These models are used to predict the bank's credit losses to help bank keep a reserve, or allowance so that bank can continue to operate with incurred credit losses. This includes support work related to models and advanced applications with a focus on credit risk. 

  

Enterprise Wide StressTesting team is looking for individuals that have a mix of strong quantitative and problem solving skills, communicate well and are able to work through complex and ambiguous challenges. The team primarily is responsible for considering the impact to CET1 capital ratios by running a number of stress scenarios across all risk types. Within the credit stress testing team, they focus on the impact to credit losses in the retail and wholesale books. 

  

Global Risk Analytics team is the center of expertise for models used in risk measurement of market and counterparty credit risk. GRA Risk Methodology team is pioneering of applying machine learning (ML) techniques for risk management in RBC.  In particular, GRA owns the ML models for OSFI reporting regarding large exposure framework (LEF). LEF model uses NLP and ML techniques to extract significant economic relationship among RBC clients from bank's credit documents and then aggregates the RBC exposures and report to OSFI. 

  

Market Risk team provides independent and effective on-site monitoring, controlling and communicating on the nature and extent of all material market and trading credit risks and to ensure the implementation of and compliance with risk management policies and procedures. The incumbent will lead in developing and promoting a "Best in Class" risk oversight environment for the market risk associated with RBC's Counterparty Risk Trading business and activities. 

  

Balance Sheet Risk team has an enterprise-wide mandate, and is RBC's second line of defense in the management of both trading and non-trading market risk. Through direct oversight (Head Office Corporate Treasury, Treasury Services, and the Central Funding Group) or through advice-and-counsel to global GRM teams, GRM-BSR ensures independent monitoring of risk quantification and mitigation activities related to Interest Rate Risk in the Banking Book, Liquidity Risk, and market risk impacts arising from Capital Markets, Insurance, Pensions and Wealth Management exposures. 

  

Wholesale Credit Risk team provides risk assessment and adjudication for complex Capital Markets transactions.  Through effective analysis of business and financial risk, GRM - Credit establishes borrower risk ratings and evaluates proposed client strategies and credit requests in order to provide comprehensive transactional analysis and approval recommendations. he analyst will have responsibility for analyzing and rating Investment Managers and Fund borrowers to whom RBC extends credit and adjudicating vanilla lending and trading transactions from Corporate Banking and Institutional Client & Credit Management ("ICCM") teams. 

  

Counterparty Credit Risk team is looking for a student that will be mainly responsible for performing risk reporting processes to produce daily/weekly and other ad-hoc reports in margin lending, security lending and portfolio analysis. The student will also be responsible for providing quantitative support in OTC derivative transaction credit sizing by simulating potential future exposure, margin loan transaction credit adjudication process by assessing the market and liquidity risk profile of collateral or margined assets. Finally, the candidate will provide support in the automation and improvement of existing processes and reporting under the guidance of senior risk managers.
Required Skills:
What do you need to succeed?

Must-have:

Currently enrolled at a Canadian post-secondary institution with a focus in Statistics, Finance, Engineering, Economics, Business Administration, Computer Science or related programs.
Knowledge of market risk, derivative credit risk, including: Value-at-Risk measurement and back-testing, stress testing and scenario analysis, sensitivity analysis and p/l decomposition, derivative pricing, potential future exposure calculation
Self-motivated individual with a high level of analytical capabilities and attention to detail
Knowledge of markets and products including equity, bond, structured products as well as current and upcoming regulatory/compliance requirements
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Excellent team player with strong interpersonal skills
Ability to work under pressure and against tight deadlines
R and Python programming skills
Good command of Excel, VBA programming and SQL

Nice-to-have:

Progress towards an MBA, MA, MS or equivalent with emphasis in finance, economics, or a quantitative discipline is preferred
CFA or FRM an asset
Previous experience in credit risk/risk in a financial instituation is an asset 
Tableau

Job Summary:
Interested applicants must apply through WaterlooWorks and directly to the employer to be considered for this position (see "Additional Application Information" section).


What is the opportunity?

RBC is reimagining the role we play in our clients' lives. To do this, we created a new organization - RBC Ventures - which operates separately from the core bank business. RBC Ventures works in small agile teams focused on creating new products, services, and businesses, allowing the core business to test new models and develop better relationships outside of traditional banking.
RBC Ventures is looking for an exceptional Strategic Researcher. This individual will play a central role in shaping new products - helping us to bring data-driven validation and the UCD process to support the creation of exceptional user experiences. As well, supporting the brand team in qualitative and quantitative research and competitive analysis. The ideal candidate has training in design research techniques paired with out of the box thinking and a natural sense business and strategic viability.

A little bit about you:

You're a researcher first - you live and breathe the scientific process and excel at bringing qualitative and quantitative validation to the design process. You love the idea of solving meaningful problems through an iterative, human-centered approach.
You are passionate about tying user-needs to business strategy - finding the sweet spot between the technical capabilities, business outcomes and the user requirements.
You get excited about conceptualizing new products and services that don't exist today.
You love working with highly-engaged, motivated teams that are on a quest to change things for the better.
You enjoy synthesizing data and pulling insights from raw data to help define and guide strategies. You have a keen ability to visualize and communicate the key points from several different research streams.
Job Responsibilities:
What will you do?

Work closely with our product, experience design, and technical teams across a number of products and business verticals to validate new product ideas, balancing business goals with optimal user experience.
Work closely with our brand team across a number of our Ventures to help audit mature Ventures, define and redefine new and existing brand strategies and positionings.
Conduct usability test, card sorts, user interviews, ethnographic research, and diary studies - leveraging best in class methodology.
Conduct qualitative and quantitative tests, secondary research mining, synthesize large amounts of data/information, pull out key themes and turn research results into insights.
Articulate results through compelling storytelling to bring user feedback to key stakeholders, supporting the optimization and refinement of cutting edge experiences.
Articulate results through compelling storytelling to bring the stakeholders through the story of the research and data in order to gain buy-in across the team.
Required Skills:
What do you need to succeed?

Must-have:

Are passionate and entrepreneurial; the idea of creating something new from scratch excites and motivates you.
Advocate for users out of a deep empathy for them.
Keen to understand why people do what they do - especially in the context of brand strategy.
Champion all elements of the user experience.
Have a strong understanding of the product design process (including research, user flows, wireframing, prototyping, and testing).
Are able to articulate the thinking & strategy behind their work.
Are confident leading design sprints and managing stakeholders.
Can execute, analyze and synthesize multiple research types.
Prefer to work closely with other disciplines and value the opinion of team members across the company.
Value open communication and working on a small and transparent team.

Nice-to-have:

Strong skills & working knowledge of the tools of the trade (usability testing, Optimal Workshop, Usertesting.com, etc.)
Demonstrated ability to deliver well-thought-out design recommendations based on user research (portfolio)
Experience working in fast paced, experimental or start-up environments
Design skills in Figma, Sketch and Creative Suite a bonus
Understanding of statistics and quantitative analysis a bonus
Understanding of brand strategy a bonus

Job Summary:

What is the opportunity?

RBC is a global leader in applying Artificial Intelligence (AI)  in various aspects of banking in order to creat value for our clients; from advice center chatbots and intlligent mobile app features in personal banking to AI- powered algorithmic trading agents in capital markets. A failure to effectively prepare for and manage emerging model risk related to AI would subject RBC to unwarranted potential financial, regulatory, and reputational risks. 

  

The Enterprise Model Risk Management (EMRM)- AI model validation team within the RBC Group Risk Management is mandated with quantification and management of the potential model risk arising from deploying AI powered techologies across the bank. 

  

The Research Scientist (AI Model Validation) Student will be working closely with the senior AI-scientists and risk managers to further develop the bank's model risk framework for testing and monitoring of Machine Learning models. What is the opportunity?

Who wouldn't want to be a part of a fantastic team of Data Scientists?  At RBC, our Data Science teams offer the opportunity to leverage RBC's data assets to develop innovative solutions in support of RBCs big data strategy. This position is an essential part to the bank as you develop next-generation applications to meet our customers' needs. By joining the RBC team as a Data Scientist, you will have the opportunity to analyze, design and implement data solutions to assist all business customers.
Job Responsibilities:
What will you do?

Utilizing the latest technologies available, designing and building data solutions to meet business needs
Be an active contributor to not only your individual team, but to the RBC development community
Constantly seek out better ways to do things, new tools, new technologies, new processes
Work on transformational projects delivering new value
Work as part of an agile team responsible for end-to-end delivery of business needs
Deploy production-scale solutions using the Hadoop Ecosystem, transforming statistical and machine learning models from single node architecture to parallel processing grid technology
Use business domain knowledge to independently lead the analytics process to identify valuable and innovative insights
Promote analytics across the enterprise to enable RBC to become a data-driven organization
Required Skills:
What do you need to succeed?

Must-have
 

Advanced programming skills in one or more of the following languages: Python or R
Extensive experience utilizing SQL scripts/querying
Proficient in building statistical and algorithmic models with complex and large datasets, including but not limited to: supervised statistical learning, clustering, natural language processing, recommendation systems, times-series analysis, experimental design (A/B testing), data visualization, deep learning
Expert in data extract, transform, and load processes with a variety of data types
Ability to perform complex data analysis on large volumes of data and present findings to stakeholders

Nice-to-have

 

Experience with big data technologies, primarily in machine learning and statistics function
Exposure to Apache Spark, Hadoop and Public Cloud technologies
Experience with big data processing tools like Spark and Hive
GitHub functionality and workflow experience/exposure
Experience with data serialization (JSON, Avro, Parquet, ORC)
Experience with messaging (Kafka, Solace, RabbitMQ)
Experience working on Agile projects

What is the opportunity?

Who wouldn't want to be a part of a fantastic team of Data Scientists?  At RBC, our Data Science teams offer the opportunity to leverage RBC's data assets to develop innovative solutions in support of RBCs big data strategy. This position is an essential part to the bank as you develop next-generation applications to meet our customers' needs. By joining the RBC team as a Data Scientist, you will have the opportunity to analyze, design and implement data solutions to assist all business customers. Please only apply if you are available for 8 months.

Utilize the latest technologies available, designing and building data solutions to meet business needs
Be an active contributor to not only your individual team, but to the RBC development community

Work on transformational projects delivering new value
Work as part of an agile team responsible for end-to-end delivery of business needs
Deploy production-scale solutions using the Hadoop Ecosystem, transforming statistical and machine learning models from single node architecture to parallel processing grid technology

What is the opportunity?

We're looking for an enthusiastic software engineer who's excited by the opportunity of being at the forefront of machine learning technology, and working on extremely challenging problems. As a Co-op Machine Learning Software Engineer, you'll be involved a project end to end - everything from data pre-processing to implementing machine learning algorithms and front-end development. 


At Borealis AI, you'll be joining a team that works directly with leading researchers in machine learning, has access to rich and massive datasets, and offers the computational resources to support ongoing development in areas such as reinforcement learning, unsupervised learning and computer vision. You can find out more about our research areas at borealisai.com. 


About Borealis AI

Borealis AI, a RBC Institute for Research, is a curiosity-driven research centre dedicated to achieving state-of-the-art in machine learning. Established in 2016, and with labs in Toronto, Montreal, Waterloo and Vancouver, we support academic collaborations and partner with world-class research centres in artificial intelligence. With a focus on ethical AI that will help communities thrive, our machine learning scientists perform fundamental and applied research in areas such as reinforcement learning, natural language processing, deep learning, and unsupervised learning to solve ground-breaking problems in diverse fields.

Job Summary:
Do you want to work in a dynamic environment and make a difference to both people and planet? Do you want to work on a flagship software package where your work will be used around the world? Does the idea of continued learning in your coop placement and your future career excite you? Do you want to work as a part of a multi-disciplinary team with engineers and designers who are developing innovative oceanography devices? 


Are you looking for an exciting opportunity to apply your energy and develop your skills within a diverse research and development team?  The Software Developer Co-Op is a member of a team of experienced engineers, designers, and technologists who are designing and building sensors, instruments, and OEM assemblies for use around the world and in all ocean conditions to gather the best data possible for scientists and researchers. 


As a Software Developer Co-Op at RBR, you will work in conjunction with the entire engineering team to develop our flagship Ruskin software which enables researchers to deploy oceanographic sensors and recover data effectively, as well as enable internal users to configure and calibrate these devices.  


RBR creates instruments to measure the blue planet. From the ocean abyss to the polar ice cap, our sensors track water parameters such as temperature, depth, salinity, dissolved gases, and many others. RBR equipment enables researchers to develop innovative measurement solutions that are deployed in the surf zone, mounted on underwater drones, dropped out of planes, towed behind boats, and sent to the bottom of the deep, dark ocean. 


Over the last five years, we've grown 20% annually and are now 50+ people. We've been recognized for three years by Growth 500 and have won a Best Ottawa Business Award!  We are located in a brilliant new space in the heart of Ottawa's tech capital. 


We provide a work environment that will expose you to experiences that will shape your career. 


The Software Developer Co-op Student reports to the Software Manager and will be involved in advancing the Ruskin software as well as other in house RBR processes. The position will require a combination of coding, testing, and troubleshooting skills to provide support to the Software Engineering team throughout their term with RBR. 


The ideal candidate will have the following characteristics:


- Enjoy fast paced work environments; 

- Enjoy unique design challenges; 

- Creative; 

- Resourceful.

Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Computing: Software

				MATH - Computer Science

Job Summary:
Do you want to work in a dynamic environment and make a difference to both people and planet?  


Are you looking for an exciting opportunity to apply your energy and develop your skills within a diverse research and development team? As Mechanical Co-Op at RBR, you will have the opportunity to learn from and work with a dynamic group of R&D professionals in the areas of firmware, electronics, mechanical, software, systems, and sensor engineering and oceanography. You'll have the opportunity to work in a vertically integrated company gaining experience from product concept to deployment support while working closely with a team of experienced engineers and designers whose vision is to be the most innovative mechanical team in physical oceanography. 


RBR creates instruments to measure the blue planet. From the ocean abyss to the polar ice cap, our sensors track water parameters such as temperature, depth, salinity, dissolved gases, and many others. RBR equipment enables researchers to develop innovative measurement solutions that are deployed in the surf zone, mounted on underwater drones, dropped out of planes, towed behind boats, and sent to the bottom of the deep, dark ocean. 


We provide a work environment that will expose you to experiences that will shape your career. 


The Mechanical Co-Op is a member of a team of experienced engineers, designers, and technologists who are designing and building sensors, instruments, and OEM assemblies for use in all ocean conditions to gather the best data for scientists and researchers. 

The Mechanical Co-Op will be involved deeply in using SolidWorks software to create models and drawings of various designs, from custom shipping foam for our precious instruments to cutting edge new sensor design.  In this role you will be working within an agile team to deliver documentation used in design, production and sales of OEM assemblies.  ?To apply, you must prepare a cover letter that references RBR, how you are uniquely suited for this role, what makes you exceptional and what will make you an outstanding part of the RBR team.

Job Summary:
RDH is an employee owned consulting firm with 250+ employees in nine offices throughout North America. Our core area of business is the integration of building science engineering, architecture, and construction management to optimize the performance of the building enclosure (walls, windows and roofs). Since our beginnings in 1997, we have become industry leaders in North America and continue to grow as we focus on technical excellence and delivering high-quality projects. We approach projects with a multi-faceted and distinctly advanced understanding of building enclosures. 


Summary 

Your responsibilities will be varied as is typical in a mid-size engineering office. Although it is difficult to identify which projects you will be working on at this time, we anticipate that your primary responsibilities will likely include assisting more senior staff. This role is based in our New Buildings service area which includes Facade Structures. 


Our core areas of work include collaborating with design teams for new building construction projects, the forensic investigation and renewal of existing buildings, building asset management to assist building owners' with the long-term upkeep and efficient use of their facilities, and building science research to identify ways of improving our building stock.
Job Responsibilities:
Responsibilities

As an engineering co-op work term student at RDH you will work directly with the senior staff of the firm on a variety of projects. Specific tasks and responsibilities will include the following: 

- Field review of building enclosure components for new construction and renewal projects. 

- On-site performance testing of building enclosure assemblies, including air leakage and window water testing. 

- Investigation of existing buildings, including visual review of as built conditions, documenting conditions via field notes, sketches, and photos, and providing recommendations for repair, renewal or rehabilitation. 

- Design and implementation of building asset management programs. 

- Research and testing in our in-house lab for new technologies and strategies for reducing energy consumption, optimizing resources, and improving durability of buildings.
Required Skills: We hire enthusiastic engineering students who have basic training in building science engineering (building science, structural and mechanical engineering, or architecture) along with some practical field experience in construction. We value innovative thinking, teamwork, and great communication skills. Most importantly, you must have a strong interest in the field of building science.

Job Summary:
Specializing in structural engineering, building science, structural restoration, structural glass engineering, parking facility design and building energy modelling, RJC Engineers (RJC) is one of Canada's leading engineering firms. Recognized as an exceptional workplace, we mentor the next generation of Canada's 'best and brightest' engineers and technologists. With offices and expertise across Canada, we challenge our people to push technical boundaries and provide leadership in our fields of practice, while providing services for clients and projects nationwide. 


We believe in taking care of our people and help them realize their full potential. RJC offers the opportunity to work in an engaging team environment where you will work on exciting and challenging projects, discover new and developing technologies, practices and techniques and where you will flourish in a culture of continuous learning and collaboration. Working under the guidance of leading technical specialists who broadly share their expertise, you will get to fine tune your skills and cultivate your expertise while being given the opportunity to pursue your professional goals. 


Candidate Profile

As a member of our Structual team, the successful student will work in both a group environment as well as on an individual basis. The student will work under the direction of a Project Engineer of the project team, and will not only learn about engineering from a technical perspective, but will also learn business acumen, teamwork and leadership.
