About us

Red Canari is a Canadian cybersecurity consultancy focused on delivering high quality, high assurance cyber consultancy services. We are fortunate to enjoy mutual commitment with a global base of anchor clients operating across several sectors - Aviation & Aerospace, Finance, Healthcare, Hi- tech, Governmental Departments and Military Commands. It is our privilege and honour to help our clients navigate the security landscape and exercise due care in order to achieve higher levels of cyber resiliency. 


We are world-renowned security researchers/hackers, who present proprietary projects on the world stage of cybersecurity including DEF CON and Black Hat. Our endeavour is to continuously redefine excellence in the field of information security.
Job Responsibilities:
Explore the role

  

What you will do 

 
 

Work closely with the cybersecurity team and managing directors to develop new software and improve existing software applications while maintaining understanding of relevant technological developments
Carry out detailed code reviews complying with coding standards
Experience testing applications with Dynamic Application Security Testing (DAST) techniques, manual processes, and automated tools.
Experience working with Windows or UNIX- based environments (i.e. Linux, BSD, etc.).
Knowledge of common networking concepts.
Knowledge of common web application (i.e. OWASP) and infrastructure-based vulnerabilities.
Experience with software development in one or more common languages such as JAVA, JavaScript, Python, .NET, etc.
Ensure consistent quality of all implemented designs and maintain business standards
Initiate creative and innovative solutions while minimizing risks
Troubleshoot, investigate and resolve highly complex application defects to maintain automatization and code quality

  

  

Professional development activities 

 Writing security blog posts
 Presenting at Security conference talk

  

Soft skills 

Take initiative on client projects and deliverables
Interface and communicate clearly with team members
Actively contribute and participate in community and corporate events
Represent and evangelize the corporation

Actively and independently involved in open-source projects.
Actively and independently or professionally involved in security testing (i.e. via Bug Bounties, corporate engagements, etc.).
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or equivalent
Experience with React, NodeJS, Ant Design GraphQLPostgres, MySQL, (Hasura preferred) OAuth 2.0
Ability to draft system documentation and diagnose system, coding and infrastructure deficiencies
High performing technical skills with the ability to assess and suggest designs and solutions to address complex issues while adhering to strict deadlines

Excellent written and oral communication skills to collaborate with teams, senior management, and stakeholders as well develop technical reports
Strategic and technical individual with demonstrated strong customer focus

Job Title:

Job Summary:
About Us 

The Region of Peel serves more than 1.4 million residents and approximately 173,000 businesses in Brampton, Caledon and Mississauga. We deliver a wide range of resident focused services across the Region. Our 20-year vision for Peel is "Community for Life." Our goal is to create a place where everyone enjoys a sense of belonging and has access to the services and opportunities needed to thrive in each stage of their lives. Our 2015-2035 Strategic Plan outlines the work we're focused on to bring this vision to life. To learn more about the Region of Peel, explore peelregion.ca. 

  

CO-OP STUDENT ANALYST 

Health Planning & Performance (HPP) 

Health Services 

  

The HPP team is a group of professionals dedicated to supporting the Region of Peel's Health Services department in the areas of strategic planning, performance measurement, program evaluation and process improvement. HPP is part of the Strategic Policy and Performance Division. 


As a member of the team, the Co-op Student Analyst will support project leads drive key projects and milestones forward across the Health Services department, which includes Public Health, Paramedic Services, Long Term Care and Seniors Services Development.

Liaise and collaborate with multiple project stakeholders
Facilitate virtual meetings, process mapping and training sessions

Research and critically appraise literature, write reports and prepare presentations
Collect data through interviews, focus groups, environmental scans, literature reviews, etc.
Succinctly synthesize and summarize findings for informed decision making
Analyze and synthesize data to identify themes or trends

Knowledge and interest in process and quality improvement (e.g. six sigma or LEAN), strategic planning, performance measurement, and evaluation gained
Passion for teamwork and collaborative approaches
Ability to lead/support multiple projects and be flexible to changing priorities
Ability to synthesize and organize information
Attention to detail and works well independently

Intermediate skills using Microsoft O365, Teams, SharePoint

Job Title:
NEW
									



										Assistant Technical Analyst (Water and Waste Education)
Division: Public Works, Operations Support, Education Programs and Services
Job Summary:
The Region of Peel, comprised of the Cities of Mississauga and Brampton and the Town of Caledon, is a blend of urban, rural and residential areas. We are one of Ontario's fastest growing municipalities, delivering a wide range of municipal services to over 1.4 million residents and a thriving business community. 

  

Working with the Environmental Education team, you will be joining a dynamic group of individuals who are dedicated to promoting and educating citizens and businesses in the Region of Peel about Public Works programs. Through our environmental education programs, you will be shaping the next generation of citizens to be environmental stewards. We are seeking outgoing, self-starters who possesses strong presentation, organization, and written and oral communication skills. Visit www.peelregion.ca/enviroed for more information about the Environmental Education team.
Job Responsibilities:
This posting is for two Assistant Technical Analyst positions - 1) Water Education, and 2) Waste Education. 

  

Your co-op term will focus on supporting the development and delivery of water or waste education programs for the Region of Peel. This entails several activities, including, but not limited to the following:
 

Assist with the development, implementation and evaluation of activities, lesson plans, and other materials to support  education  of school-age (grades K-12) students in Water Education and Waste Education.


Delivery of in-person and/or online  education programs.
Compile, analyze and monitor data to identify trends and assess performance of educational resources and program.
 Support with program promotions through flyers, e-newsletters, social media content, etc.
Research relevant educational programs and resources in the community to support water and waste education. Assist with facilitating online sessions for program promotion.
Assist with other Environmental Education team  programs  including the redevelopment of the Region's Water Efficiency Strategy.
Other duties as assigned.
Required Skills:
Enrolled in a post-secondary education program with a focus on Environmental Studies, Environmental Sciences, Geography, Biology, Planning, Communications, Education, or other related program.
General knowledge of Region of Peel Public Works programs and topics including water efficiency, water and wastewater treatment, water quality and waste management is an asset.
Valid unrestricted driver's license (G2 or higher, held for a minimum of 6 months) and be comfortable driving on 400 series highways and throughout the Region of Peel is mandatory.
Experience working with school-age children ages 3 - 17 is an asset.
Strong oral and written communication skills.
Strong data analysis skills.
Detail-oriented.
Comfortable conducting presentations to varying ages.
Strong time management and organizational skills.
Capable of working in a team setting as well as independently without supervision.
Technical knowledge of video conferencing platforms such as Microsoft Teams, Google Classroom, etc.

  

Note: Interested candidates should be comfortable in a school classroom setting and conducting presentations. A valid driver's license (G2 or higher, held for a minimum of 6 months), the ability to pass a required Region of Peel driving test, and the ability to obtain a clear Police Vulnerable Sector Check to the satisfaction of the Region are mandatory. Safety shoes are required for this position.

Job Summary:
The Regional Municipality of Peel is the upper-tier municipality located immediately to the west of the City of Toronto, comprised of the Town of Caledon, City of Brampton, and the City of Mississauga.  Peel is a vibrant and culturally diverse community of 1.5 million residents and 165,000 businesses that's experiencing rapid growth.  Peel Region also contains wide swaths of agricultural and natural areas, falling within the jurisdiction of the Niagara Escarpment Plan, the Oak Ridges Moraine Conservation Plan, and the Greenbelt Plan. 


The Information Management Division enables the effective delivery of services to best meet the needs of the residents and businesses of Peel.  Within this Division, the Peel Data Centre is responsible for the provision of data and analysis across the corporation, Geographic Information Systems (GIS), supporting the Regional Official Plan, and the Region's Open Data program. 


The Peel Data Centre has a reputation for service and quality.  Our aim is to work with students to enhance their skillsets, experience, and professional development through motivation and teamwork with a wide range of projects.  Our co-op students are an important part of the team, bringing new ideas, skills, and experiences to the Peel Data Centre.  We encourage our co-op students to expand their skills and knowledge through learning on the job.  Your valued role will be to participate in GIS activities and support the continued development of the Peel Data Centre.
Job Responsibilities:
Acquiring, creating, and/or maintaining GIS data.
Producing online and paper maps.
Collecting, organizing, analyzing, and sharing tabular data.  For example: demographic, socio-economic, and housing data from the Census.
Working directly with internal and external clients to respond to map, data, or other requests the team receives.
Applying your knowledge to solve problems and improve processes within the team.
Assisting with other projects on the team.
Required Skills:
A thorough understanding of GIS concepts.
Experience with Esri ArcGIS and ArcGIS Online.
Experience editing tabular and GIS data using industry best practises.
Familiarity with different data sources, for example: Statistics Canada (Census), MPAC (assessment databases), Land Information Ontario (LIO), conservation authorities, and local municipalities.
Experience with spreadsheet and database software, e.g. Microsoft Excel.
Basic understanding of urban and rural planning concepts.
Strong analytical, research, and communication skills.
Interest in improving and pushing your skills with GIS, data, automation, and communication.
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:

				- Theme - Visual, Urban & Industrial Design 
				
			
				ENV - Business, Enterprise and Development
				
			
				ENV - Geography and Environmental Management
				
			
				ENV - Geomatics
				
			
				ENV - Planning

Job Summary:
Providing safe and reliable drinking water for the residents of Waterloo Region is our business. We help shape sustainable growth in our community by ensuring the infrastructure is in place to support it. The Engineering and Planning group is responsible for providing technical support for our division. Our diverse mandate allows us to customize the co-op term experience to the successful candidate. Students become exposed to all aspects of our business which spans Engineering, Land Use Planning, Geomatics, and Geography and Environmental Science disciplines. 


The Student Coordinator - Engineering and Planning can be involved with:
 

Distribution system modeling and engineering drawing review.
 Reviewing and commenting on a variety of different applications, and coordinate with planners all across the Region.
 Developing transferable Geographical Information System (GIS) analytical and programming skills working with large amounts of data.
 Developing maps and tools to be used by engineers, hydrogeologists, planners, and the public
Job Responsibilities:
The student will be involved with:
 

Updating the divisional GIS database (DOCSDRAW) as supplied from engineering drawings
Reviewing and updating existing infrastructure in the model with data supplied by local municipalities.
Comparing multiple datasets and identify continuities and discrepancies.
Assisting with organizing and updating geographic datasets
Reviewing development applications as pertaining to Water Services concerns 

Some occassional seasonal field work may be required as part of data collection and verification, use of a personal vehicle may be required.
Required Skills:
The student should have the following skill sets:
 

Experience using ESRI GIS Technology, including ArcMap, ArcCatalog, ArcGIS Pro etc. in a professional setting
Experience analyzing, managing, and maintaining complex geographic data sets
Knowledge of editing geographic datasets while adhering to topology rules
Microsoft Access and Excel
Analytical and detail oriented
Programming knowledge using Python
Experience with models pertaining to water distribution and/or  collection systems (Infowater )
Knowledge of water distribution systems and wastewater collection systems

Job Title: Hydrogeology and Source Water Protection Student
Job Summary:
The Region of Waterloo is comprised of three urban centres (Cambridge, Kitchener, and Waterloo) and four rural townships (North Dumfries, Wellesley, Wilmot, and Woolwich). The Region provides residents with approximately 180 million litres of drinking water and treats 170 million litres of wastewater everyday. Approximately 75% of the Region of Waterloo's municipal water supply comes from groundwater resources. Source water is vulnerable to contamination from certain activities; it is important that we monitor it closely and ensure that the water is safe and clean from the source to the tap. 


The Hydrogeology and Source Water (HSW) group implements policies in the Grand River Source Protection Plan, including the negotiation of Risk Management Plans for applicable prescribed activities under the Clean Water Act, commenting on pre-submission applications to advise of applicable Source Protection Plan policies, directly communicating with property owners and representatives (site visits, phone calls, emails) to confirm activities/property uses and practice information, and managing/entering/monitoring public user and internal staff generated data through the Region's customized web-mapping and workflow data management system.
Job Responsibilities:
Duties/Responsibilities: 

 

Assists in the development and maintenance of data tracking for programs, including information collected from site visits, reports by other divisional staff and consultants, and contained within Region applications and databases. 
Liaises and communicates regularly with the public, businesses, and institutions to explain program objectives, collect site and practice information, and confirm property uses and activities (by phone, business site visits, and email).  
Reviews Planning Act development applications and technical drawings, and provides comments on policy applicability and other requirements. 
Analyses available datasets to identify potential data gaps. Assembles external datasets from the Province and others to supplement the Region's databases. 
Reviews technical reports prepared by consultants, and summarizes information for other divisional staff.
Prepares data reports and mapping, as requested. 
Uses a computer approximately 80% of the time. Attends meetings and communicates with others approximately 20% of the time. 
Works in a standard office environment. Occasionally travels to business sites to collect information (approximately 1-2 times/week). 
Performs related duties, as assigned.
Required Skills:
Knowledge, Skills & Abilities: 

 

Knowledge and familiarity of source water protection and the Clean Water Act, acquired through current enrolment in a post-secondary program in a related field (e.g., Science, Engineering, Environmental Studies, Planning). 
Knowledge of and ability to follow policies and procedures. 
Organizational, problem solving, and planning skills to work independently; complete projects within established timelines; and adapt to changing priorities. 
Human relations and communication skills to interact with businesses, institutions, and the public to collect/exchange information and provide program information; and participate as an effective team member.    
Computer skills with knowledge and ability to use software such as Microsoft Office (including Microsoft Excel), Microsoft Access, SQL, and geographic information systems/databases (e.g., ArcGIS, ESRI ArcGIS). Knowledge of database design and query procedures.
Cartographic skills, including map projections, coordinate systems, and effective display/ incorporation of information on a map. 
Ability to travel within Waterloo Region. 
Ability to support and demonstrate the Region's values.
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Natural Resource Management 
				
			
				ENG - Civil, Environmental and Geological Engineering
				
			
				ENV - Environment, Resources and Sustainability
				
			
				ENV - Geography and Environmental Management
				
			
				ENV - Planning
				
			
				SCI - Earth, Environmental and Geological Sciences
Application Documents Required: University of Waterloo Co-op Work History,Résumé,Grade Report

Job Summary:
Are you interested in exploring the relationship between urban growth and how we move around our communities? We need an energetic student who likes being busy, facing challenges that matter and is interested in public transit, transportation planning and urban planning. This position is an opportunity to build on the successes of Grand River Transit (GRT) and the recent implementation of Rapid Transit (ION) in Waterloo Region. 


This position assists with all functions of the Transit Development area of GRT, combining research, mapping, analytics, and field work to inform decisions related to routing and scheduling of transit service in the Region.
Job Responsibilities:
In general, the responsibilities of the job include the following elements: 


- Provides planning, technical, research, and analytical support. 

- Participates through individual projects and study teams; collects and analyzes related data. 

- Conducts research and surveys. 

- Uses statistical and/or transportation planning models. 

- Assists in preparations for and/or participates in public meetings. 

- Works some extended hours to attend public meetings or conduct surveys. **not likely required at this time due to COVID-19** 


Some of the specific tasks could include: 


- Assists in the development of service changes that could occur in 2022. 

- Analyses and checks reliability of data obtained from electronic fareboxes and AVL/APC (automatic vehicle location/automatic passenger counter) systems. 

- Assists in monitoring routes. 

- Assists in bus stop and route corridor analysis, including stop infrastructure planning. 

- Conducts surveys through travel on routes or at a bus stop. **likely not on the routes themselves due to COVID-19** 

- Presents results in GIS map format for use by other staff, in reports, or for public presentations.
Required Skills:
- Knowledge of transportation planning and public transit, transportation policy formulation and implementation, and development planning, acquired through current enrolment in a University Geography, Planning, Environment and Business, or related program. 

- Ability to work independently and organize time to accommodate multiple tasks. 

- Research, report writing, and analytical skills. 

- Computer skills using software such as MS Office and Geographic Information Systems (e.g., ArcMap). 

- Ability to prepare, write, and read technical and research reports; compile statistical information; interpret and explain data; and prepare presentations for different audiences. 

- Ability to travel to various locations within Waterloo Region. 

- Ability to support and project values compatible with the organization.
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Public Policy, Public Service and Government Relations 
				
			
				- Theme - Visual, Urban & Industrial Design 
				
			
				ENG - Civil, Environmental and Geological Engineering
				
			
				ENV - Geography and Environmental Management
				
			
				ENV - Planning

Job Summary:
About Relay


Our mission is to increase the success rate of small business. We believe that banking is a growth limiter rather than a growth enabler for business owners, and we're changing that. We're building turbocharged business banking. With Relay, business owners can open an account in minutes, issue corporate cards in seconds and automate their bookkeeping. 


The Role


We're looking for an incredible software engineering student, who loves delivering robust code, is eager for high-impact work, and wants to help shape the future of Relay.  


If you join us, you will have:

- A huge impact building solutions with the potential to reach 29 million small businesses across North America 

- Personal and professional growth. We care about getting better everyday and leveling up. 

- An outstanding work environment that is passionate about getting stuff done, collaboration, learning and having fun. 


At Relay, we believe that diversity is key to building high-performing teams, and creating an inclusive work environment is our priority. We are an equal opportunity employer and we welcome people of diverse backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We will work with applicants to provide accommodations at any stage of the hiring process.
Job Responsibilities:
Some of the things we'd love to have you do during your term:

- Develop and ship functionality that meaningfully improves our customers' lives 

- Help develop testing strategies to ensure product quality 

- Work with product management to plan features and estimate their complexity 

- Fix bugs as and when they come up 

- Support customer service if there's a pressing issue
Required Skills:
You are the ideal candidate if you:

- Have experience with Javascript - we're a Node.js, Typescript and React shop 

- Are perpetually curious and always learning - whether about the latest languages, frameworks, best practices or the tech industry in general 

- Are a team-player - our team is small and mighty, and we collaborate constantly - we want someone who is always willing to pitch in and isn't afraid to ask for help 

- Are a self-starter, a problem-solver, and a creative thinker
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Computing: Software
				
			
				- Theme - Finance and Investment 
				
			
				ENG - Software Engineering
				
			
				MATH - Computer Science
Application Documents Required: University of Waterloo Co-op Work History,Résumé,Grade Report

Job Summary:
About Relay Platform ("Relay")

Building the next generation of technology for the Commercial Lines insurance and reinsurance markets, Relay works with forward-looking brokerages to deliver increased volumes, higher commissions and maximal efficiency. Relay is headquartered in Toronto, Canada, with team members and operations in the US, as well as an expanding activity internationally. Relay is backed by top tier venture investors, including Fortune-500 American Family Insurance, NFP Ventures, Highline BETA, and Plug and Play Ventures. In 2020 alone, Relay joined the reputed Insurtech100 list, was listed as top 10 Insurtech by Plug and Play, and won Reaction's Innovator of the Year award. 


About the role

This is your chance to join a fast-track insurtech venture on a mission to take the commercial (re)insurance placement workflow into the 21st century and beyond. 

As a key member of our engineering team, you will participate and be a key member in the development of our next-generation (re)insurance placement platform. With the startup culture of our company, you will get a chance to be exposed to and participate in all aspects of software development from front/backend, to DevOps, to architecture.

Job Summary:
This is your chance to join a fast-track insurtech venture on a mission to take the commercial (re)insurance placement workflow into the 21st century and beyond. 

Working as part of Relay's Product & Engineering team you will work closely with Relay's Design team to help ensure we maintain a high level of quality and polish in the features we deliver to end users through feature acceptance testing and sprint-to-sprint regression testing. 

Our teams have a high degree of autonomy and ownership and we are looking for candidates who can work with minimal supervision.
Job Responsibilities:
We are looking for a Software Developer In Test with a passion and entrepreneurial spirit for contributing to a solution that will revolutionize the way things are done in a huge, established market. 


Your core responsibilities will be to:

Ensure we deliver a high-quality product through feature acceptance testing;
Run and maintain a sprint-to-sprint regression test suite to prevent new development from breaking existing features
Work closely with the rest of the Product & Engineering team as new features are developed to build out test plans and testing strategies
Build out our automated end-to-end test suite to increase application coverage as the product develops
Work directly with the QA and engineering teams to continue to develop our QA process
This is a highly entrepreneurial opportunity and you will be part of the first wave of collaborators, with the ability to shape both the business and your role as you go forward and build credibility and trust with our team and partners.
Required Skills:
You're perfect for this role if you:
 

Enjoy picking things apart and digging in to find the edge-cases that haven't been thought of Have strong communication skills to feed back accurate bug reports to the rest of the Product & Engineering team
Have a strong interest in leveraging the latest tech and frameworks, and generally turning innovation into real-world products;
Are results-driven with a strong ownership mentality and drive to deliver on schedule and problem-solve independently in a dynamic, fast-paced environment;
Are a team player who openly shares information, helps others, and is open to new ideas and "going the extra mile" when needed.


Your track record should include:
 

Experience working as part of a development team to test web based applications
Any development experience with end-to-end testing libraries, particularly TestCafe, is a plus
Knowledge of web technologies and the differences between various browser and OS environments and how that can impact web software
A drive to get better every day, demonstrated by evident career progression and explorations;
Experience working with a small team towards aggressive product development milestones, with a strong appreciation of business needs

Job Summary:
Do you want to apply what you're learning today to contribute to the games of tomorrow?
Are you interested to see what's it like to ship a AAA title?
If so, our Programmer Co-op (Game Development) role is the perfect fit for you!


Relic Entertainment is a wholly owned studio of SEGA. We are an award-winning developer of genre-defining games like Homeworld, Dawn of War, Company of Heroes, and Age of Empires. We have delivered rich, thoughtful strategy games throughout our history and our vision is to continue making games that people love to play.

As a co-op in programming at Relic, you will have the opportunity to do interesting work while being truly integrated into our game development team. We'll provide mentorship from some of the industry's best programmers, the tools you need, and an opportunity to work on real programming challenges.

This is a 4/8/12-month (with a preference to longer) work term starting January 2022.

We are hiring in the following areas:

Game Development
Relic's Game Development team builds features to realize the game design vision and create compelling experiences for players to enjoy.  Programmers who enjoy working collaboratively to support creative content developers will thrive on our Game Development team.

Front-End Systems
Relic's Core team builds the low level of the Essence Game Engine that powers all of Relic's games. As part of Core, the Front-End Systems team includes areas such as the underlying UI engine, server communications, gameplay data management, and common front-end functionality across all of Relic's games. Programmers who want to learn and work on a game engine, and architectural problems and systems that live on through many games will fit well on the Front-End Systems team.

Systems
Relic's Core Systems team builds the low level of the Essence Game Engine that powers all of Relic's games. The Engine includes areas such as physics, animation, effects, terrain and performance. Programmers who want to learn and work on a game engine, optimization problems and systems that live on through many games will fit well on the Systems team.

Are you game? We'd like to hear from you!
Please apply through your school's career portal. Email Katie.Clark@relic.com if you have any questions or concerns.

This is Relic  
We have a culture of kindness, transparency, and play. There is a lot of heart and passion at this studio: we get to work on projects we're proud of and we work hard to be the best at what we do. We are curious, we strive for excellence, we build on each other's ideas, and we celebrate each other's great work. Relicans organize movie nights, game tournaments, life drawing, community and charity events, and more. Basically, we believe that good work starts with a community you're excited to spend your day with, both in and out of the studio.
You will also become part of the SEGA family (in addition to Relic, this includes Creative Assembly, Sports Interactive, HARDlight Studio, and Amplitude Studios), which gives us access to the resources to enable us to build on our legacy of innovation. 
 
Covid-19 Update
In the current circumstances, our studio has transitioned to a working-from-home environment. While we have started a phased return back into our studio in Vancouver, there is a possibility that your experience may be entirely remote (depending on current circumstances and government guidelines). Our studio maintains core office hours of 10am PST - 4pm PST. We understand each person's circumstances may be unique and will work with you to support your onboarding and work experience with us.

Want to see what's in store for our next project?
Check out the trailer here and follow along on social:
Facebook
Twitter 
Instagram
Job Responsibilities:
As our Programmer Co-op (Game Development), you will:

Write code that contributes to Relic's next games to market
Collaborate with other team members to design and architect your code
Gain experience in areas such as gameplay, AI, UI and graphics programming
Participate in planning, scrums, code and design reviews
Work closely with cross-disciplinary teams, including artists, designers, producers, and animators
Receive a credit on the titles you contribute to and experience shipping a AAA title
Required Skills:
You would be a great fit if you have:

Completed at least the second year of a Computer Science or Engineering degree
Proficiency in C++ and a strong understanding of object-oriented programming principles
Some game programming experience such as other co-op terms, making games in your spare time, game jams/hackathons, or projects on Github/your website for us to see
A passion for games and curiosity for solving complex problems
A desire to learn, share, and grow with us

It's a bonus if you have:

Experience working on a mod for a game
Experience with OpenGL or Direct 3D
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Computing: Software
				
			
				ENG - Electrical and Computer Engineering
				
			
				MATH - Computer Science

Job Summary:
Do you want to work at one of the most recognized RTS games studio in Canada? 
Do you want to apply what you're learning today to contribute to the games of tomorrow?
If so, our Server Programmer (Co-op) role is the perfect fit for you!


Relic Entertainment is a wholly owned studio of SEGA. We are an award-winning developer of genre-defining games like Homeworld, Dawn of War, Company of Heroes, and Age of Empires. We have delivered rich, thoughtful strategy games throughout our history and our vision is to continue making games that people love to play.

As a co-op in programming at Relic, you will have the opportunity to do interesting work while being truly integrated into our game development team. We'll provide mentorship from some of the industry's best programmers, the tools you need, and an opportunity to work on real programming challenges.

This is a 4/8/12-month (with a preference to longer) work term starting January 2022.

Are you game? We'd like to hear from you!
Please apply through your school's career portal. Email Katie.Clark@relic.com if you have any questions or concerns.

This is Relic  
We have a culture of kindness, transparency, and play. There is a lot of heart and passion at this studio: we get to work on projects we're proud of and we work hard to be the best at what we do. We are curious, we strive for excellence, we build on each other's ideas, and we celebrate each other's great work. Relicans organize movie nights, game tournaments, life drawing, community and charity events, and more. Basically, we believe that good work starts with a community you're excited to spend your day with, both in and out of the studio.
You will also become part of the SEGA family (in addition to Relic, this includes Creative Assembly, Sports Interactive, HARDlight Studio, and Amplitude Studios), which gives us access to the resources to enable us to build on our legacy of innovation. 
 
Covid-19 Update
In the current circumstances, our studio has transitioned to a working-from-home environment. While we have started a phased return back into our studio in Vancouver, there is a possibility that your experience may be entirely remote (depending on current circumstances and government guidelines). Our studio maintains core office hours of 10am PST - 4pm PST. We understand each person's circumstances may be unique and will work with you to support your onboarding and work experience with us.

Want to see what's in store for our next project?
Check out the trailer here and follow along on social:
Facebook
Twitter 
Instagram

Develop the server infrastructure needed for the next generation of our games
Collaborate with other team members to design and architect your code
Gain experience in networking and server programming
Participate in functional and stress testing

Completed at least the second year of a Computer Science or Engineering degree
Proficiency with C++ and/or Java
An interest in game programming and curiosity for solving complex problems
A desire to learn, share, and grow with us
A passion for games!

It's a bonus if you have? 

Some experience with video games ? either making games in your spare time (for example, participating in game jams or hackathons) or experience working in a game studio
Some C++ or Java projects on your Github or website for us to see
Some web or server development experience, such as a previous work term in a server role

Job Summary:
The timing couldn't be better.
Picking the company to dedicate your valuable co-op term to is tough. You want to join a team that has proven its potential in the market but hasn't yet grown to the point that you're just another cog in the machine. You want to have an impact. That's why it's a perfect time to join Relogix.  The changing nature of work and employee engagement has caused companies to re-evaluate their use of space, and Activity Based Workplace design is transforming offices everywhere. And now, Fortune 500 customers are using our advanced IoT sensors and cloud-based software to monitor workspace utilization, workplace design effectiveness, and employee engagement. We're attracting a lot of attention, and it's time for growth.  
 
Relogix is looking for a Hardware and Logisitics Specialist who is passionate about providing exceptional customer service when implementing our industry-leading Internet of Things (IoT) solutions. As a key member of our Operations and Support team, you demonstrate the curiosity and willingness to develop new technology skills. You are self-motivated and understand that quality is in the details and you enjoy collaborating with peers and customers alike. 
 
In this position, you will help us to build and maintain our innovative product offering for the commercial real estate industry globally. We are looking for someone passionate and curious about technology and who has an interest in the Internet of Things (IoT).

This is a chance to see how a company runs from one end to another, to roll up your sleeves, and learn!
Job Responsibilities:
Responsibilities and Duties 

Assist with Hardware build, including out IoT gateways and sensor conversion (assemble, configure, and test).
Responsible for troubleshooting, configuration, administration and set up of the solution. 
Provide technical support of existing systems within Support Tool, on-going maintenance, testing, and resolution on customer's sites and remotely, including but not limited to monitoring hardware and troubleshooting issues relating to device outages (Gateways and Sensors).
Ensures all inquiries and problems are handled in a courteous and professional manner in line with Relogix Service Level Agreements (SLAs).
Assist in managing inventory, including placing orders for parts identified in Bill of Materials (BOM). Ensure maintenance of the physical inventory and database of all hardware, software, equipment, and parts. Assist with return process and refurbishing.  
Assist with preparation of hardware shipments (ensuring shipping readiness through compliance labelling, completed shipping documents, confirming latest firmware, scanning and leasing hardware to correct customer on the platform, packaging, etc.).
Assist with the creation of customer deployment plans and XY mapping.
Assist with creation and management of Knowledge Base (training documentation), including updating with new features, new discoveries, and process changes.
Required Skills:
Qualifications

Highly team orientated with the ability to work independently and in the field. 
Working or technical knowledge of electronics, electronic devices. 
Strong communication skills (written and oral) with a 'client first' mentality. 


Strong organizational skills and high attention to detail. 
Good problem solving and communication skills. 

Assets

Previous troubleshooting experience considered an asset. 
Hardware or technical building experience an asset.
Some knowledge of networking, wireless, RF devices an asset.
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Business Administration
				
			
				- Theme - Computing: Hardware
				
			
				- Theme - Computing: Information Systems 
				
			
				- Theme - Computing: Software
				
			
				- Theme - Information Science and Data Management 
				
			
				- Theme - Supply Chain Management and Logistics 
				
			
				ARTS - Business
				
			
				ENG - Mechanical and Mechatronics Engineering
Application Documents Required: Résumé,Grade Report

Job Summary:
UX/UI Design Intern (Remote 4 month term with the option to extend)

  

Our Purpose

  

At Remitbee, we value innovation and diversity to help our team, and the world thrive. In a culture that promotes ethical values, mentorship, flexibility, and inclusion, you will receive the tools and guidance to grow and achieve success. When you join the team, you'll be given opportunities that directly make an impact on the organization and receive direct mentorship through your whole journey at Remitbee. We take care of you so that you can take care of business.  

  

About Remitbee

  

Remitbee is one of Canada's leading and most reputable online international money transfer fintech companies. Remitbee's application can be accessed from mobile apps and web browsers to send money to more than 85 countries around the world. Our goal is to end the high costs of sending money overseas by simplifying the traditional process and to become the most entrusted financial services provider in the world. Remitbee is recognized in the GTA as one of the area's most admired fintech companies - https://bit.ly/2AfwMsC. 

  

We are seeking a creative Winter 2022 Co-op student that will be working as an UX/UI Design Intern to help guide Remitbee into the future. In this role, you will be involved in the entire UX/UI process by preparing and developing UI designs. You will also be a part of building our next generation app. If you are passionate about creative interface design, Remitbee is the perfect place for you to learn cutting edge technologies and to learn how to use them to develop products and services. 


This position will be a remote, full time position (40 hours/week) for 4 months with the option to extend. The compensation will be based on market and previous co-op students' experience ($19.50+). Last 1 month of the work term will be provided for personal projects of the student's interest.
Job Responsibilities:
Key Responsibilities:

Gathering and evaluating user requirements, in collaboration with product managers and engineers
Illustrating design ideas using storyboards, process flows and sitemaps
Designing graphic user interface elements, such as menus, tabs and widgets
Building page navigation buttons and search fields
Developing UI mockups and prototypes that clearly illustrate how sites function and look like
Creating original graphic designs (e.g. images, sketches and tables)
Preparing and presenting rough drafts to internal teams and key stakeholders
Identifying and troubleshooting UX problems (e.g. responsiveness)
Conducting layout adjustments based on user feedback
Adhering to style standards on fonts, colours and images
Required Skills:
Required Skills/Qualifications:

Current co-op students studying in the Communication, or Art and Technology program
Proven work experience as a UI/UX Designer or similar role
Portfolio of design projects
Knowledge of wireframe tools (e.g. Figma, Wireframe.cc and InVision)
Up-to-date knowledge of design software like Adobe Illustrator and Photoshop
Team spirit; strong communication skills to collaborate with various stakeholders
Excellent time-management skills
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Computing: Software
				
			
				- Theme - Digital and Graphic Media; Web Site Design and Development 
				
			
				ARTS - Global Business and Digital Arts
				
			
				ENG - Electrical and Computer Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Software Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Systems Design and Biomedical Engineering
				
			
				MATH - Computer Science
Application Documents Required: University of Waterloo Co-op Work History,Résumé,Grade Report

Render & Partners LLP is a professional accounting firm in Aurora, ON. Their full complement of Chartered Professional Accountants are dedicated to helping clients succeed by guiding them through modern day accounting challenges. Is a steady performer and an avid quick learner
Is meticulous and accurate and able to meet deadlines

Job Summary:
Replicant was founded on the belief that machines are ready to have useful, complex conversations that will transform the way they interact with the world, starting with customer service.

Replicant is building the world's first autonomous contact center that works out-of-the-box to solve customer problems over the phone using voice AI. You can think of Replicant Voice as a self-service, Thinking Machine. Just like agents, Replicant is able to speak with customers in a natural tone, answer questions without delay, and deflect calls to resolve customer issues quickly. Now, enterprise customers can eliminate hold times, manage unpredictable call volumes, and give agents time back to resolve high empathy cases with a new, human + AI operating model.

If you're excited by AI and human-to-machine communications and want to make an impact with great technologists and strong go-to-market leaders, then look no further. In the last year we've grown our team by 3x, increased revenue by 100x, and was named a top enterprise AI company by The Information. We currently serve Fortune 500 customers, run millions of AI calls per month in production, and are increasing our footprint globally.
Job Responsibilities:
We're a small team (~65 people) tackling a big industry with many eyes on it, using powerful technology. Our team comes from a diverse background of industry and the arts. Our core stack is primarily NodeJS for backend and React for front end both using Typescript. We also use Postgres and cloud buckets for storage and Kubernetes and Gitlab CI to manage deployments.

That's where you come in! We're looking for a generalist with an ability to dive into backend and frontend systems, solve problems, and innovate on our cutting-edge voice technologies.
Required Skills:
We're looking for students with the following experience/interest:

Excellent communication skills and a vivid imagination
Experience with NodeJS and Javascript
Typescript experience helpful
You are interested in building out the tools to support the next generation of Thinking Machine development

In order to support you we offer:

A remote-friendly culture: Communication is big. Everybody here works remotely, full and/or part time.
Interesting challenges: Not all of the problems we encounter have frameworks or well-defined solutions.
Ownership: We know that we don't know everything and will need you to help us find the best answers.
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Computing: Software
				
			
				ENG - Electrical and Computer Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Software Engineering
				
			
				MATH - Computer Science

Job Summary:
Replicant was founded on the belief that machines are ready to have useful, complex conversations that will transform the way they interact with the world, starting with customer service.

Replicant is building the world's first autonomous contact center that works out-of-the-box to solve customer problems over the phone using voice AI. You can think of Replicant Voice as a self-service, Thinking Machine. Just like agents, Replicant is able to speak with customers in a natural tone, answer questions without delay, and deflect calls to resolve customer issues quickly. Now, enterprise customers can eliminate hold times, manage unpredictable call volumes, and give agents time back to resolve high empathy cases with a new, human + AI operating model.

If you're excited by AI and human-to-machine communications and want to make an impact with great technologists and strong go-to-market leaders, then look no further. In the last year we've grown our team by 3x, increased revenue by 100x, and was named a top enterprise AI company by The Information. We currently serve Fortune 500 customers, run millions of AI calls per month in production, and are increasing our footprint globally.
Job Responsibilities:
We're a small team (~65 people) tackling a big industry with many eyes on it, using powerful technology. Our team comes from a diverse background of industry and the arts.
Our stack includes TypeScript, JavaScript, Python (3.x), Pytorch, and Haskell.

That's where you come in! We're looking for a generalist with an interest in Machine Learning (or even better some experience with it!), the ability to dive into the backend systems that run our models, solve problems, and innovate on our cutting-edge voice technologies.
Required Skills:
We're looking for students with the following experience/interest:

Excellent communication skills and a vivid imagination.
Experience and familiarity with Machine Learning, Deep Learning
Experience with Python or Typescript & any of: PyTorch, TensorFlow or other deep learning frameworks
You are interested in exploring the nuance and aesthetic of conversations.
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Computing: Software
				
			
				ENG - Software Engineering
				
			
				MATH - Applied Mathematics
				
			
				MATH - Combinatorics and Optimization
				
			
				MATH - Computer Science
Application Documents Required: University of Waterloo Co-op Work History,Résumé,Grade Report

Job Summary:
Restoration Design, based in Guelph Ontario, is a manufacturing facility producing high quality replacement panels for vintage Porsche automobiles. We have the largest in-stock sheet metal inventory in the world manufactured in-house. Recently we have expanded our operations to include a wiring department, and it is growing fast to keep up with market demand. 


A successful candidate will have an opportunity to design, build and manufacture wiring harnesses for vintage automobiles, namely Porsches and BMWs ranging from models produced in the 1950's to 1998. With an increase in demand for wiring harnesses in the automotive restoration sector, candidates will have an opportunity to create an impact on the industry and support the manufacturing of niche, in demand products.
Job Responsibilities:
Job responsibilities will take place under the supervision of the wiring department and candidates will be expected to follow company and industry standards when completing their work. 


Wiring Harness Design: Utilize Rapid Harness software to design wiring harnesses for classic cars, specifically Porsche and BMW brands. The designs will then be implemented at the production level.  


Wiring Harness Assembly: Candidates will be trained in wire harness assembly and involved in the assembly process. Within this task the following equipment and techniques will be used, and training will be provided:
 

crimping
wire cutting (semi-automated)
soldering
injection molding (e.g. overmolding plugs)

Quality control: examine and asses the quality of produced goods prior to releasing them for design approval and eventually for inventory. QC protocol can range from simple visual inspection to the use of a CAMI harness tester and software. 


Installation: Installation of pre-production harnesses into automobiles. 


CAD Design: Utilize SolidWorks software to design sheet metal components for wiring components and accessories. 


Project Management: Candidates will be assigned a specific project (TBD) within the wiring department which they will manage and showcase at the end of the work term. It is expected the project be finished within a set timeline and the resources provided be used appropriately.
Required Skills:
Candidates are required to have an intermediate level understanding of design software (e.g. Solidworks, Autodesk) and a good understanding of electrical principles.   


Hands on experience in the automotive sector is an asset and students with Formula SAE experience will be strongly considered. Candidates are expected to communicate with staff and operate in a collaborative environment to promote technical problem resolution. In addition, the application of technical knowledge (engineering principals) to improve designs and processes is strongly encouraged.
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Manufacturing and Process Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Electrical and Computer Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Mechanical and Mechatronics Engineering
Application Documents Required: University of Waterloo Co-op Work History,Résumé,Grade Report

Job Summary:
Retain is the world's first Customer Insights Engine (CIE) that enables everyone responsible for delighting customers to be customer-obsessed. Retain delivers a trusted, flexible system for identifying and sharing the best team habits that drive customer retention and revenue. By sitting naturally in a team's workflow, Retain enables everyone responsible for engaging customers to make data-driven decisions by giving them a complete view across the entire customer lifecycle. Retain powers enterprises like Google, Nielsen, and Salesforce. 


We are a team of talented, friendly people headquartered in San Francisco. Our leadership team is composed of experienced founders from LiveRamp ($15M funding to $5B NYSE: RAMP), and early employees from Uber (NYSE: UBER), PagerDuty (NYSE: PD), and Drawbridge (acquired by LinkedIn). 


As one of AngelList's "Hot Startups Hiring Now," the company is backed by Emergence Capital (Gordon Ritter is on the Board - an early investor in Zoom, Box, Veeva, and Salesforce), Baseline Ventures ( Steve Anderson is on the Board - (first investor in Instagram, SoFi, PagerDuty, Heroku, StitchFix, and many others), Upside Partnership, Afore Capital, and Industry Ventures. 


Are you looking for the most rewarding role you've ever had? This is it.
 

You will help build a great company.
You will experience exponential personal and professional growth.
You will work with a supportive team that values ownership, empathy, and humility.

About the Technology

React on the frontend.
Ruby/Rails on the backend.
Scala, Flink, AWS behind the scenes.
Pulumi for infrastructure management.

If you've worked with any of these before, that's great! If not, don't worry! Above all, we're looking for people who enjoy learning and diving into new technical problems.
Job Responsibilities:
Drive changes across all layers of the stack: cloud infrastructure, data pipelines, APIs, and user-facing widgets.
Contribute to strategic technical decisions.
Fear no failure, take calculated risks, and experiment with technology to create the most trusted and insightful time management tool for large enterprises.
Required Skills:
Great teammate and collaborator.
Openness to giving and receiving honest feedback.
Comfort with a high degree of uncertainty - there's a lot we don't know, and we need your help to figure it out!
Ability to be proactive and deliver results without a QA team or 10-page spec.
Experience building web applications.  
Experience with AWS and/or other cloud platforms.

Don't worry about checking off every box! Above all, our goal is to build a community of thoughtful team players who are enthusiastic about learning on the fly, sharing their expertise, and getting things done. If that resonates with you, we would love for you to apply.

										Co-op Financial Analyst (Business Performance & Analysis)
Job Summary:
Working for Revera is rewarding in every sense. Each day, Revera makes a difference to our people, offering them a great place to work, a development culture that helps them to be their best, and an environment that's focused on individual and collective performance. Our people's expertise and caring is built on a 50-year history of helping residents and clients to live their lives to the fullest. At Revera, we foster an environment where all members of our team can enrich us and realize their potential. Revera is focused on growth and opportunities. That's true whether supporting residents and clients to live life their way, or helping employees to thrive in meaningful careers. Our robust training and development programs enable staff at all levels to improve their skills and abilities and learn new ones. Those initiatives, combined with ongoing coaching and mentoring, give employees the basis to excel in their job and advance in the company. 


Mission: 


The Co-Op Financial Analyst (Business Performance & Analysis) supports centralized financial and business reporting, creation and analysis of operational performance management tools, financial consolidation, proactive guidance and insight to improve financial performance and mitigate risk 

This role supports the Revera's Managed Retirement Division 


Key Outcomes:
 

Performance management tools that enable improved financial and business performance and/or reduced risk
Management reporting, variance analysis and counsel on go-forward opportunities to capitalize on
Value-added insight to identify blind spots and/or improved prioritization of resourcing
Event-driven and ad-hoc analysis to identify and rationalize trends
Improved business casing and allocation of operational resources
Consolidating processes centrally, enabling capacity to be created for BP&A manager

Job Summary:
RFA Labs is an early-stage team that moves fast and is building core solutions for our banking and mortgage finance platforms. We're an embedded startup inside RFA, a Canadian financial services company that includes RFA Bank of Canada, a Schedule I Canadian bank (https://www.rfa.ca). 


About the Opportunity

This is a chance to work in Fintech with a small, passionate group of developers and business people where you can contribute to products people will immediately use. If you like solving for real problems with immediate impact--and seeing a user light up when they use software you helped build--this is a great opportunity for you. 


Our stack is modern in implementation (microservices architecture, distributed systems, and event-based architecture; React micro-frontend) with a lot of engineering leeway for innovation, and we're pretty obsessed with user experience. You should be, too.  


At RFA you will work with talented devs on engineering problems (though there's a lot of that), but also experience the whole development cycle. We start with user interviews and need-finding (design thinking, event storming), explore innovative ideas, ask questions, and move as a team to rapidly build and iterate with consistent feedback. 


Your experience working at RFA will include:

A super supportive dev culture: As long as you're willing to work hard and learn, you will have the tools, feedback, and resources you need to succeed.
A humble, non-hierarchical environment: Our culture is one of humility and hard work: we care more about building great things than anybody's ego. Best idea always wins--including yours!
Exposure to the whole development cycle, from user interviews to production release

About RFA

RFA is a rapidly growing financial services company based in Toronto, Canada. RFA Labs is our internal technology subsidiary supporting the group of RFA companies. 


Since launching its residential lending platform in 2018, the company has grown significant market share in the Canadian broker channel and acquired a Schedule I Canadian Bank, now RFA Bank of Canada.  


RFA Labs has a strong culture of innovation and tackling challenging problems with a first-principles approach.  

We are always interrogating whether how things "have always been done" is actually they way they should be done, and are relentless in our search for efficiency through technology.
Job Responsibilities:
To succeed in this position, you will need to be a self-starter who can learn quickly, contribute questions, be proactive in your work, and take ownership. As part of a small team, you will have less management oversight than other opportunities, so you should be comfortable with that. If you are, you'll be in a position contribute at the highest levels of the organization. 


You will report to a Senior Engineer (who is also a Waterloo grad!) and your responsibilities will include
 

joining stand-up meetings
attending engineering planning sessions
working with our product team to clarify and refine requirements
writing and committing code
participating in code reviews
Required Skills:
We will prioritize candidates with the following, in order of "required" to "nice-to-have":
 

Experience with a modern front end framework like React, Angular, Vue, etc. (Preferred experience: React with TypeScript)
Experience with REST APIs
Familiarity with git
Experience with C# / .NET Core
Understanding of event-driven / microservices architectural patterns
Knowledge of atomic design principles
Experience with websockets
Experience with core modern CSS design principals and frameworks (such as Bootstrap and Material UI). Bonus: understand of utility-first frameworks such as Tailwind or Chakra.
Experience working with Storybook JS

Job Summary:
Rich Media, an interactive agency in Toronto, is recruiting for the following position: Web and Mobile Developer 


Company Description: 

Rich Media is a Toronto based digital agency producing many of North America's leading interactive projects. Our services include web sites, print, mobile sites and apps, animation, games and video. Some of our clients include Samsung Electronics, TD Bank, RBC Financial, Manulife Financial, Scotiabank, Great-West Life and Sun Life Financial. Rich Media has garnered a reputation for taking leading edge technology, combining it with strong creative talents and developing multimedia firsts. Rich Media has twice been a Top 5 Finalist for Employer of the Year at the Canadian New Media Awards, and Rich Media has been placed on the Top 100 Multimedia Producers list by a major industry publication. Jake Rich, President of Rich Media, has also been nominated three times for Entrepreneur of the Year. 


Position Description: 

Rich Media is looking for an exceptional programmer with a passion for solving problems in a creative way. You thrive working online and can't wait to get your hands on the next mobile device where you can apply your skills. You're outgoing, you love to share ideas and be around creative people.
Job Responsibilities:
The main responsibilities are as follows: 

- Assist or take a lead role in the management and development of interactive projects for some of Canada's largest companies 

- Create processes and business requirements documentation 

- Assist or take a lead role in beta testing for own or others' projects 

- Participate fully as a team member in planning and implementation of projects 

- Attend client meetings where required
Required Skills:
Desired skills:

- Experience in the following: Object Oriented Programming, Mobile Development, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, jQuery, Bootstrap, Angular and React. 

- Knowledge of, PhoneGap, SharePoint, ASPX. C#, .NET, SQL and other web programming languages such as PHP, JSP and PERL would be an asset. 

- Ability to take initiative and contribute to a team environment 

- Energetic, motivated, positive attitude 

- Strong verbal and written communication skills 

- Ability to have fun with our pool table, pin ball machine, air hockey table, regular celebration lunches and the toys in our meeting rooms

Job Summary:
Ricoh Canada Inc. has always been on the forefront of workplace innovation. 


Yesterday, that meant creating the first office fax machine, enabling people to work smarter, better and faster than ever before. Today, that means information mobility, which is the ability to capture, manage, access and use the information you need -- wherever and whenever you need it -- driving the results you want. 


As for tomorrow, that vision is already taking shape in our heads and labs, too. And when the workplace begins its next major change, our imagination will help drive it.
Job Responsibilities:
Ricoh's Global Solutions Engineering (GSE) group has an opening for a Co-op Software Developer. GSE is part of the Software Development Center Americas (SDC-A), which works with Global teams developing software products used by our customers, ranging from small businesses to global enterprises. The solutions typically are based on scalable cloud or server architectures, and primarily implemented in Java, with other technologies used when appropriate. 


Joining our team, you will gain exposure to a variety of development technologies and be able to work together with developers on the global teams. We have a quiet, productive work environment, with the opportunity to collaborate with other bright software developers, enabling you to grow your skills. We encourage our team members to go beyond their job descriptions and help each other to both exceed our project goals and to grow their technical expertise. Team events and lunch-and-learn sessions help you connect with and learn from other team members. 


Examples of Our People-based Programs Include

From meeting your financial goals to time off, we promote the well-being of our employees and show them they're valued.
 

Wellness
Flexible Work Options
Time-Off
Development
Rewarding your Efforts

Education

Currently in a university degree or college diploma, preferably in Computer Science or an equivalent field. 


Skills And Experience

Must currently be a student seeking co-op.
 

Strong object-oriented programming skills.
Some software development experience including, Java/C# development.
Know some Core Java, Java OEM, Android and/or iOS technologies.
Preferably have some knowledge in using Java development tools such as Eclipse, Ant, Maven, SVN and Apache Tomcat.

Job Summary:
COOP - Geology
 

 

Rio Tinto is the winner of The University of Waterloo 2021 Award for Next Generation Employment Innovation
Rio Tinto was named Canada's Top 100 Employer and one of Canada's Top Employers for Young People for 3 consecutive years
Get real work experience at one of the largest mining and metal companies in the world, focused on safety and inclusion
Work with the newest technology and innovation, in an environment where we challenge you to drive positive change
Winter internship opportunity

What's on offer 
 

 

A work environment where safety is always the number one priority
A competitive salary
An ambitious, exciting and rewarding experience
Opportunity to build relationships with the Rio Tinto team and community
A great chance to prepare yourself to join our Graduate Development Program
A relocation allowance and a premium are offered for students outside the region

Where you'll be working? 

We are a leading North American producer and exporter of premium iron ore pellets and high-grade concentrate with average iron grades greater than 66%. With a team of over 2,400 employees, IOC is committed to providing value and continuity for our customers, employees, communities and shareholders through our unique mine to port approach, taking advantage of our full integration and wholly owned infrastructure to deliver our high-quality concentrate and pellets to our customers across the globe. 

  

IOC's operations include a mine with five operational pits, a concentrator and a pelletizing plant located near Labrador City in the province of Newfoundland and Labrador. We also operate a wholly-owned 418 km railway, the Quebec North Shore and Labrador Railway (QNS&L), that links our Labrador operations to Company-owned port facilities in Sept-Iles. This internship is based in Labrador City.
 
Every Voice Matters
At Rio Tinto, we particularly welcome and encourage applications from Indigenous Peoples, women, the LGBTQIA2 community, mature workers, people with disabilities and people from different cultural backgrounds. 

We are committed to an inclusive environment where people feel comfortable to be themselves. We want our people to feel that all voices are heard, all cultures respected and that a variety of perspectives are not only welcome - they are essential to our success. We treat each other fairly and with dignity regardless of race, gender, nationality, ethnic origin, religion, age, sexual orientation or anything else that makes us different. 

We are seeking to increase the diversity across our operations in order to improve equal opportunity outcomes for our employees and encourage female applicants to apply. 

Applications close on Friday October 8th (Rio Tinto reserves the right to remove advertised roles prior to this date). Applications received will be assessed over the following weeks. 

Please note, in order to be considered for this role you must answer all pre-screening questions. 

  

All progress begins with pioneers - at Rio Tinto, it begins with you.

  

#HRAwardsCA
Job Responsibilities:
About the role
We are offering a 4-month Geology internship. This opportunity will be based based in Labrador City, Newfoundland and Labrador at our Iron Ore Company of Canada (IOC) operations. 

  

This internship will allow you to have direct exposure to mine engineering work on an active mine site. You will support different activities relating to IOC's Geologist. 

  

In this role, you will be responsible for:
·Assist with geological and geotechnical core logging and sampling to collect pertinent data and ensure timely processing of samples.
·Conduct field work related to the diamond drill program, such as: hole surveying, reconnaissance and downhole installations.
·Work to high standards for quality assurance, quality control and data validation of for all geological data.
Required Skills:
What you'll bring

At least one year completed* of Geology, Earth Sciences or Geological Engineering
Safety mindset
Leadership skills, eagerness to learn and ready for the challenge ahead
Flexibility and autonomy
Good communication skills and ability to work in a team
Valid driving license

  

* To be eligible for this internship, you must be returning to school after the work term and have the right to work in Canada.
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				ENG - Civil, Environmental and Geological Engineering
Application Documents Required: University of Waterloo Co-op Work History,Cover Letter,Résumé,Grade Report

Job Summary:
Ripple Therapeutics, located at the acclaimed MaRS Innovation Centre in downtown Toronto (near the University of Toronto) is a clinical stage, ophthalmology-focused developer of novel therapeutics. Our technology platform was founded on a discovery that drugs (e.g. dexamethasone) can be engineered into controlled release pharmaceuticals without the use of polymers or excipients. The proprietary prodrugs have unique properties that allow them to be processed into standalone drug delivery implants or as coatings on medical devices. 

Ripple boasts state of the art laboratory facilities and currently employs 20 people with 16 team members dedicated to R&D activities with expertise in biochemistry, pharmacology, engineering, chemistry, and process manufacturing. Ripple has several ongoing R&D projects developing novel prodrug materials. We are seeking a highly motivated student that can successfully contribute to the research and product development projects at Ripple. The student will have an opportunity to utilize their existing scientific skills and gain new ones as an integral part of Ripple's R&D team. 


Please note, this role will require laboratory work on site at our downtown Toronto location. We have made safety our highest priority when it comes to laboratory practices, and we have added additional protocols and PPE practices to ensure the safety of all staff during the COVID-19 pandemic. Students will be given specific training for all relevant laboratory and facility protocols. 

  

Ripple is dedicated to fostering continuous professional development for all staff and employees. During their work term, Co-op students are encouraged to participate in professional development activities taking place at Ripple.
Job Responsibilities:
The Chemist/Chemical Engineering Co-op student will apply his/her scientific skill set to support the development of novel biomaterial compounds. S/he will work closely with R&D team members, under direct supervision, to advance project objectives and milestones. 


The main responsibilities of the position are listed below, but may be expanded upon based on the experience level of the candidate.
 

Assist senior scientists/engineers in the design and execution of experiments
Perform experimental setup and reaction monitoring for chemical reactions, isolations and purifications of novel materials
Prepare samples for analysis to be tested on equipment such as liquid chromatography (HPLC, GPC), Calorimetry (DSC), NMR, microscopy (Optical, SEM) etc.
Evaluate processing techniques with different formulations for prototyping of drug release implants
Perform testing and analysis of materials and prototypes, using materials and chemical analytical techniques and other tools (e.g. drug release studies)
Assist in the development of test methods and standard operating procedures for new analytical techniques and equipment
Analyze experimental data and communicate results to appropriate team members in a clear and concise manner
Accurately document all tests/test materials/equipment used and all results obtained
Performs all work in a safe manner and maintains a clean and organized work environment
Work in accordance with approved methods, standard operating procedures (SOPs)
Other duties as assigned
Required Skills:
University student in Chemistry, Chemical Engineering or in a related program
Experience working in a chemical research laboratory is preferred
Experience performing organic reactions and purifications is exceptional
Good understanding of basic chemical characterization techniques (NMR, HPLC, MS, IR) and material characterization techniques (microscopy, DSC)
Strong interpersonal and communication skills (both oral and written)
Must be a detail oriented individual with excellent organizational skills
Self-motivated individual with the ability to meet deadlines and prioritize
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Scientific Experimental Design and Laboratory Assistance
				
			
				ENG - Chemical Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Nanotechnology Engineering
				
			
				SCI - Chemical Sciences

Job Summary:
About the Company:  


At Riskfuel, we have pioneered the use of Deep Neural Networks (DNNs) to speed up mathematical models used in quantitative finance.   


We generate massive amounts of synthetic training data using an existing (but slow) model then train neural networks on these vast collections of synthetic data. In order to produce models in a timely manner, we leverage thousands of cores of compute and dozens of GPUs spanning across both bare metal and cloud Kubernetes clusters.
Job Responsibilities:
About the Job:


You will work with and support our machine learning engineers, developing and maintaining core internal services which power our business. The work is varied, interesting and fast paced, ranging from CI/CD pipelines, distributed storage systems, Kubernetes cluster administration, the occasional web development project, and more.   


You'll be mentored by a fun, kind, and talented team and will be given enough responsibility to take a project and run with it.  In other words, you will learn a lot here!   


See more at our website Riskfuel.com
Required Skills:
Must haves: 

 

Proficient using Python and its popular libraries to manipulate data 
Experience with containers and container orchestration tools 
Comfortable with Linux/Unix 
Experience with CI/CD tooling such as GitHub Actions, CircleCI, or Jenkins 


Nice to haves: 

Deep familiarity with Kubernetes and its inner workings 
C++ or Golang skills 
An interest in web development (we use React + THREE.js) 
Experience using automation tools like Puppet or Ansible
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Computing: Software
				
			
				ENG - Software Engineering
				
			
				MATH - Computer Science

Job Summary:
About the Company:


Riskfuel is hiring an AI Researcher to join our research team.   


At Riskfuel, we have pioneered the use of Deep Neural Networks (DNNs) to accelerate mathematical models used by banks to price complicated portfolios. We generate massive amounts of training data and then we use that training data to train a neural network. We do a lot of research around minimizing the amount of training data needed and optimizing the training process.

Job Summary:
This is an exciting opportunity for an aspiring Hardware Designer to be part of a motivated and exceptional team developing next generation networking products.  As a member of Rockport's Hardware team, you will contribute to the design of high speed, high performance, high-capacity optical networking products destined for large compute cluster environments. 

  

If you are passionate about technology and interested in working with critical parts of a deep architecture that starts with a distributed web application and ends with a specialized hardware solution, Rockport offers a great opportunity to contribute to the development of innovative software solutions using the latest technologies in a fast-paced and growing environment. 

  

**We are targeting candidates in their 3rd / 4th year**
Job Responsibilities:
Lab debugging and validation of PCB designs and interfaces against commercial requirements
Support the schematic capture and design of High-Speed Digital/FPGA/Power Circuits
Support the layout and mechanical implementation of the PCB designs
Developing Python scripts to support lab debugging and validation
Contribute to the continual improvement and enhancement of our development methodologies
Required Skills:
Knowledge of high-speed signal integrity, transmission line theory, Ethernet, highspeed DDR, high-speed SerDes, PCIe Interfaces, etc.
Knowledge of in-system debugging using standard lab tools
Knowledge of Board level simulation and circuit simulation methodology

BONUS SKILLS 

Knowledge of Cadence Capture CIS and Allegro
Knowledge of version control systems like Git, Mercurial or SVN
Knowledge of wired networking technologies including Ethernet and PCIe
Knowledge of Python or similar scripting languages
