Job Summary:
The company:
Founded in 1996, Rocscience is a world leader in developing 2D and 3D software for civil, mining, and geotechnical engineers. For over 25 years, we've built on leading-edge research to create the best geotechnical software available. As engineers ourselves, we know the importance of having reliable and easy-to-use software. That's why we constantly develop and refine our programs to make expert solutions that work for our customers. To explore more, visit https://www.rocscience.com/.

Job Position:
Rocscience is seeking talented undergraduate students who are willing to work with our Software Development Team for Winter 2022.

Location:
The Rocscience office is centrally located in downtown Toronto and is easily accessible by TTC (Osgoode Station) and is a short walk from the University of Toronto. We recently expanded our existing office space to include the famous half-house in Toronto - 54 ½ St. Patrick Street.
Job Responsibilities:
Scope of the Position and Responsibilities:
Rocscience is working on new generation 2D and 3D modelling and analysis software. We are looking for software developers for these two main categories: 1. To design and implement features that will facilitate a pleasant user experience. 2. Having experience with software testing and mainly be working on improving QA testing system integration. We are constantly innovating and upgrading our programs to make them easier for our users to create, manipulate, and manage complex engineering models and geometry. Alongside the development, we need to have an efficient testing system that keeps improving the integration of our QA system into the development cycle and leads to a bug-free release. As a member of our team, you will have the opportunity to explore different testing methods, design clean user interfaces and define intuitive user interactions that make complex tasks simple to use. To explore our range of products, explore: https://www.rocscience.com/software

If you like to work on

Geometrics algorithms
Performance and memory management
2D/3D modeling
Designing software cycle support systems
Automating and executing tests and analyzing the results

and comfortable with


Software engineering principles
Verifying and validating your code
C/C++/Python
Azure DevOps
Desktop App automation tools such as TestComplete

We would love to have you join us. We're working on new products and looking for new ideas and you will be a key part of the solution.

Projects:
Successful candidates will receive an interview in which potential projects can be tailored to their interests. Possible projects include:

Working with 3D Geometry Construction Tools
Developing/Maintaining unit tests
Systematic software testing
Required Skills:
Applications should be comfortable with:

Software engineering principles
Verifying and validating your code
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Computing: Quality Assurance 
				
			
				- Theme - Computing: Software
				
			
				- Theme - Quality Assurance and Control 
				
			
				ENG - Civil, Environmental and Geological Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Electrical and Computer Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Software Engineering
				
			
				MATH - Computer Science
Application Documents Required: University of Waterloo Co-op Work History,Résumé,Grade Report

Job Summary:
Rocscience is seeking talented undergraduate students based in Toronto, Canada, who are willing to work with our Engineering Development Team for Winter 2022 (January - April).

The company:

Founded in 1996, Rocscience is a world leader in developing 2D and 3D software for civil, mining, and geotechnical engineers. For over 25 years, we've built on leading-edge research to create the best geotechnical software available. As engineers ourselves, we know the importance of having reliable and easy-to-use software. That's why we constantly develop and refine our programs to make expert solutions that work for our customers. To explore more, visit https://www.rocscience.com/.Rocscience is seeking talented undergraduate students based in Toronto, Canada, who are willing to work with our Engineering Development Team for Winter 2022 (January - April).

Location:

The Rocscience office is centrally located in downtown Toronto and is easily accessible by TTC (Osgoode Station) and is a short walk from the University of Toronto. We recently expanded our existing office space to include the famous half-house in Toronto - 54 ½ St. Patrick Street.
Job Responsibilities:
We are working on developing state-of-the-art geotechnical software for slope stability, retaining walls, foundation and pile analyses. Students would be involved in research and development.

In addition, several concurrent three-dimensional Rocscience programs (Slide3 and RS3) can analyze complicated geotechnical problems. Interns will be involved in creating 3D models that focus on validation and creating scientific publications.
Required Skills: The successful candidate must be enrolled in engineering or a related discipline and must have completed the second year in University. Although the qualified candidate will work under the supervision of an experienced engineer, he/she must also be able to work independently and must exhibit creativity and initiative in problem-solving.
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Natural Resource Management 
				
			
				ENG - Civil, Environmental and Geological Engineering
				
			
				SCI - Earth, Environmental and Geological Sciences

Job Summary:
Rocscience is seeking talented undergraduate students based in Canada, who are willing to work with our Software Development Team for Winter 2022 (January - April).

Location:
The Rocscience office is centrally located in downtown Toronto and is easily accessible by TTC (Osgoode Station) and is a short walk from the University of Toronto. We recently expanded our existing office space to include the famous half-house in Toronto - 54 ½ St. Patrick Street.
Job Responsibilities:
Scope of the Position and Responsibilities:

Rocscience is working on new generation 2D and 3D modelling and analysis software for the Geotechnical Engineering industry. We are looking for software developers to design and implement features that will facilitate a pleasant user experience. We are constantly innovating and upgrading our programs to make them easier for our users to create, manipulate, and manage complex engineering models and geometry. To explore our range of products, explore: https://www.rocscience.com/software

Geometry processing and meshing algorithms
Performance and memory management
Machine learning
2D/3D UI/UX design for desktop applications

we would love to have you join us. We're working on new products and looking for new ideas and you will be a key part of the solution.

High-Performance Computing on Geomechanical Analyses
	
Schedule and manage computing clusters

Machine Learning for Geometry Manipulation
	
Identify the regions of interest in a 3D model
Repair or modify problematic input geometries


3D Geometry Construction Tools
3D Visualization
3D Feature Extraction
Experience with graphics and a strong mathematics background will be considered assets.

C# and .Net (WPF is an asset)
C/C++ (Experience with MFC is an asset)
Linear algebra
Software engineering principles

Job Summary:
At Rogers, we connect Canadians to a world of possibilities and the memorable moments that matter most in their lives. Every day we wake up with one purpose in mind. To bring loved ones together from across the globe. To connect people to each other and the world around them. To help an entrepreneur realize their dream. A sports fan celebrate a special moment. 


Because we believe connections unite us, possibilities fuel us, and moments define us. 

  

As we grow our team, the well-being of our team members remains our top priority. To ensure the health and safety of our team members, including those in the recruitment process, our team members are working from home, and are equipped to do so safely and efficiently.  

  

Start your career with a strong foundation and spend your Co-op work term with us! Our Co-op Program gives students the opportunity to be involved in meaningful projects, contribute real work, rewarding opportunities and learn from a diverse group of leaders. We are building for tomorrow and as we plan for the future to make more possible for all Canadians, we believe it starts with Students & New Grads from coast-to-coast-to-coast.  

At Rogers, your journey is filled with limitless possibilities - let's make your dream co-op placement possible. 

  

About the Team:  

Channel Management is a new team here at Rogers, which lands within our Connected Home organization. Reporting to the Sr. Director of Sales Channel Performance and Strategy, the role will be accountable to help support the team in building the optimal annualized channel strategy and bottoms-up quarterly plans for Connected Home, ensuring alignment between sales, marketing, product, and finance.  Working cross functionally to help support and achieve the quarterly plan and meet channel targets will be a key measure of success.   

The successful candidate will work well cross-functionally and help act as a bridge builder between their respective CH channels to ultimately drive accelerated revenue growth while helping support a unified approach across all our channels, removing roadblocks to create a better customer experience and ensure channel expectations are met.
Job Responsibilities:
What you will do…
 

Support and enable sales performance for Connected Home within channels they support to ensure consistency, support, focus and a one RCI approach across all channels for the Connected Home customer
Work cross functionally across the organization with the many stakeholders to align and consolidate channel support and clear obstacles standing in the way of driving sales and exceptional customer experience
Look to find and support innovative ways for cross channel selling and support models to ensure best in class customer outcomes while increasing overall sales and revenue within the channels
Work to support the Channel Management team to ensure focus on sales enablement, incentives, and other opportunities to increase focus and productivity for CH are top of mind for the channels ensuring the customer is at the centre of everything we put into channel
Act as the voice for their respective channels to ensure they are supported with the sales tools and materials for sales success they need and work closely with channel leaders to find new opportunities to drive additional sales and revenue through better tools and support models for better customer outcomes
Required Skills:
What you will bring… 
 

Enrolled in an accredited co-op program working towards a degree in Marketing or equivalent 
Passionate about Sales and Marketing
A mindset of creativity, innovation and energetic drive to succeed 
Proven track record of building data driven strategies and business plans with a focus on executing effectively to achieve expected performance results in a business environment 
Collaborates well with others 
Sales-minded and driven to find opportunity through analytics and analysis 
Understands basic project management and able to tie to what the front lines see, building a simple but effective narrative and get-well plan.
Strong ability to explain and simplify strategy and approach to gain buy in from stakeholders
Always demonstrates Rogers values and leads by example

About the Business Unit:  

We are the Consumer Major Accounts department here at Rogers Communications and we are responsible for signing agreements with builders, developers and property management companies to ensure our networks are established on the premise and our sales channels are best equipped to promote and sell Rogers products and services to their clients at the highest degree.   

  

Our team, Contracts Administration and Sales Operations, provide a wide variety of support to the CMA Sales Teams, including Contract Processing, internal and external Sales Support, Analytics, Project and Process Management.  We are looking for individuals who would be interested in participating in any of these fields.  In CMA we promote and foster an inclusive, engaging and energetic environment with a wide array of development and career growth opportunities.
Job Responsibilities:
What you will do…
 

Provide support services for CMA Sales management and Account Executives based on business-driven deliverables (i.e. uploading forms and documents, submitting application requests, etc.)
Complete research, audit and analyzing of data, and prepare penetration and ad-hoc reports for management and Account Executives in support of contract negotiations.
Assisting with the adherence to contract terms and maintain accuracy of account and data in our billing system
Assist with formatting and data entry into our contract management system
Account conversion support (i.e., Assist in auditing bulk offers, updating contract types for upcoming conversion activity, updating address notepads with new bulk offers prior to months' end, etc.)
Coordinating special requests, installations and change of service orders for Multi-Dwelling Unit (MDU) clients, their offices and/or multiple buildings of a portfolio.
Required Skills:
What you will bring… 
 

Enrolled in an accredited co-op program working towards a degree in Business Management, Commerce, Law, Marketing or equivalent 
Intermediate to advanced technical competence with MS Office Applications (ie. Excel, Access, Outlook, Word and PowerPoint)
Strong organizational and time-management skills, with a high level of attention to detail
Passionate about working in the telecommunications industry, delivering the highest level of customer service and collaborating with others
Is a people person and likes to always have fun in everything they do 
A mindset of creativity, innovation and energetic drive to succeed
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters

				- Theme - Sales and Business Development 
				
			
				ARTS - Business

				MATH - Statistics and Actuarial Science

Job Summary:
Start your career with a strong foundation and spend your term with us! We're looking for motivated students who want to make an impact. Your co-op experience at Rogers will prepare you for the real world, and will empower you to take on challenging work after you graduate. Throughout your term, you'll gain first-hand exposure to what life is like at our organization. You'll work alongside industry professionals who will support your overall growth, and you'll be responsible for business-impacting work that will help you transition into the various new grad opportunities we offer post-graduation. We want you to explore our organization so you can find your fit within it. 

  

As part of the Carrier Cost department you will be responsible for assisting in the completion of a number of process improvement projects that will enhance the team's expense validation processes.  This role requires an individual to pay careful attention to detail, be organized and result driven. We are looking for a fun and enthusiastic person with the propensity to analyze large data sets, while identifying opportunities for efficiencies. Working as part of this team will give you a better understanding of the Telecommunications industry and a view into what happens behind the scenes.
Job Responsibilities:
Detailed responsibilities include:  

•    Complete an audit of billing information, execute on outlined steps to resolve discrepancies. 

•    Review contracts & tariffs to capture critical terms and validate pricing components 

•    Assist in audit of Inventory information and establishing set criteria for fields and data cleanup. 

•    Coordinate information from multiple sources (including other team members, clients, and vendors) to ensure the telecom expense management systems contain up-to-date and accurate information at all times 

•    Contribute to cost reduction initiatives through analysis and data correlation  

•    Identify process gaps and implement efficiencies and automation 

•    Perform daily tasks related invoice payment overview and resolve any issues that arise
Required Skills:
What you'll bring: 

•    Business, Computer Science, Engineering degrees 

•    Proficient in Excel, particularly pivot tables, functions, lookups and macros 

•    Strong working knowledge of PowerPoint 

•    Solid Ability to read and understand contracts and tariffs 

•    Strong communication and presentation stills 

•    Extremely organized and detail oriented.
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Business Administration
				
			
				- Theme - Data Analytics, Statistical Analysis and Mathematical Optimization 
				
			
				- Theme - Information Science and Data Management 
				
			
				- Theme - Sales and Business Development 
				
			
				ARTS - Business
				
			
				ARTS - Economics
				
			
				ARTS - Global Business and Digital Arts
				
			
				MATH - Business
				
			
				SCI - Business

Job Summary:
RM (Client relationship Management) support Administrator 

Our Quebec Business Sales Team, is seeking a CRM support administrator who will be responsible for making changes to Saleforce.com CRM tool. As the Sales teams will be migrating to a newer version of Salesforce.com, a full audit of current data regarding existing clients and prospects needs to be done.
Job Responsibilities:
This is an important role and interested applicants should be motivated by the challenge of learning a new strategic skill with the dominant CRM tool on the market. 

As well, you will acquire intimate knowledge of Quebec based businesses, develop new relationships with our Strategic Account Executives, and help them input accurate data in the new CRM tool. 

 What you'll do: 

•    Review each Strategic Account Executive`s client & prospect account base. 

•    Move/add/change account hierarchy, contacts & other important data points within the CRM tool. 

•    Research other data points should the existing data be called into question, by communicating directly with the client/prospect. 

•    Help create the consistent and thorough documentation of account and call activity with SalesForce.com and other tracking applications.
Required Skills:
What you'll bring: 

•Post-secondary education in business or related discipline a strong asset or equivalent work experience in a fast paced, dynamic business environment. 

•Experience preferably in a business-to-business role within the communications, technology services. 

•Strong technical aptitude (keyboarding, MS Office, capacity to learn new systems) with a passion for new technology 

•Knowledge of the Rogers suite of products and services and/or telecommunications is an asset 

•Self-directed with strong organizational and time management skills, attentive to detail 

•Investigative, demonstrates excellent judgment, driven to succeed and adept at listening, understanding and identifying possible solutions. 

•Superior communication skills (oral and written)

Job Summary:
Start your career with a strong foundation and spend your term with us! We're looking for motivated students who want to make an impact. Your co-op experience at Rogers will prepare you for the real world, and will empower you to take on challenging work after you graduate. Throughout your term, you'll gain first-hand exposure to what life is like at our organization. You'll work alongside industry professionals who will support your overall growth, and you'll be responsible for business-impacting work that will help you transition into the various new grad opportunities we offer post-graduation. We want you to explore our organization so you can find your fit within it. 

In the Rogers for Business, Advanced Services team we are committed to creating and growing teams that are focussed on where technology is going, and how we can harness technology advancements to help Canadian businesses do more. The Advanced Services portfolio encompasses both IoT & Data Center products and services, allowing us to bring to our customers the newest, most innovative and best end to end solutions. 

  

Not only is our business strong, but so is our culture. We genuinely care about each other and working in an environment that allows each of us to bring our best authentic selves to work. That starts with our firm commitment to a diverse, inclusive and safe workplace. 

Are you a student with great ideas that can change the world?  At Rogers our collaborative environment and commitment to setting innovative standards with our IoT solutions, we are inspiring the next generation of technology leaders to be creative visionaries and innovators for the IoT Smart Cities portfolio. Are you up for the challenge and the fun??  If so, consider the following opportunity!
Job Responsibilities:
What you will do: 

•    Enhance our Portfolio Strategy 

•    Develop an understanding and clearly articulate IoT technology, industry and customer trends within the portfolio 

•    Work with the IoT team to develop and execute comprehensive & innovative short and long term strategies and plans for the portfolio 

•    Build cross functional relationships as a key trusted partner for sales, operations and marketing. Engage and communicate our strategic vision to key stakeholders 

•    Build effective Partner Management methodologies & relationships 

•    Leverage great relationships with our partners to deliver exceptional solution experiences 

Product Management 

•    Manage the IoT solutions product(s) lifecycle with the team; understand the inflection points that will drive growth and profitability while balancing out technological evolution 

•    Support marketing activities and programs to drive awareness within the IoT portfolio
Required Skills:
What you will bring: 

•    A positive attitude 

•    Pursuit of Bachelors Degree from an accredited University/College: Technology, Business, Engineering, Marketing 

•    Intellectual curiosity and a drive to always be improving - if you are ALWAYS looking to do things differently or improve on what you deliver - We want you! 

•    Ability to translate customer needs to business requirements, clarity and ease 

•    A strong researcher and analytical skills.  You are able to see the "big picture" and understand where and when improvements would be required. 

•    A passion for innovation and technology and future trends in IoT solutions!

About the Business Unit:  

Consumer IT is at the centre of technology transformation at Rogers. Driving modern software engineering through cloud native development our teams are engaged in the latest technologies as they deliver new solutions for Rogers. We're looking for someone who loves technology, is curious and confident, and can bring a business lens to the technology problems we are trying to solve.  It's a fast paced environment and you'll contribute to our technology strategy, analysis and business case development.
Job Responsibilities:
What you will do:
 

Create financial analysis and models, business cases, define new IT capabilities and associated investments for Rogers. 
Conduct research into new technology areas. Technical topics of study may include topics such as: Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Cloud Native Development, Customer 360, Order Management, etc.  
Create strategy documents which include defining a problem statement, completing quantitative and qualitative analysis, and making recommendations. 
Work with different teams across the organization including enterprise architecture, engineering, and finance and present your research and work.
Required Skills:
What you will bring
 

Enrolled in an accredited co-op program working towards a degree Applied Science (Electrical Engineering, Computer Science), Business Technology Management, or equivalent
Familiarity with telecommunication industry and operations is highly desirable
Proven analytical, financial modeling and problem-solving skills
Strong time management capabilities, with the ability to perform multiple tasks and objectives
Strong sense of initiative and a self-starter who can work equally well in groups or on their own
Results oriented, flexible and willing to work in a multi-task and dynamic work environment
Comfortable In assembling multiple points of view and finding a common ground
Advanced skills in Excel and PowerPoint
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Computing: Information Systems 
				
			
				- Theme - Data Analytics, Statistical Analysis and Mathematical Optimization 
				
			
				- Theme - Project and Process Management
				
			
				ENG - Electrical and Computer Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Management Sciences
				
			
				ENG - Mechanical and Mechatronics Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Nanotechnology Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Software Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Systems Design and Biomedical Engineering
				
			
				MATH - Business
				
			
				MATH - Computer Science
				
			
				MATH - Computing and Financial Management

About the BU: 

  

Consumer IT is at the centre of technology transformation at Rogers.  Driving modern software engineering through cloud native development our teams are engaged in the latest technologies as they deliver new solutions for Rogers. We're looking for someone who loves technology, is curious and confident, and can bring a business lens to the technology problems we are trying to solve.  It's a fast paced environment and you'll contribute to our technology strategy, analysis and business case development.
Job Responsibilities:
What you will do
 

Assist the team with facilitating collaborative sessions with diverse business stakeholder groups to drive requirements discovery, impact analysis, identify influencer groups, review and prioritize
Participate in various Agile ceremonies, alongside the Platform/Product Owner
Writing and developing user stories, user acceptance test plan, strategies and leading the overall testing activities for medium to large initiatives
Assist in developing use cases, defining and documenting processes and workflows, and how each class of user interacts with each system function
Build and maintain a repository of reusable requirements documentation to support future initiatives
Working with QE to ensure testing is thoroughly completed and assist the team to manage the fix of defects
Assist the team to provide ongoing requirements/build/testing support to the developers and QA team
Maintain an overall understanding of all changes impacting overall solution of the platform
Required Skills:
What you will bring…
 

Enrolled in an accredited co-op program working towards a degree in Computer Science or Computer Engineering, Business Technology Management or equivalent 
Demonstrate a high degree of self-motivation and tenacity to get the job done
A strong sense to learn new technology, willing to jump in and think outside the box
Possesses strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail and accuracy
Adept in SDLC and different methodologies: Waterfall, Iterative and/or Agile environments, hybrid
Organized with the ability to quickly prioritize and move with agility from one task to another with support from the team
Ability to effectively assist the team facilitating collaborative sessions with large and diverse business stakeholder groups to drive requirements discovery, analysis, and review
High level understanding of API's/Microservices architecture, AWS cloud architecture
Knowledge/understanding of MS Office, SharePoint, Service Now, JIRA and Confluence applications, UML Diagrams: Use case diagrams, Activity Diagrams, Business process Model, and Notation, prototypes, wireframes using Microsoft Visio and Lucid Chart
Excellent communication skills, analytical and problem-solving skills, inquisitive nature and comfort challenging current practices

				MATH - Computer Science

About the Business Unit: 

Rogers is seeking a Data Governance Analyst (Co-Op) to play an active role in shaping the data governance landscape at Rogers. The chosen candidate will be able to work across the enterprise data community, engage with our clients, communicate our processes, and support the adoption of our technology, specifically supporting the development and implementation of our Enterprise Data Governance Tool.
Job Responsibilities:
What you'll do:
 

Work with Enterprise Data Governance leads and Data Stewards to define and instrument metadata capture and storage for the CDE's, evolve our common business glossary, and facilitate the linkage between business terms and the underlying technical metadata
Gather and elicit requirements with specific focus on metadata analysis to develop use and test cases for metadata applications
Identify, understand, articulate and document Critical Data Element (CDE) requirements
Work with business to standardize and formalize CDEs
Assist Data Stewards to identify enterprise data requirements
Required Skills:
Currently enrolled in post-secondary education with a focus on Business, Engineering, Computer Science, Statistics, or related field
Excellent verbal and written communication to effectively communicate with both business and technical development teams
Collaborate cross-functionally with product managers, data analysts, data scientists, business owners, and colleagues to learn from subject-matter experts, present findings in a clear and concise manner, and reach alignment on how to support our metadata strategy.
Comfortable working in a fast-paced, results-oriented environment
An innate intellectual curiosity, and a willingness to build awareness of current telecommunications industry and metadata best practices. 
A mindset of creativity, innovation and energetic drive to succeed
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Business Administration
				
			
				- Theme - Computing: Information Systems 
				
			
				- Theme - Computing: Quality Assurance 
				
			
				- Theme - Data Analytics, Statistical Analysis and Mathematical Optimization 
				
			
				ARTS - Business
				
			
				ENG - Electrical and Computer Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Management Sciences
				
			
				ENG - Software Engineering
				
			
				MATH - Business
				
			
				MATH - Computer Science
				
			
				MATH - Computing and Financial Management
				
			
				MATH - Statistics and Actuarial Science

About the Team / BU:  

Rogers IT, Supplier Management is at the centre of our use & management of suppliers in technology transformation at Rogers.  Driving modern software engineering through cloud native development our teams are engaged in the latest technologies as they deliver new solutions for Rogers. We're looking for someone who loves technology, is curious and confident, and can bring a business lens to the technology problems we are trying to solve.  Our supplier management team works across IT with our strategic suppliers and enables collaborative working between Rogers employees and the expertise of our suppliers.  It's a fast paced environment and you'll contribute to our technology strategy, analysis and business case development.
Job Responsibilities:
What you will do
 

You will create financial analysis models, supplier governance processes, supporting our teams hold suppliers to account, define new IT capabilities and manage supplier risks for Rogers. 
You will conduct research into new technology and the suppliers that have expertise. Create commercial models & processes to help suppliers deliver the innovation Rogers requires.  
You work with teams across IT making sure our suppliers deliver quality, stability, and innovation to Rogers customers.
Required Skills:
What you will bring
 

You are a strong communicator with a commercial and business background.  
You are ready to collaborate with the team to conduct analysis and identify different options.  
You are an awesome team player who will foster creativity and respect the ideas of other team members.
You can balance multiple projects at once with changing priorities and see it through to completion. 
Enrolled in an accredited co-op program working towards a degree in in Applied Science (Electrical Engineering, Computer science preferred), Business or a Financial discipline.
Familiarity with telecommunication industry and operations is highly desirable
Proven analytical, financial modeling and problem-solving skills
Strong communications (written & oral) and interpersonal skills
Strong sense of presence: confident and comfortable working with senior management
Strong time management capabilities, with the ability to perform multiple tasks and objectives
Strong sense of initiative and a self-starter who can work equally well in groups or on their own
Results oriented, flexible and willing to work in a multi-task and dynamic work environment
Comfortable In assembling multiple points of view and finding a common ground
Advanced skills in Excel and PowerPoint

Do you love learning new cutting edge technologies and being part of an innovative team that is at the forefront of the 5G revolution? We are looking for a talented individual to join our exciting team at Rogers Data Networks Engineering! Our team is responsible for the design, architecture, engineering, and end to end deployment of innovative technology solutions for wireless and wireline data services. About the Team:

You will create amazing experiences that bring our brands to life and solve complex problems for our customers using the latest emerging technologies.  

  

This role focuses on the OV Connected Home program within the IT group, empowering our front-line agents with the right tools to easily serve the customers. You will be a key player in designing the DevOps platform for this portfolio, from both the strategy and execution perspective across the Rogers brands. 

  

Our team aims to deliver a seamless sales and service experience to our frontline agents who assist our customers in the Care, Field and Retail settings. The primary focus will be on developing and supporting next-generation solutions delivered to our frontline staff. Possible rotational roles include Development, DevOps, and Systems Analysis.
Job Responsibilities:
What you will do
 

Learn about the cloud solutions and support applications in a DevOps environment from development till deployment of changes into production.
Identify functional and technical requirements based on interactions with the stakeholders and knowledge of the DevOps tools and processes.
Troubleshoot production issues and coordinate with the development team to streamline code deployment.
Implement automation tools and frameworks (CI/CD pipelines).
Support the Release management processes including deployment of changes from staging to production for bi-weekly, hotfix releases, and ad-hoc changes.
Working closely with the Release and Scrum teams, including coordinating with the delivery, and QA teams to plan for upcoming release scope and deployment activities through the DevOps lifecycle.
Document detailed designs and diagrams for new tools, processes, and automation flows including required testing and debugging based on the high-level designs and requirements.
Collaboration: Involves others to leverage additional knowledge or skills that lead to increased understanding.
Initiative: Proactively identifies present and future obstacles, issues, and opportunities. Takes actions to address such obstacles
Innovation: Motivated to improve organizational performance through the introduction of new ideas, methods, processes, products, or services. Develops new ways of looking at a situation.
Oral and Written Communications: Ability to express oneself and communicate with others verbally; it includes tone, style, and structure and the ability to produce a variety of technical and business documents that demonstrate command of the language, organization of thought, and orderliness of presentation.
Required Skills:
What you will bring
 

Enrolled in an accredited co-op program working towards a degree in Computer Science, Mathematics or Computer Engineering or equivalent. 
DevOps including design and development of CI/CD experience in an agile/iterative delivery structure and is viewed as a subject matter expert.
Passionate about learning new technologies, languages, and tools.
Demonstrated analysis, problem-solving, and troubleshooting expertise.
Ability to multi-task and perform effectively.
Strong analytical, problem solving, and decision-making skills to drive software development solutions.
Any CLOUD knowledge or experience is an asset.
A mindset of creativity, innovation, and an energetic drive to succeed.

About the Team: 

We are looking for talented individuals to join our exciting team at Rogers IMS platforms and Services Engineering. This team part of the Voice Network Services Department is accountable for the integration and deployment of platforms to enable services like Voice over LTE, Voice over WiFi and other advanced wireless voice solutions for Rogers customers.  

We are currently seeking network designer interns to work within our IMS Engineering team. Successful candidates will work on initiatives to modernize our wireless voice core network and interconnects with other carriers and will be responsible for the design, implementation and validation activities. You will work closely with IMS engineers who will share their extensive knowledge and support your overall growth.
Job Responsibilities:
What you will do…
 

Assist in design and modernization of new and/or existing Voice Platforms. This will include evaluation of the existing services and call flows using network tracing software in the lab and production environment to guarantee minimum impact to customer as we provide more modern platforms and services. You will get exposure to next generation Voice services and virtualization opportunities for voice functions.
Testing Strategy and Solution Validation
Network Function Lifecycle Management and Evolution
Network function performance and maintenance
Network function Capacity planning and augmentation
Engineering platform design and documentation creation
Automate process to improve efficiency

What you will bring… 
 

Enrolled in an accredited co-op program working towards a degree in Electrical Engineering, Electronic Engineering, Telecommunication Engineering or equivalent 
Passionate about wireless voice services, cellular system principles and two-way land mobile communications
Excellent communication skills with the ability to articulate technical solutions
Knowledge in Voice Signaling protocols (i.e. SIP, SS7) or similar communication call flows
The ability to take direction and report on current status
A mindset of creativity, innovation and energetic drive to succeed

About the Team: 

Do you want to put your problem solving, business and technology skills to the test? Do you want to be a part of a team that will be able to make a difference in how our frontline agents engage with our customers? 


If you have always wanted to work at an entrepreneurial company where the employees are committed to solving big challenges and making a real difference; then join Rogers.  We are a leading communications and media company where people come to do great work. We are looking for individuals who are curious, love digital & technology, and want to be part of the team that will push the customer experience to the next level.
Job Responsibilities:
What you will do

You will be part of the Assisted Channels team building out a product that gives our frontline agents a unified view of our customers. As an Experience Analyst you will be an integral part of the team.  You will be a key player in analysing feedback that comes from our frontline agents through the various channels (our Contact Centre, Retail stores, and Field) and helping to create or improve features to address the feedback. 

  

Responsibilities:
 

Analyze feedback from agents received through the different channels and identify key opportunities to address agent concerns or ideas for improvement
Define user stories that will help improve the product for the agent experience
Work closely with channel stakeholders, user experience, and be part of a Scrum Team and actively participate in sprint ceremonies to provide day-to-day guidance and support to Development and QA
Track and measure efficiency & delivery of all initiatives (impact on business and customer satisfaction) against established targets

Enrolled in an accredited co-op program working towards a degree in Computer Science, Business Administration or equivalent 
Passionate about improving user experiences 
Proven ability to analyze and interpret data to provide insight-driven direction
Ability to map out processes and improve workflows
Excellent communication (written and oral) and presentation skills
A mindset of creativity, innovation and energetic drive to succeed

About the Team:

Channel IT: Our team aims to deliver a seamless sales and service experience to our frontline agents who assist our customers in the Care, Field and Retail settings. The primary focus will be in a DevOps analyst capacity supporting next-generation solutions delivered to our frontline staff. 


Business IT: Supports small/medium businesses and corporate customers by delivering exciting new products leveraging innovative tech such as IOT, 5G and many other next gen services. We deliver using modern software engineering through cloud native development.  

  

We're looking for someone who loves technology, is curious and confident, and can bring a business lens to the technology problems we are trying to solve.  It's a fast paced environment and you'll contribute to our technology strategy, analysis and business case development.
Job Responsibilities:
What you will do
 

You will conduct research into new technology areas. Technical topics of study may include topics such as: Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Cloud Native Development, Customer 360, Order Management, etc.  
You will create strategy documents which include defining a problem statement, completing quantitative and qualitative analysis, and making recommendations.
You will define new DevOps capabilities/processes, create data analysis and models, business cases to support the necessary implementations or change.
You will work with different teams across the organization including enterprise architecture, engineering, and finance and present your research and work.
Required Skills:
What you will bring
 

You are a strong communicator.  
You are ready to collaborate with the team to conduct analysis and identify different options.  
You are an awesome team player who will foster creativity and respect the ideas of other team members.
You can balance multiple projects at once with changing priorities and see it through to completion. 
Currently enrolled in post-secondary education working towards a degree in Applied Science (Electrical Engineering, Computer science preferred) or Business
Familiarity with telecommunication industry and operations is highly desirable
Proven analytical, financial modeling and problem-solving skills
Strong communications (written & oral) and interpersonal skills
Strong sense of presence: confident and comfortable working with senior management
Strong time management capabilities, with the ability to perform multiple tasks and objectives
Strong sense of initiative and a self-starter who can work equally well in groups or on their own
Results oriented, flexible and willing to work in a multi-task and dynamic work environment
Comfortable In assembling multiple points of view and finding a common ground
Advanced skills in Excel and PowerPoint
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Business Administration
				
			
				- Theme - Computing: Hardware
				
			
				- Theme - Computing: Information Systems 
				
			
				- Theme - Computing: Software
				
			
				- Theme - Data Analytics, Statistical Analysis and Mathematical Optimization 
				
			
				ARTS - Business
				
			
				ENG - Electrical and Computer Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Management Sciences
				
			
				ENG - Software Engineering
				
			
				MATH - Computer Science
				
			
				MATH - Statistics and Actuarial Science
Application Documents Required: University of Waterloo Co-op Work History,Résumé,Grade Report

Job Summary:
At Rogers, we connect Canadians to a world of possibilities and the memorable moments that matter most in their lives. Every day we wake up with one purpose in mind. To bring loved ones together from across the globe. To connect people to each other and the world around them. To help an entrepreneur realize their dream. A sports fan celebrate a special moment. 


Because we believe connections unite us, possibilities fuel us, and moments define us. 

  

As we grow our team, the well-being of our team members remains our top priority. To ensure the health and safety of our team members, including those in the recruitment process, our team members are working from home, and are equipped to do so safely and efficiently.  

  

Start your career with a strong foundation and spend your Co-op work term with us! Our Co-op Program gives students the opportunity to be involved in meaningful projects, contribute real work, rewarding opportunities and learn from a diverse group of leaders. We are building for tomorrow and as we plan for the future to make more possible for all Canadians, we believe it starts with Students & New Grads from coast-to-coast-to-coast.  

  

At Rogers, your journey is filled with limitless possibilities; let's make your dream co-op placement possible. 


Together, we'll make more possible, and these six shared values guide and define our work: 
 

Our people are at the heart of our success
Our customers come first. They inspire everything we do
We do what's right, each and every day
We believe in the power of new ideas
We work as one team, with one vision
We give back to our communities and protect our environment

About the Business Unit:  

Tech Hub is at the center of technology transformation at Rogers. Working primarily from our 1 Mount Pleasant or Brampton offices, you will be driving modern software engineering through cloud native development. Our teams are engaged in the latest technologies as they deliver new solutions for Rogers. We're looking for someone who loves technology, is curious and confident, and can work with business to design elegant solutions to difficult problems.
Job Responsibilities:
What you will do:
 

Design and develop TM Forum compatible APIs using modern development practices Enhance and maintain existing solutions bringing in lessons learnt and best practices
Work in a small team with startup mentality to write high quality code
Proactively recommend solutions by comparing advantages and disadvantages of different approaches
Collaborate with the development team, support, and business on day to day development requests and support
Collaborate with multiple teams both upstream and downstream for development and issue resolution
Actively document all activities and participate in peer review for code and documentation
Follow industry best practices in all development activities
Required Skills:
What you will bring
 

Enrolled in an accredited co-op program working towards a degree in Computer Science / Engineering or equivalent 
Hands on experiences with Java and/or Python, with proficiency in at least one
Familiarity with microservices development using the Spring Boot framework
Familiarity with Test Driven Development 
Interest in DevOps principles such as Configuration as Code with tools like Terraform
Flexible and adaptive, team player 
Excellent analytical communication and interpersonal skills

				- Theme - Computing: Software
				
			
				ENG - Electrical and Computer Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Mechanical and Mechatronics Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Software Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Systems Design and Biomedical Engineering
				
			
				MATH - Computer Science

About the Team:  

The Robotic Process Automation (RPA) team designs software Robots to make work faster and more pleasant. We do this by automating the parts of work that are not fun or worth doing manually.  

  

RPA is part of Tech Hub, a team that together is transforming the way we work in Rogers Technology. If you are interested in being part of this change, we want to hear from you!
Job Responsibilities:
What you will do:
 

Participate in the end-to-end implementation of RPA at Rogers
Work closely with business and technical stakeholders to understand requirements
Contribute to automation development by coding in UiPath Studio
Assist with automation testing
Collaborate on production support activities
Connect with business stakeholders; understand and negotiate resolutions to complex issues
Required Skills:
What you will bring
 

Enrolled in an accredited co-op program working towards a degree in Computer Science or equivalent 
1-2 years experience in programming .NET (C#, C++, VB, or PowerShell) and/or RPA software such as UiPath
Passionate about finding ways to automate things that shouldn't need to be done manually
A mindset of creativity, innovation, and energetic drive to succeed

About the Business Unit:  

Rogers is looking for a reliable device certification & life cycle test analyst to works within the engineering department at Rogers. The test analyst's primary focus is the testing and launch of all new customer provided equipment that are leveraged to offer Rogers services. A successful candidate will be familiar with home networking and be detail oriented with the execution of detailed test plans. The coop term will deliver a solid experience in developing, executing, and reporting on complex device features and their identified defects and enhanced troubleshooting skills to identify root causes through analysis.
Job Responsibilities:
What you will do…
 

Development of new test cases for new features and functionality
Execution of detailed/complex device test plans
Reporting, testing, and root cause analysis to management and above
Working with testing peers to coordinate testing activities to ensure efficiencies
Development of testing automation to reduce manual testing efforts
Required Skills:
What you will bring… 
 

Enrolled in an accredited co-op program working towards a diploma or degree in a Computer Science field or equivalent 
Knowledge of home networking and WiFi technologies
Passionate about early adopter technologies 
Works well in a team and is able to collaborate with others 
A mindset of creativity, innovation and energetic drive to succeed
